To make life easy when you visit here's how you order:1) tell the cashier what kind of filling you want and hand over your cold dirty cash2) take the slip the cashier gives you and slide to the left3) give the slip to one of the cute guys behind the counter and THEN and only then tell him what kind of tortilla you want and if you want it to go4) when you get your food douse it with as much salsa, which is readily available on the counter, as you want *if you are taking your food to go there are little cups to carry the salsa in so pack that up while they're making your tacos5) when you get your food and fixins move out of the way! There are no chairs and limited counter space so do what you gotta do and keep it pushin'!
Some of the best tacos you'll ever eat, served rapidly at a counter. That's really all you need to know.

By far, these are the best tacos in all of Nyc. La Esquina and Casa Enrique have better Mexican food, but these tacos are better.They make everything fresh in front of you, and once you do order, it's pretty quick. They make fresh corn and flour tortillas.This is my go to order: Adobada (pastor) tacos on flour tortillas, and carne Assad tacos on corn tortillas. Get everything on them, and chug them down with a fresh horchata or tamarindo.

I've had a lot of tacos in my day, and this place has the best Carne Asada I've ever had. The line is long but so worth it. These tacos are affordable (tacos are around $3.50 each) with fresh made meats and fresh toppings. You would think your grandma just whipped it up. The toppings include: guacamole, onions, cilantro (these three are put on by the chef while the rest is self serve), salsa verde (kind of spicy), red salsa (I didn't have it but it's usually spicier than the verde), fresh cilantro salsa, and limes. I also had a cup of horchata and it was pretty good. Not very sweet, which I was happy about but I know some people prefer it to be sweeter. It certainly helped offset the heat of the salsa verde and the heat of a NYC summer afternoon. Going back as soon as I can for more. Totally recommend.

Kinda hectic but boy oh boy is it tasty! Best tacos I've had! Take your receipt up to the counter and they'll make your tacos in front of you. Fresh salsa and pico were great, but definitely not needed. These tacos can stand alone! Put them in your face!

There are times when that one kiss ruins all future kisses for you, the one book becomes the measure for all books, the one taco becomes the taco, the most amazing taco, that no other taco could compare. I love taquerias. Love them. The seedier, the better. Los tacos may have ruined me for all other future tacos. Seriously. The line was so long, it felt a little ridiculous waiting in such a long line for a 4.00 teensy weensy street taco. But all these people waiting in line? But then you get yours...The giant meat thing they cut from  for the abodaba was freaking amazing. And they put so much stuff on the street taco- tons of meat, guacamole sauce, onions, all the other stuff... Oh. My. It was small but I was full... And I wish I would have savored the moment, bc it was a moment I will relive forever! The best fricken taco I have ever, and I am sure, will ever, eat.

These tacos are top notch, expensive but authentic! The horchata drink is yummy too but I'm not positive that it's authentic. Get the tacos with corn tortillas they are the best. The line is long!!! It moves fast though. After you order and get your tacos you put ur toppings on them at the counter.Finding a seat is hard so be prepared to stand up eating your yummy tacos.
The food here is delicious! My favorite is the "especial", you can order with chicken,beef or pork. It's a fried empanada with cheese. There really isn't a taco there that isn't worth trying.

My favorite tacos in the whole city.  You will wait in line for awhile but they are totally worth it.  Also, there is no seating so I had to give four stars because there is not enough space, but excellent tacos!

If I'd never had tacos in California I might agree that this place is good. But.. both my partner and I agreed that the best part of the tacos we ordered (carne asada, adobada, and chicken) was the corn tortilla. Not all that flavorful and I'd even say that I prefer the tacos/meat at Dos Toros, which has the benefit of tables/a place to sit. Had to wait several minutes to get within sniffing distance of the salsa/garnishes and the whole experience was chaotic and underwhelming. Food looks much better than it tastes.

The BEST tacos in the East Coast.Been here so many times they are always on point. They are starting breakfast.  Cant wait.Enjoy the  Horchata, or any of the other house made drinks great to cool off.
If you are in New York and walking around Chelsea don't think twice go to Chelsea market and get steak quesadilla, it's my favourite taco place in NYC and probably in America... It's just yummmm!

No. 1....hmmmm do they live up to the name?  Decidedly the five star rating suggest that they do...more than that this little taco joint in Chelsea Market actually made Yelp's top 100 places in USA.  I have to agree.  The tacos are daringly authentic- no cheese or sour cream thrown on to impress the Americans.  Just simple, delicious ingredients on a beautifully crafted corn tortilla. It's shall we say... Numero 1.

To my surprise, this place was really crowded and the idea of a taco place inside Chelsea Market seemed odd to me. The place is in the back with the dried fruit stand in the front, it's next to Mokbar and the lines here were diesel but it moves rather quickly. The menu is pretty limited and the prices are a little higher for a taco but it is in the Chelsea Market.The food:Carne Asada Taco- I thought the taco was good, the carne asada had nice flavor and had a good chew. For me, the star of the show was the corn tortilla, I thought the tortilla had an excellent texture and a good mouth feel. My two gripes were the size of the taco and the price. Overall a good taco but no where as authentic as the outer boroughs.

WOW. JUST WOW. I have tried a lot of tacos since I'm from Texas. But by far, this is my ideal taco. I passed this place a couple of times at Chelsea Market and always passed it because of the long lines. But after trying their tacos, I can see why there's always a long line and it's DEFINITELY worth the wait. Everything about their tacos are perfect.THE TORTILLA: My number one complaint about tacos is the tortilla because it always takes over the taste of the filling. But Los Tacos have perfected their tortilla but making it thin but not too thin. It perfectly envelops the fillings and does not take away any taste of the fillings. It is simply a soft counterpart that exemplifies the fillings.THE AVOCADO: Their avocado is so well made that it just melts in your mouth. It's not thick and it's more like a puree. The way it just covers the top of the taco is just beautiful.THE MEATS: pollo, carne, you name it. It's all good. Perfect seasoning, perfect tenderness. You cannot go wrong with their meats.THE VEGETABLES: It's there and it adds a slight crispiness to each bite of the taco. It's not overpowering and adds flavor to each bite. THE SALSA: Whether you like a kick in your taco or not, add the salsa. It's still good without the salsa but the added spiciness just finishes the flavor profile of the taco. This place is a must.
Consistently amazing, one of the best tacos I've had ever. Pork, chicken, beef, all good!! Love their self-serve salsas, radish, chiles, and limes. Always a must-have when i'm in Chelsea.

The most amazing tacos I've ever had! I took a day trip to NYC and went straight to Chelsea Market to get the adobada tacos. I walked around the city after then came back to get the tacos again for dinner. That's how much I love them.

I have had the best tacos of my life here!I ordered the adobado and carne asada tacos, and let me tell you that the Adobado taco was THE BOMB. The ingredients coordinated so well together. Additionally, the meat was so flavorful and just a little bit crispy the way I like it. The only regret I have is that I didn't order more. I was craving to have more as I finished mine, but the line prevented me from buying more haha. So if you are going to be in the line anyways, order to your heart's content. And don't regret it like me. The tacos go well with the Mexican Coke in a bottle. Also you can put as much salsa as you want on your taco.I was expecting this place to be overhyped or just popular due to its location, but man, this place totally exceeded my expectations. And the line is worth it! The price is worth it!Only complaint is that... so where do I eat my tacos? It's hard to find seatings before your tacos get soggy. So plan ahead.
Best tacos probably in Manhattan. I havent had better ones yet. Get the quesadilla - which is basically a taco with cheese on it.

The adobada taco here is my favorite taco anywhere in NYC. My previous favorites were in Bushwick, Sunset Park and Queens, but inconsistency, a fire, and the fact that nobody wants to go to Queens has left Los Tacos No. 1's adobada in sole possession of first place. Let me give you some advice:Anytime you are at a restaurant and there is meat that they will carve off a spit and serve you, you should get it. Immediately after seeing the spit, I wanted to get two adobada tacos. But in the interest of variety, I got one adobada and one carne asada. HUGE MISTAKE. (Your first instinct is always right, people.*)While the carne asada and the pollo asada are both excellent (seriously, fantastic tacos in their own right), pork is always the right decision. Really, I'm betting anything you get on a fresh corn tortilla** will probably be good here...but any space the inferior meats of beef and chicken take up in your stomach is space you cannot fill with the crispy, fatty, juicy explosion of flavor that is the adobada. I've always known these marinated pork and pineapple flavors as al pastor, but whatever you want to call it, it's ridiculously delicious and all I can think about is going back for more._____________*Even if it tells you to slap that 250 lb. man for his insolence. **I can't abide a crappy, grainy, cold, corn tortilla (I'd actually rather have flour), but Los Tacos No. 1 does corn tortillas right.

Come here every once in awhile and it never disappoints the horchata is perfect especially when you put more spice on your tacos....I always get the corn tortilla I can't with flour ones...it won't cut it. There is always a line but if you have time def stop by you won't regret it!

See, I can't give tacos 5 stars because it's really hard to mess tacos up BUT I was strongly considering giving this 5 stars. The wait is a little long but it moves fast and make sure you to keep track of your receipt because my order got switched with someone else's. Do yourself a favor and get the flour tortilla though. I know, I know, the corn one will probably have more flavor (this is what I thought) but the flour one is cooked with lard or something and is 100% more delicious than the corn!

The tacos at this place are amazing. This has to be the number one taco spot in new York. I got the pork tacos and added the spicy tomatoes.The only thing is that the place is very small and there are no seats.

The tacos were very good (tried all for available), unfortunately I can't say they're good enough for me to plan to return to Chelsea market any time soon. That place is just annoying because of how hectic it is and I believe the tacos are more expensive because of this location.They should really consider opening another location.Also I would say that the vegetarian taco (with cactus) was the least good option. This is something you see in many places that don't specialize in vegetarian food, their vegetarian option trends to be planned less well. I wouldn't take a vegetarian friend here, specifically.
Waited in an enormous line during holiday break, but the queso taco shells and the nopal filling were worth it! Would like to come back when it's not crazy busy.

That shit was so good. Made right in front of you. If I could've order 100 tacos I would've, but I'm only fat so no me gusta. The carne asada tacos were so woke that Jesus came down and blessed it with their homemade guac himself. I wanted to hug the woman who was making the tortillas. God Bless her heart.

Tacos are a little ok the pricey side. But boy are these bad boys delicious. Mouth watering meat on a freshly made corn tortilla. Everything complimented each other. I see a lot of reviews saying to try the cheese taco shell. Will definitely try that the next time I visit. I asked if they had water cups and they told me they did. The lady pointed at where they should be but they were no where to be found. Searched for a small duration and ended up asking another worker again only to be ignored. Overall the food was fantastic and I would definitely come back for more!

I struggled a bit with this review. Let me first off start by saying it really is a pity I can only give this place three stars. Taste, I would go with a five. Experience, way less.To begin, yes the line is long, but it's pretty worth it and it goes by fairly quickly. It gets a little crowded at the end because you have to get your receipt and​ ​hand it​ ​personally to the chef so they can make your order.​​ Of course, since it's in the Chelsea Market, there's nowhere to really sit.The prices are a little steep for a little taco (~$3.75), but it's packed with great flavor! The way they season their chicken and steak and the fact that they make their own tortillas from scratch right the makes a huge difference.I got the steak taco with a corn tortilla and my boyfriend got a steak taco and a chicken taco with a corn tortilla along with a steak quesadilla (FYI the quesadilla is just a taco with cheese in it​ - odd​). Overall, the food was really good. The best taco I've had in NYC (the steak one). I'm from the West Coast and haven't been able to find a decent Mexican Taco in NYC. This has definitely been the best so far.The reason I am only giving them 3 stars is because I had asked three times if there was any dairy in the taco and I was assured there was not. They mentioned the guac in the cactus taco did, but that was it. So, I got my steak taco and devoured it. Needless to say, I had one of the worst nights of my life a couple hours later. I am lactose intolerant, if I had an allergy the situation would have been much worse. For this reason, unfortunately, I cannot give them 5 stars. ​Especially when it comes to dietary restrictions, your staff should be educated and not make faulty mistakes like that.​Other than that, I would highly recommend this place. Tacos are delicious. I, however, am extremely disappointed with my experience and ​would ​caution anyone with a food sensitivity to maybe think twice, just in case.

I seem to always find myself here whilst gallivanting around the meatpacking district. This is the perfect place to stop at if you're going to a booze fest at Milk Studios or Highline Stages and aren't sure if food will be served (and the backdoors at Chelsea Market are adjacent to these venues, haha). The quality and price of the tacos is unmatched in the neighborhood and it is one of the cheaper eateries in the market ($3.50 - $4.75 per taco). Everything on the menu is good; take your pick. I am preferential to the pollo asado because the chicken is perfectly marinated. The carne asado (grilled steak) and adobada (marinated pork) are fantastic, too. The later comes with strips of pineapple creating a piquant sweet & spicy contrast with the pork. Two tacos are enough to leave you satiated, but I certainly attempt a third on many occasions. I alternate between the flour and corn tacos but if you want a more authentic experience go with the corn.There are a number of toppings you can add to your tacos, but try not to go overboard; the food is already well seasoned. A splash of lime should be sufficient. Wash the tacos down with a glass of horchata or tamarind juice. The former is great if you want something to neutralize the tacos if you went crazy with the chili peppers and/or other spicy toppings.

I'm from California so I have had my share of some pretty dank ass tacos. Decided to come here cause I was seriously craving some tacos & OMG. SO. GOOD. I got the adobada on CORN tortilla. GET THE CORN TORTILLA!! Seriously. So delicious. -1 star just cause this place is all the way across the country from me -_- *sigh*

Outstanding adobado tacos, served with a rich, savory sauce, not unlike pulled pork. Very tender, no gristle. The menu is very limited, there's a long line and the only "seating" is stand-up counters. But worth the pain.

Oh. My. God. I don't even know how to convey the ridiculous deliciousness of these tacos. I never bothered coming here because it's a freaking taco stand inside Chelsea Market. I mean, who would think this would be something worthy of my precious time and stomach space in all of the great city of New York? I've got so many better options, right? No. Wrong. THIS is what you spend your time on. wow. WOW. W.O.W. Carne asada - seriously, best in my life. And I've been to Mexico several times. And I live in California. I know tacos. I'm eating here every time I come back to NY. I love you, Los Tacos No. 1
Food - 5 starsService - 3/4 starsThe line was very long, but it moved quickly. Lots of chaos after ordering to actually give the order ticket to the "cook". Cluttered. But worth the hassle!

The Tacos are...amazing! I was upset that they don't have carnitas, but that disappointment was easily appeased by the Adobanda - marinares Pork and those amazing hand made tortillas (get the corn tortillas), made right on the spot. It's like you can put anything in them and those tortillas will make it Silver platter worthy! Excellent!My only knock is...ain't no frick'n place to sit, and sometimes there's barely any standing room! That being said I'll be back again and again! AMAZING!

I Whent to tacosn1 because I see celebrity  singer thalia go there the food look Soo goodThen I have vacations  to ny  I try the tacos ,de adobada y carne asada,tostada and Mula very good homemade tortillas flour or corn Viva mexicoooooI love the music too

Holy TACO.  If you're like me and love Mexican tacos this is the place to stop at.  There tacos are so fresh yoy stand and watch them cook the meat and add toppings. You can pick from flour or corn tortillas. And then you add some toppings yourself as well. The hot sause is pretty hot but I loved it. Stop here for even one taco as an appetizer, you won't regret it !

The hype? It's all true. All of it. Everything is incredible. So flavoursome. My only gripe is I wanna sit down and eat more of them but as it's standing only with essentially nowhere to even lean or perch on it's almost impossible to order enough. However go. It's worth the standing.
there is a reason why the ratings are so good.The food is amazing- the best tacos I ever had!The workers are super hustlers-- they are all like energizer bunnies!!

LOVE these tacos. Adobada all the way. Quick assembly line style taco joint with typical fun trendy branding with awesome fresh choose-your-own toppings in huge molcajetes. Wish it was cheaper but they probably pay Chelsea Market rent and it's so good I don't even care.

I've had tacos far & wide, but these are easily some of the best tacos I've ever had.The flavor, the authenticity & the love is there. The only flaw at all is that everything is a little rushed due to the amount of people coming for food at once, but once you make it, you understand completely.My best advice is you get your fill, try different things, and don't be afraid of cilantro. Pick up a few tacos & one if there juices, you won't be disappointed.

You've probably heard everyone say this but this place is authentic as fuck. Its that one place on the side of the street (in doors), so tiny yet so irresistible. Always order the corn tortilla + carne asada because that's the only way to do it.

Best tacos in the city! The pork tacos are to die for. The only negative is the staff can be a little rude if you don't speak Spanish. I've been called cabron on multiple occasions. They didn't know I knew what they were saying

Inventive, delicious tacos? Check.Quick, easy and cheap? Check. $3.50 for a mouthwatering grilled chicken/marinated pork tacos? Check. Generous toppings and guac on just about everything? Check and mate!5 stars for the no. 1 taco joint in the city!

I'd say the tacos here are probably the best in the city. I love how the meat was cooked on a spit and nice and crispy.  Fresh rolled tortillas are awesome as well. Just find a spot in the Chelsea Market and eat.  The tacos aren't too big, so make sure you order a few of them.

These are decent tacos, but certainly not worth the price. I had the carne asada and the nopal, paired with a tamarindo aguafresca. Granted, the tacos automatically come loaded with guac and all the fixins, but it was too much for me. I'm used to my tacos coming with onions, cilantro and lime, and I don't want to pay more than $2 for them.This is most certainly not the best taco in Manhattan, but I'll let it slide if it means everyone else stays away from my taco spots uptown!

This place is crackin'!! There's usually a line, but it's so worth it. The ingredients are fresh and they definitely don't skimp. Presentation is also quality. Can't say enough good things about here.
Amazing place . I saw it on Insider and I definitely  wanted to try. I traveled all the way from LI to Chelsea market and I must say it was so worth it .

After seeing this being advertised by websites and bloggers alike I felt overwhelmed to try it. We got to the market only to find ourselves in nearly an hour line for tacos. I ordered the abobada tacos one on corn and one on the secret menu queso shell. I enjoyed both but I must admit that the cheese shell was a little over the top. After ordering you get to watch your tacos be made and oh boy is it impressive. They whip those things out. I would definitely go again and I recommend it to anyone who likes Mexican food!!

As mentioned in my, by now legendary review of Chelsea Market, Los Tacos are home to my favorite tacos in nyc. You'd be surprised how often places ruin the ostensibly simple "taco" but every factor that makes up the perfect taco is calibrated here beyond reproach. The meat is seasoned impeccably, just at the upper edge of maximum piquancy and the accompanying vegetables, salsa and guacamole are indisputably of higher quality than other tacos I've had in the area. Some may think I've over-hyped the place to unreasonable expectations, but I think its entirely warranted and so will you after you come down here.

I love this place.. These are the best tacos you will find; the ingredients are so fresh. It's pricey, but worth the splurge. The adobada quesadilla is my favorite. So flavorful and I love the salsa bar. All tacos need fresh tomatoes and onions, and a bit of heat. The best corn tortilla I've ever had. The texture and flavor of these tortillas are fantastic. I wish I could buy them! I actually don't like the taste of corn tortillas, but that's probably because they're not freshly made. You don't get these flavors from those "authentic Mexican places." They usually put two grainy, dry tortillas with chewy meat and no salsa, with a bland guacamole sauce. The only issue I have, is that you have to stand to eat these tacos. These tacos can be a lil messy. I hope they expand.. I'd love to sit down and see just a few additions to their menu. What they do now is perfect, but imagine fish tacos on their menu...

I've been wanting to try this place for a while, since they have a bajillion ratings. The tacos here are pretty good. One of the best you may find in lower Manhattan. However, they are grossly expensive (what isn't in Chelsea Market?). I had all the tacos (chicken, steak, pork, cactus) and a pork quesadilla split with my boyfriend. Not enough food for the both of us. I think the pork taco is the best. I am not really a fan of the cactus, and the chicken was just alright. The steak comes at a distant second. The corn tortilla is fine, but I usually prefer it more corn-y. But maybe that's just me. Also, first timers. Please note that you should give your receipt to the guys behind the counter otherwise you will never get your food!

The carne asada was one of the best taco's I've had.  Not only was it great quality (and a reasonable price), but they had bowls of limes and tomatoes to add to your liking.  Only downside - it closes at 9pm

I stopped by Los Tacos No. 1 while checking out Chelsea Market and the High Line.  The tacos sounded pretty good so we had to try a couple.  There was a bit of a line even in the middle of the afternoon, but after a short wait we were able to put in our orders.We got the Adobada and Nopal tacos.  The tacos were great - both had plenty of toppings and the flavors were delicious.  I hadn't tried a cactus taco before, but after trying Los Tacos' version I'm probably getting another one the next time I get the chance.  And I really liked the spices on the Adobada, though my mouth was burning by the time I got to the end of the taco.  The tacos here aren't exactly the cheapest, but tacos this good are well worth the price.  Oh, and one final note: the salsa bar is pretty cool, but a warning - unless you really like your food spicy, stick with the mild salsa, just a taste of the medium one was more than enough for me.

Some pretty darn good tacos they hv. I had steak and pork-- and I loved the steak! It's full of ingredients although the price may be a little high. Steak taco is $3.75 per piece I believe. They also hv special non-alcohol drinks too but I didn't try them. Good Mexican soda collections too-- different flavors of fanta.The only real downside is that it's in Chelsea market full of tourists, the line is insanely long- about 25min wait to place an order.

Seriously good tacos, the carne asada and adobado are winners (on corn tortillas). The line is almost always long but def worth it. Oh and you'll have to elbow people out of the way to get salsas and such in front of the crowded pickup area.

Probably some of the BEST tacos in NYC. Will there be a line to wait for some of the best tacos in NYC? Yes. Will it be worth it? Yes. Will I want to go back for more? YES!It has been a while since I've been to Los Tacos No. 1, but man, what an incredible experience it was dining here. It is pretty much a taco stand set-up (with a long line leading up to it), so prepare to stand and eat as seating is limited. Every single taco option was beyond delicious, and the tostadas were also the bomb. Every single item on the menu is super flavorful and the portions are just right. If you enjoy jarritos they have those here, as well. Great location in Chelsea Market, great service, and great food. This place is a must!

We stopped here for lunch on recommendation from Yelp's Top 100 of 2015 list and had an enjoyable lunch.Décor: There really isn't much to this place as it is in the "food court" of Chelsea Market. It's literally just a walk-up-and-order place, there are no tables so good luck finding a place to eat. The line can get really long, so try to get there before the lunch rush starts or you'll be waiting for a bit. However, they do move the line along at a decent clip so don't worry too much. They prepare everything right out in front of you as you wait so there is nothing to hide, and everything looks very clean and appetizing.Bathroom: In Chelsea Market, yes. Clean, inviting, but a line can also easily develop here as well.Staff: The cashier, and also food prep people, move the line along pretty well. They are all friendly and are more than willing to help you with your order if you're not a regular (which 99% of the visitors are NOT).Food: We ran the gamut of their tacos, trying each one. I would not recommend the cactus one, but the rest of them are very tasty and very enjoyable. Honestly, you can't go wrong with your choice, just pick something you like (I think the beef was the best though...)Value: It's a popular place because the food is great, but the prices won't put you in the poor house either.This is a cool little taco spot that I'd come back to again - however I'd make sure to arrive early because the line we waited in was just a bit too long (of a wait).

After hearing several people rave about this place, I had to try it! As a pescatarian, I was slightly disappointed that there were no other options for me (in tacos) other than the nopal (cactus) but since I'd never had it before, I was game. For $4, I got one taco served open on a small plate with everything on it. While they were generous with the cactus, I found it to be too slimey and got tired of it fast. I think it lacked flavor and the texture was just meh. The guac was really good though and I wish they had put more. The cilantro was also the right amount and not overpowering, something a lot of mexican rests overdo.  I like the serve your self station where you can add mild, medium, spicy, or lime to your tacos (the spicy was great) and the large selection of sodas. However, I only wish they had more options, such as fish or potatoes. I would've loved to come back but the nopal tacos are just not for me.

Hands down the best tacos!! I come here twice a week at least. That's how much I love this place!!The long line can be scary, but it's totally worth it and it moves fast. My secret is to come on week nights. My recommendations:1. Especial - fried quesadilla, so yum.2. Queso taco - fried cheese taco shell, drop the mic! Get it with carne asada. Trust me. 3. Adobada - marinated pork with pineapple. Yes. And then finish it off with the horchata or jamaica and chips & guac and you're good to go. They also have a ton of sodas to choose from. I'm hungry. I want tacos.

Alright. I'm jumping on the fan bus. Buses aren't even my thang, I'm a subway girl, but Los Tacos No. 1 is most definitely an exception. I've been dying to come and try Los Tacos as all I kept hearing was "these are the BEST tacos," plus I couldn't help but realize that my Instagram page for some odd reason always seemed to feature their picture perfect tacos in their conical-like serving style, topped with only the most beautiful silky looking guac I ever did lay my eyes on. If Instagram could make cones look so good, well sign me up then!I must say I was skeptical of Los Tacos and thought it would all be hype. People in the past have told me Ottos Tacos was the best, or Taqueria Diana in the LES-- I fell victim to their strong opinions and tried the places myself but was utterly disappointed with both--their tacos were somewhat bland, meat was dry, and corn tortillas were too thick. Alas. Los Tacos entered my life and ended my mistrust in finding good tacos. One bite and I'm telling you--they truly were THE BEST TACOS. Chicken was moist and perfectly charred, all the toppings (onions, cilantro, 2 types of salsa, and guac--uhh free guac with no extra charging is unheard of!!) married so well. If only my marriage will be that good... Best part yet was that the corn tortilla was so fricken' fresh and not too thick or thin. I saw those women behind the counter making them by hand and boy did I wish I was them so I could take the credit for them tortillas.I'm not even a taco girl but like I said earlier about buses... Los Tacos is most definitely an exception.

BEST TACO I'VE EVER HAD!!!!! Only reason it's not 5 stars is seating. You order then have to stand to eat. It's inside of the Chelsea market and in my opinion this is the best food option there. We had the carne asada taco and it was great. Only a few dollars as well so you can't beat it.

This is THE number one taqueria in NYC.  Truly authentic delicious Mexican street food . I'm not from the area but I come up often and every time I do I must make a stop to get me the adobada and nopales. Also love love the jamaica . This is real Mexican tacos and reminds me of Tijuana style tacos . And all my friends that visit from the mother land always say the guys at los tacos no. 1 got it down ! Definitely go you will love it
THE BEST TACOS I HAVE HAD IN MY LIFE. this is how a real taco suppose to taste. LOVED this place I am obsessed.

We came here for a quick lunch before an afternoon on the high line. The line alone should tip you off to the fact that this is a place to be tried. Order at the counter, bring your ticket to the cooks and they make your taco or quesadilla to order.  Don't forget to give that ticket to the cook because it really holds the line up if you're new and don't know the flow. Once you give them your ticket, your order will be up within minutes!No where to sit really so be prepared to eat on the go or standing in the corner. That was fine for us because the food was so delicious it only lasted 5 minutes! Great, affordable lunch on the go when you're in Chelsea.

I wish I could say this place is overrated because I hate waiting in the long line for a couple tacos, but I cannot lie... this is my favorite taco place in NYC (and maybe anywhere). These tacos are so yummy that my mouth is watering just writing this review. The tender meat, the salsa choices, and the way the tacos are folded to make them easier to eat are just a few reasons that I thank my lucky stars that I have found a place like Los Tacos No 1. It is truly my numero uno.

Best tacos in NYC? I can see that. Deep within the recesses of Chelsea Market, you'll find a steaming counter in the distance, way at the end of a very, very long line. The masses line up for these scrumptious vittles, and I did, too. Said line goes pretty quickly and if you're not ready with your order at the end of it, be prepared for some looks, fella -- these patrons are for real. Word on the street is the adobada is the way to goo, but if you're allergic to pineapple (like me) or don't eat pork (like my buddy), you're still covered: the pollo asado is truly delectable, what with it's exceptional mix of spices and smoke from the grill. The carne is equally as good, but the pollo has a leg-up on texture. Add a squeeze of lime, a heaping spoon full of salsa fresca and you're golden, friend. Choose from corn or flour tortilla, and if you want cheese, order a quesadilla -- there' the same size as the tacos, but include melted choose courtesy of grilling over a wood-burning flame. In all honest, I've not had tacos this excellent outside of California. They're the real deal. Paired with one of their full-on sugar Mexican sodas, and you'll forget you're in a super-gentrified area of NYC. Just don't expect to relax. This isa munching-whilst-standing establishment, so come with a bib and your patience, too.

Went here last night to meet up with my Sister; it was also my first time at Chelsea Market! So many delicious things! We decided on Los Tacos No. 1 because I had seen it recommended on quite a few cheap but great eats in NYC and the food held up to the reviews! Yum! We both had one pork taco- it was amazing and the steak quesadilla (not quite what you are used to) but they used super fresh ingredients. The spicy salsa was AWESOME! The chips and guac were also very tasty. I left full and felt like it was a pretty good deal. Really friendly staff- they provided recommendations and checked in on our experience throughout; they also hooked us up with a free order of chips and guac since we were still eating when they were closing down. It was also nice to see them deep cleaning their kitchen at the end of the night! As someone who used to work in F&B, I love a clean kitchen! TIP: they don't sell alcohol but the wine bar (Corked?) next door has to-go cups for a buck extra if you are a craving a drink with your meal.
Great food..long lines...no seating. Workers move fast but there's usually still a bit of a wait

Whenever people ask me on recommendations on Tacos I either steer them towards Five Tacos or here at Los Tacos No.1. Truly, they are probably some of the best if not a top contender for the 1st and 2nd ranking in the taco world in NYC.But I think after last night's binge tasting I think they might be just be tied at 2nd place with 1st still open for the taking.  SERVICE : Was close to being on point. The lady cashier expedited orders with ease and even though there wasn't a line waiting we all ordered, paid and moved on to the food side of things rather quickly.  The 2nd part of the service was just as quick which is great BUT when I asked for extra onions and was given practically 3 little cubes of it due to the food assembler rushing through to get the tacos stuffed, I feel the service took a slight step backwards here. As much as you should be expediting food, listening should be just as important. There wasn't a line so the whole rushing thing I didn't really understand. It was also NOT Lunch time, happy hour, nor was it a dinner rush.  You close in an hour. Slow down homie. And even if there were the speed that this guy was scooping, stuffing, and wrapping made it seem like he was trying to finish the order to go use the restroom. He could have just said something. I would have gladly waited.FOOD: This was also close to being on point. I ordered 4 different taco(s) Nopal (Cactus), Adobada (Spicy Pork), Pollo Asada (Grilled Chicken), Carne Asada (Grilled Steak).  The cactus tacos was WAAAYYYY off the mark. I don't even know how to describe it. It just didn't taste right.  The spicy pork was good but I felt it was lacking a certain kick to it. The chicken and the steak was the stars which came through on both flavor and expectation. The tacos are also on the smaller size very similar to Otto's except here they offer you the choose of corn or flour for your taco shell.AMBIANCE: This space is kind of a clusterfukc. The storefront is actually a health nut store. Across from it is MokBar which is a Korean noodle soup which offers seating & happy hour. Then you have Los Tacos No.1 to the far right which offers no seating whatsoever. I hate to imagine what happens when the health nuts store gets busy during a lunch rush for MokBar and the a taco rush for that same lunch crowd. 8 words. YOU DON'T WANT TO BE THERE FOR THAT. Even if Los Tacos No.1 offered seats, they would have no place to put it. If I was going to get tacos on the go, I'd go to a taco truck.PRICE: The price is on the higher side partially due to the location of Chelsea Market, partially to there wide fan base, partially to Yelp and then partially because New Yorkers are willing to pay as much. They are priced competitively to those of Otto's & Five Tacos so I guess for better quality in Manhattan you need to fork out more cash for quality tacos.Overall: I would say they are at a 4 star for me but more like 3.5 stars after that cactus tacos. REALLY GUYS, FIX IT.FAN.

Seriously probably the best tacos I've had ever. No frills, nothing fancy, just plain good food!This food stand in Chelsea Market is absolutely amazing. The line can be long at times, but is so worth the wait.They ask you what kind of tortilla you want, flour or corn (I usually choose corn), and then fill it with all types of goodness. It depends what you're into, but literally every type of taco is absolutely amazing. You can't go wrong.I usually get the chicken, but the carnitas is always a fan favorite. Only downside to this spot on taco joint is the lack of seating. But when they're this good, who even has time to sit... you just want to scarf them down.Upside, great tacos for not too much dinero!Ole!

Best tacos I ever had.  All the taco places in my hometown of Seattle would be a two star or less if they were compared to this place.  I had two of the pork tacos and one of the steak, all three with the queso shell.  Try the queso shell!

Really delicious tacos! I usually like California fish or shrimp tacos but this is easily my favorite pork taco! It is so flavorful and juicy. Must be the rotisserie style roasting. I don't know what the secret is but so so good. I do prefer the adobada pork for sure over the beef. And the house made corn tortillas! Beware the salsa/sauce tho, medium just kicks you in the face. It's so spicy but oh so good at the same time. I don't think I can go to Chelsea market without having one. Try it! Or don't, more for me! Trust me you'll be missing out if you don't!
Exceptionally good tacos. I actually recommend that you don't get the queso taco though. It's just too much savory on top of savory flavor (i.e. Too much of a good thing).

Went here last night with a friend after reading rave reviews and I was not disappointed! The pork is out of this world! Quesadillas are great as well. I love the selection of salsas they have out as well. Already planning my return!

Yelpers got it right.  My husband and I went here a few days ago and he was hesitent because the name of the restaurant wasnt really original.  Yes there was a long line as mentioned in other reviews.  Despite the long line they did not sacrifce quality nor friendly customer service.  The tacos were so good
This place was great I tried the chicken and the steak. I can't wait to get back for some more. As well as trying their seafood taco spot!

Best tacos I've had on the east coast that taste like Californian tacos! The line is always long but definitely worth it. The pork tacos are to die for, as are the carne asada. You can choose corn or flour tortillas that they make from scratch right before they're cooked. The quesadilla is also very good but it is not a classic quesadilla--more like a taco with melted cheese.

Liked the tacos. Mild sauce was spicier than expected but loved it. This is what mild should be! However, didn't really get to enjoy it because there was no seating. The bar area is also for pick up so you have people shoving in to get their orders, to grab Salsa and limes and also trying to eat. Too hectic and not worth the trouble. Would only return if there's no one there, or there's a better system/seating.

I am a self-proclaimed taco junkie. I could, and often do, eat some form of Mexican food everyday. This place is so good, I am contemplating paying the $2,000 or whatever for UberEats to pick me up some Los Tacos No. 1.The tacos here are amazeballs. I'm talking greatest taco I've ever had and probably ever will. Everything is super fresh, from the meat they hand carve in front of you, to the salsa and guac. They are quick, clean, insane multi-taskers, and have diehard fans. The dude next to us went on and on about how good they were for several minutes, and literally showed us how to "properly" fill the taco. A woman by us fully agreed! Turns out, they weren't lying :)Bottom line: if you like tacos, you have GOT to go here.

I'm really picky when it comes to tacos. I found this place by mistake. Was going to the seafood market next door. Ended up seeing a line and figured I need to try it . You can choose corn or flour tortilla,Awesome choices of the meats. Not fats or skimpy meat. Tender and juicy .Free Guac on your taco and lime.  Hot sauce is la carteClean and honestly have to say best Mexican taco spot in NYC for sure.

I admittedly don't have much experience with genuine tacos. I've only heard about how great it is in the West Side, Arizona, Texas and even some parts in Queens. However, I do know good food and Los Tacos #1 is where it's at. The food is so fresh, so flavorful and so cheap. It's the best tacos I've ever eaten. The menu is simple. Chicken, beef, tacos or quesadillas. Simple yet perfect and they do it so well. I'm already addicted. Mild, medium and hot salsa on the side. Choose between flour or corn tortillas and add radish and lime for your choosing. If you're a fan of Mexican, you must come here for some genuine tacos.
Love, love, love this place! The one taco place that keeps me coming back for more. Worth the wait. Amazing flavors and cooked to perfection.GET THIS TACO. You will not be disappointed.

Legit tacos in Chelsea Market!! The line was long, but it was definitely worth it. Once you order, you get a ticket and you hand it to the guys behind the bar so they can fill your order. The tacos were sooo good!! And the salsa bar is awesome!! It's made fresh and the meat quality is outstanding. It's pricey, but you get what you pay for here.

The tacos are amazing. It is very crowded but the line goes by pretty quickly. It is the best tacos that I have had in NYC and it each bite is packed with flavor. It is nested inside of chelsea market and there is always a long line for it and no seating area. During the summer, it is great to order some tacocs and head over to the high line after. The tacos are amazing and definitely a must try!

By far my favorite taco joint in NYC. I've gone back time and time again because it's too good and I'm a creature of habit. I recommend the Carne Asada Mulas or Tacos. Load up on everything, including the guac, and you won't be disappointed. If you see a long line, don't fret and just hop on. The lines tend to move fast so there's nothing to worry about. Seating on the other hand doesn't exist, but with some scoping it's not impossible to find somewhere to eat. Or you can just eat while standing with no table or anything. Annoying? Yes. Doable? Yes. Yummy? Always.For our first Valentine's Day my boyfriend surprised me at my apartment with 2 of every taco on the menu. Romantic? Hell yes. Was I happy? No doubt. Yummy? Always.So there you have it -- run to Chelsea Market right now and get some grub from Los Tacos No.1You won't regret it.

Tried them all and loved the pork and chicken the most, and normally carne asada is my fave. The guy working the register today made the situation more confusing than it needed to be and was poor at communicating that you move over and hand off your ticket, so it was mass confusion, and the guy taking the tickets was having to yell at everyone to get them in line. He was fantastic at his job & keeping up with everyone's orders...I was thoroughly impressed with his brain cause it was chaos and I was stressed just being a customer. Overall delicious experience. Glad to have quality tacos in NY!

One of the best taco that I've had in NYC. Don't get me wrong there are plenty of other taquerias in NYC that serve much more authentic and better food than this one.This place is unique, the mold, press, and cook their own tortilla to order. So every taco that you order is a handmade tortilla. What's even better, the tortilla itself has an amazing texture and flavor. I'm guessing it's because they use lard :)If you order al pastor, the cook will take a fresh tortilla soak it on the grease from the al pastor and slice the meat on the tortilla. They offer three different type of salsas, they're all delicious and have different level of heat.Unfortunately, they don't have lengua, cecina or any other specialty meats that a normal authentic taqueria would have. My favorite is the al pastor, it's so good!

Wow.dont know where to start . Yum yum yum, The carne tacos are delicious, Love it with a sangria Beautiful spotSuper busy and hard to find a place to eat the tacos when they are packed but the atmosphere was awesome, love the set up, got ice cream right after so convinentFound it on yelp recommend it on yelp

Great tacos!!!! It's hard to find a place to sit and things move quickly. The tacos are worth the price. You get two tacos per order the carne asada tacos were amazing!!!!! Giving it 4 stars due to the difficulty of finding seating but overall worth it!
Delicious pork tacos tucked away in the bustling Chelsea Market. Perfect cheap eats definitely worth waiting for!

So after getting gelato from L'Arte Del Gelato, we came here for dinner since we were watching on what we were spending. We ended up getting three tacos, carne asada and marinated pork. We also got horchata cause I really really like it. There's not much sit down to eat but we found a standing table to eat at. It was good too so we weren't too comfortable to not want to leave. We were on a schedule! The show will start without us if we were late!! But definitely drop by if you're tight on money! The condiments and stuff are on the side after you order your food. Grab napkins cause eating will get messy!

I'm from Austin where the tacos are some of the best you can find. Also been to San Diego a bunch but these tacos rank right up there with the best I've had. Get the quesadilla if you want cheese in your taco (it's not like a normal quesadilla you're used to. Just a taco with cheese). The steak is my favorite meat there. The special was good too but pretty rich since the tortilla is fried.
Wow. The Best tacos of my life. I wish I could eat 10000000 of them. The guacamole and chips are also really good.

Those adobada tacos (marinated pork) are the BEST TACOS I HAVE EVER EATEN. The service is madd fastt which is good because lines can get prettty long and crowded fast. However go easy on the spicy salsa that you can get yourself. It is spicy affffffffff. But tacos for 3.50 each and they give guacamole with none of tht extra price bs yess please...

Wonderful tacos at great prices. The portions don't look big but they will fill you up. If you're a pork lover, you'll want anything with the adobada (marinated pork). It's charred and tender at the same time. Marvelously seasoned. The pork tacos ($3.50 apiece) are smaller than the pork quesadillas ($4.50). One of each would be very filling. Or else, get two tacos to make a meal. There's a nice array of condiments that you can load up on yourself, including cut radishes, a mild tomato salsa, and spicier sauces. The corn tacos seem to be handmade, as are the flour tortillas.If you're avoiding carbs, try the nopal plate ($5), which is grilled cactus with beans and cheese. You can add meat for $1. The cactus is interesting -- chops up like a green pepper but a little slimy, like okra. I liked it!The $4 guac and chips seemed small but went surprisingly far. We were a group of four and probably should've placed two orders. Still, the guac was delicious and so were the chips. For non-alcoholic drinks $3.50), the homemade Jamaica had a sort of hibiscus tea taste to it. The horchata was okay. Both were on the thin, watery side, with a lot of ice in the cup. Lines can be long but they move fast. There's no place to sit. So if you have several in your party, get some to grab one of the public tables in the main corridor.
I wish i could give more than 5 stars ! Small place with great service and delicious food! Love spots like this one!
Best tacos I have ever had in my life! EVER!!The horchata is also great.Always go for the pork, ALWAYS!Definitely worth a trip to 9th ave.

Good, not great. 3.5 stars.I got a steak taco, pork taco, and the cactus taco. I appreciated the honesty of the cashier when I asked her if the cactus taco was a popular item. She said not unless they are vegetarian. I appreciated her honesty but ordered it anyway because I was curious what it'd be like. It tastes like mild green beans. The taco had almost no flavor and I'm someone who likes my tacos with a lot of kick. The steak taco was ok - I didn't actually order it - I ordered chicken but was sitting too far down the fall in Chelsea Market when I noticed the mistake and didn't go back to exchange it. I don't care for steak so naturally I didn't particularly care for this taco. The pork taco is the reason I give it 3.5 stars. It was very good. Far from the best taco I have ever had but very good nonetheless. One thing I really liked about this place is that you add the salsa and lemon and radish to your taco yourself - guaranteeing that you are going to get the exact amount of heat you are looking for because you add it yourself. Also, beware there is zero sitting space. I'd go back again if a friend wanted to and we were nearby but would not go out of my way to come back here.

Oh my! Did not expect them to actually be No 1. I'm pretty new to the taco game here coming from a non-Mexican influenced country, but I've been enjoying tacos all over NY, CA, AZ, UT, NV in the last month, and I gotta say this was the best I've had in terms of filling. Cons: - The sauce was a bit watery though, and caused the wrap to prematurely go soggy. Have some napkins handy when devouring this amazing thing. - Pricey. Wasn't able to get anywhere near full for the price. They're not huge so it's only good as a quick snack. Pros:- The freshest most flavoursome tacos I've had in my life. We got the Abodaba and Pollos which were both good but we both favoured the Abodaba more.
Absolutely delicious especially their mini special quesadillas. I recommend this place and will definitely come back when I go to NY!

Dear Los Tacos - please take my order in full (like what kind of tortilla I want) when I place my order.Please also understand that most of your customers are not going to speak spanish - so some explanations / translations on your menu would be helpful!NOTE: the tacos / items are TINY - so a 3 taco order is about right for lunch.  You may want to add another for dinner.The taste is great, once I received my food - but they aren't very well set up for 'to go' orders (again, translating!)

I must go back and try everything. visited yesterday and fell in love. pork taco was ok, yet meat was a little tough. that steak corn tortilla taco?absolute perfection.Chelsea Market rocks, and this place makes it rock even more. a MUST visit.

VERY busy on Saturdays- the price is expensive for what you get but that's basically NYC for you. There'll probably be a line but it moves very quickly. I got the Carne Asada quesadilla and it was open-faced. Almost the same portion as a taco but the meat was so juicy and flavorful, it really defined the food. The condiments also work really well with the flavors and all in all, it's a good place to go if you want a quick bite to eat. A major downside is that there is no seating and Chelsea Market is very crowded so you most likely will be standing up while eating.

Bottom line: if you haven't yet been to Los Tacos No.1 in Chelsea Market... you're missing out big time. By far the most delicious, mouth-watering, authentic tacos in New York. At least in my limited experience! Affordable, too! YUM YUM YUM IN MY TUM TUM!A bit hard to find, nestle din the back of a mini-market inside of Chelsea Market, along 14th street, but only accessible from the inside of the market. Go here, and I guarantee you will NOT be disappointed!
Best tacos in NYC hands down! Epic and so good. High quality ingredients, best taste.

Came here on Labor Day weekend at about noon. Got lucky and the line wasn't too long. I ordered one beef (asada) one chicken (pollo) and one pork (adobada). I got them with "everything" which included cilantro and onion and some type of salsa (which was quite spicy btw). The verdict? The chicken and beef were both excellent. Muy sabroso. But the pork was beyond words. It was one of the best pork tacos I've ever had. I lived in Mexico for two years and that taco was worthy of being called "Hecho en Mexico".

My bar for Mexican food is held really high. This place looked pretty legit but it was just okay. I ordered an adobada taco. The corn tortilla was good and the whole taco was flavorful. But the taco was too salty for me!

One of my favorite Mexican spots in NY, if not the favorite. I usually get an assortment of tacos and they are all equally awesome and full of juicy Mexican flavors.I know this spot is in the touristy Chelsea Market but Los Tacos No.1 is anything but touristy, just bomb ass Mexican food. So good that I think even Donald Trump would it, or maybe not.

I LOVE this place. I've been here a few times over the past 3 or 4 years, and it's literally the only place I visit for a meal at Chelsea Market. I have only ever ordered the Pollo Asado quesadilla and the Pollo Asado taco, as I generally don't eat a lot of other meat. I've gotten them on corn or flour tortillas at different times, both great. Usually one quesadilla and one taco, and that is satisfying enough to me for a meal where I don't want to eat to the point of being stuffed.They are packed with mini chunks of meat, even though they're a bit small overall. Succulent, juicy, wonderfully marinated meat! I get them without guacamole and they are still pretty decadent to me. All the cilantro hits me in just the right way. They have three different salsas to choose from on the counter to add yourself after the food is prepared- a mild, which is basically pico de gallo, a medium, which is tangy and green and perfectly spicy to me, and there's a more brownish colored hot sauce, which I haven't tried. They also have a plentiful supply of fresh lime wedges, radishes, and dried chiles de arbol to choose from on the counter. I highly recommend squeezing lime all over your tacos and quesadillas! The whole experience is just an explosion of flavor, definitely inspiring a bit of quasi (if not full-on)-orgasmic moaning. I thought I remember there being a few more small general seating tables in the vicinity of Los Tacos, but I think they may have been removed (or moved elsewhere), and now many tables are attached to certain other food establishments in the Market. When I went last night, a friend of mine got food from the place across the way which sells burgers and whatnot, so we sat at the relatively spacious tables in there. I never really spend over $10 when I go here, but getting a little more food and a drink will definitely take you over to the $10-20 range of spending.
Seriously, so yummy! I had a pork taco with everything on it and my husband tried the carne asada quesadilla. We loved it and can't wait to go back for more! Quick, Fresh and Fast!

There is always a long line here. But it's totally worth the wait! Everything is made fresh right before your eyes. I can't begin to explain how delicious my carne asada taco was. To die for. We came here twice in 3 days
Omg.   Great tacos in NYC. Who'd a thought.  Could not stop eating the asada tacos.   The quesadilla my kid raved about for several days.  Eat here.    Little to no seating but it's worth it.

I thought I'd never find great #MexicanFood in NYC. Boy I was wrong! @lostacos1 makes California-style tacos tasted just like home. They make it really good. It was mind blowing good! The meat was deliciously juicy and the ingredients were totally fresh. The corn tortilla was fluffy and the seasonings were perfect! Last but not least, they accept credit cards (but no Amex)! The overall experience was dope!If the food is great and the vibe is cool, I wouldn't mind the wait and price. Los Tacos No. 1 makes me a happy person! I'm think I'm already in love :-)
I prefer their sister Los mariscos because this spot just has meat. Good cheap eats but not a lot of options to pick from

This. Place. Is. So. Good. Listen to all of the reviews - this is as good as it gets. I've had tacos all the time from Big Star in Chicago and in southern California and in Mexico City. Nothing beats an amazingly tasty soft taco with perfectly spiced meat. We got the chicken and pork tacos and the meat was perfectly charred (because I love burnt chewy bits!) and seasoned. I would have stayed at the counter for hours but I had another place to be. It is a little confusing at first, but order at the counter and then weasel your way through the people busy eating their tacos at the counter and hand your receipt to one of the guys behind the counter cooking the delicious food and tell them your tortilla preference (flour or corn). Your taco will be out in just a few minutes. I can't wait for next time!

Best tacos I've ever had, and I've had A LOT of tacos. In fact, probably the best meal we had in NYC, and we tried many different places at many different price points. The tacos were so good we walked to the Times Square location the next day to try it out. It was just as good!
Best tacos in Manhattan. Get the pork, a dab of green sauce, and it's on. Used to take them to highline to eat but last couple times didn't make it that far.

Really nice Tacos, we don't usually eat casual meals, but this was definitely a treat!. Our friends swear that these are the best tacos in town; for us they were very tasty, but I would not compare them to a great meal at Le Bernardin, Vaucluse or Jean Georges. There isn't really a place to sit down to eat, and the line can be overwhelming... but it's nice to... mingle with friends. ***we interrupt for a champagne break ahead for the next hour***

Just yum! We got two pollo tacos and two nopal tacos. I also loved that we could help ourselves to the three different types of salsas, limes, radishes, etc. Definitely a good place to bring friends who are visiting from out of state too since it is in Chelsea Market.

All that walking on the nearby High Line park had me day-dreaming about a lip-smacking, spicy taco and I had pre-picked this spot based on Yelp reviews, to wit, "Best Tacos in New York City!"Located INSIDE the Chelsea Market, a revamped former industrial warehouse, you'll need to find the back corner where this stall is located across from a Korean Rahmen noodle place.  There was a short line to order. The stall has no seating and sadly, not much room for standing either.  (I enviously eyed the diners wedged on bar stools around the Rahmen shop.) You order, pay, then hand your ticket to the prep cooks who beckon you helpfully.  They ask you whether you prefer corn/flour tortillas and what toppings you would like. I got the adobada tacos on corn tortillas, with all toppings (that includes a squirt of guacamole).  Yes to the vertical meat spit with slowly roasting pork!  With plate of tacos in hand you have to navigate their counter for salsas (a range of mild, medium and spicy), lemon wedges, and radishes.  Very authentic.  However, very difficult to access, because due to aforementioned lack of space, there are all kinds of people with their back to you, their plates set right in front of the salsa bowls, eating.  Hence short of shoving them aside, it's regrettably annoying to try to garnish your delicious and juicy tacos.Having little other choice, I too wedged in my little plate on the corner of a counter and noshed on these quite delicious tacos.  I thoroughly enjoyed them. The balance of meat with crunchy, zesty, liquidy acoutrements is perfect.  It's the authentic Mexican style!You just have to cope with the the New York City square footage and crowds.  I would enjoy this place better were there some bar tables to set my plate down, so I could breathe easier while eating.

Wow!!! Had great Father's Day dinner, the tacos  and cultural ambiance was impeccable!!! Thank you so much, Juan (the taco maker), for the outstanding service for our first time!. It was 12 of us and there was not one complaint on the tacos! I personally had the tacos al pastor and all the favors on it blended perfectly! Amazing time and great tacos.

This little gem is right in the heart of Chelsea Market! I've always heard amazing things about their tacos and now got to experience its wonders firsthand. I ordered two tacos - carne asada and adobada. Both of them were tender, succulent and extremely flavorful. I'm definitely a taco girl and these take the number one spot. I also tried their guacamole which was yummy and they also have a bunch of salsas you can try out and add onto your tacos. Each of them was equally delicious. I can't wait to go back and try out more items on their menu. Definitely give this place a try. You won't regret it!

Hands Down the best Tacos I've ever had in my life. Fast service, they are freshly made, the spices are amazing, and everything blends together. I had the carne asada, pork, and chicken and they were all amazing. I will definitely go back here again.

Great place for quick fresh food. I got two pork tacos with everything on them. The pork was spot on, and they have salsas, limes, and pico on the side if you want it. The four stars is because there is so much sauce and juices and that it was a crazy mess, and the meat and tortilla seem to get lost in it. Overall great place, just very messy.

I had the cactus and pollo asado tacos on a corn tortilla. The tacos have a very authentic taste but what is even better is that salsa that you can add on after! The salsas are all super fresh but the spicy salsa is where it is at. Definitely go ahead and try that -- it gives a great kick! I enjoyed the tacos (two with all the fillings was enough) but I do not think they are the best tacos I have had. They are great but nothing too stellar! Cute decor and very efficient handling of the line -- it move along quickly! Overall -- great place to grab lunch/dinner for and affordable price and great flavors!

Great place- was going to Chelsea Market so decided to give it a go. My thoughts:1) Chicken tacos- great, very flavorful2) Beef tacos - also pretty amazing, the meat was delicious3) Pork quesadilla - a lot of flavor but may have bit a bit too much for me with the cheese, preferred the tacos. Got corn tortilla for all and that was very good4) Cactus plate with beans - good, but didn't wow me, tad on the bland sideOverall I would ago back there again if I was in Chelsea market - too bad they don't really have a place to sit down but for a fast pace restaurant that is expected.
The best tacos in nyc. Believe me, I ate a lot of tacos in everywhere and that place is the best.
Best tacos I ever had!!! Everything here is delicious  is worth the wait. They have Mexican culture drinks so good. You have to come and try a couple because one wont be enough. A+

Great tacos. Tried all 3 meat types- Beef (Carne Asada), Pork (Abodaba), and Chicken (Pollo). Beef the best, then Pork, then Chicken. They're small tacos, but they fill them up pretty well. You'll need 3 to fill you up.Don't forget to stop off and add or pick up some salsas!

"We are not in Tijuana anymore...." BUT I thought I was!  Who would have known that the best tacos to touch my pallet/mouth/tongue would be in New York?  Really?  Not even what I consider "the best" tacos in California can come close to the tacos I had here, ESPECIALLYYYY the adobada (we know it as al pastor) tacos... my goodness gracious!  It is a song in your mouth, the meats are so tender, so well seasoned, and the tortilla, the tortilla -- is handmade ladies and gentlemen, yes HANDMADE!!!  The toppings are delicious and your tacos come wrapped individually in a piece of paper, just like the ones in Tijuana!  I could have swore I crossed the border somewhere, but didn't remember!   These guys are ON it the line is a mile long, but it keeps moving steadily and accurately, before you know it, you too, will be placing an order of the best tacos you will EVER have, so order two or more!  Your time and money will be worth every second/penny!  Do NOT give up or you will regret it!Not recommended: the horchata.

I've been here 3-4 times and it's my favorite taco place in the city! The lines are pretty long most of the times and the bar area where you hand over your receipt and wait can be pretty hectic with the nonstop crowding (at least on the weekend). Props to the workers for keeping track of who ordered from which receipt though. We ordered 3 types of tacos, 4 carne asada, 4 adobada, and 2 pollo tacos and they gave us each set of tacos in individual batches amongst the crowd waiting. Among the 3 kinds, I liked the carne asada (steak) tacos the best. Adobada came a close 2nd as it's nicely roasted pork topped with some pineapple pieces! It's a bit salty but the pineapple balanced it out. The chicken one was pretty good, but not amazing. If you consider price per taco then it's kinda pricey at $3.50-3.75 each but they do give quite a decent amount of meat! I spent $40 there for 10 tacos after tax. Worth it? To satisfy my craving for los tacos, yes! If I became a more frequent customer, probably not for that price tag. FYI, it might be hard to hear, but when you hand over the receipt, they typically ask if you want corn or flour tortillas. The corn tortilla can sometimes be dry and flakey so I personally prefer the flour ones.
Their tacos and quesadillas are amazing and they are very cheap. You can also add your own sauce and condiments. Beware of the long line!
GUAC is yummy AF nopal taco was weird but delicious. I didn't know u could even eat cactus but I tried it. This place has rockin flavor.
We order lunch for office on Fridays, and Los Tacos No.1 is my favorite.

After having the Adobada Taco, I can see now why people really like this place. The flavor was salty and intense. It actually tastes somewhat like Cha Shao (叉燒) , the Chinese BBQ pork. Out of the ones I've tried so far (Carne Asada, Nopal, Adobada), the Adobada is closest to how good the tacos are in the Southwest. They have really good soft and fresh corn tortillas and salsa. Only thing I dislike is their guacamole. I prefer the chunky kind over the pureed kind.
Best tacos in NYC. Period. They are authentic, simple and use quality ingredients. My favorite is the nopal taco and the horchata water.

Actually, I was starving when saw this place. I love Mexican food, and without any doubts came in and...fell in love! The price is right, the portions are big (chefs are really generous with the ingredients). My food came out super fast - it was delicious! The most I loved salsa (green medium, I guess...) - it was spicy and flavorful.I have left a five-star review and want to add that from this moment won't go anywhere else for tacos in NYC now!

Possibly one of the best taco joints I've been to in a long long time. It was an amazing experience.Starting with the meat:The carne asada was perfectly seasoned and grilled to perfection. Tender and juicy. Like the narrow habitable zone where the earth is localized in relation to the sun... This carne asada hit that "just right" goldilocks dank zone.The corn tortillas are hand made right there. The rest of the ingredients just meld together into the best 3.75 + tax you've ever spent on anything ever. They have a couple housemade salsas that are bomb as well.Horchata was aight, but that didn't matter because the tacos made up for every mistake I've made in my life.
Hands down, BEST tacos in ALL of NYC...yea, that's right, I said it. Every New Yorker knows this. Just go here, and you'll see.

Just the best tacos in all of Manhattan. New York City has many great cuisines and Mexican is not one of them... Especially Mexican street food. Los Tacos No1 is delicious. You have to pace yourself... The location is a mess as its in Chelsea markets.. A combo of local and tourist.. It's literally street food. You order. You pay. You give your ticket to a cooker. You stand in front of a make believe taco truck. You pick up and you eat. That's it. Nothing fancy.Nothing Fancy but oh so delicious. I had Nopal for the first time and now it's every time. Nopal is cactus.. And absolutely delicious.Highly recommend.

The best tacos you can get in NYC. Everything here is off the charts good. All authentic takes on Mexican, all fresh, all good. Big down side here is there is no seating  the tacos are so good you will want to sit down and enjoy them. You can take a walk through the market to find seating but I do wish there was at little some seating there. I would recommend something...but you cant miss here (except maybe the cactus. I didnt like it)

These are the best tacos in the United States and dont f**k with me on that statement. Ive had far too many amazing food experiences (especially street tacos) to just hand out the title of "best" without any rapport.First things first, everybody thinks flour tortilla is just some simple flour/water concoction but that's not true. Flour tortillas usually have a fat in them, and Los Tacos #1 isn't afraid to admit that there is lard in them. Im sure off other reviews you've heard that everything is made to order -- tortillas are pressed, meat is shaved off a rotisserie/grill, and then you choose what toppings you'd like. But it's not the customization that makes this restaurant earn its 5 stars, it's the sheer quality of the finished product. Yes, you do have to go all the way to chelsea market and deal with tourists. And yes there is a ramen shop and a lobster bar within 25 feet of Los Tacos No. 1, but if you can resist these alternatives, and just release your inner mexicano, you'lll surely enjoy these tacos. Los Tacos IS No.1

Tried the carne asada taco and the chicken quesadilla. Both were great, the carne asada slightly more flavorful than the chicken but nevertheless they were both delicious. The guac on both items was great, you could taste the lime and that's how I like my guac. The only negative is the lack of seating, but still worth it!
The carne asada was the best taco I've ever had. Not even close. And I've eaten a lot of tacos. I just wish I lived in Manhattan. I'd be here every week.

Best tacos in NYC. So good. Just the right spice. This place is always packed and difficult to find a place to eat. If you walk further down the Chelsea Market you can find tables outside of the restaurants to eat the tacos. When you enjoy the tacos look around to see what others are also eating. If you see others eating the tacos ask them if they like it. They will reply "the tacos are delicious".

Wow, these tacos really are No. 1. They're also Los, too.You must try these, especially if you are one of those that always complains about how there is no good Mexican food in New York. These tacos are seriously delicious.There will be a line - but just wait. You will be tempted to take a step to the left to try Hybird, since you've probably read some of the inexplicable good press for it, and since there is nobody on line and there is a much shorter wait.But instead of throwing away $2 on a drumstick, spend $3 here for one of the best tacos you'll ever taste. That will get you the Adobada Taco, which has some of the juiciest, most tasty marinated pork you could ever hope for. You should also get the Carne Asada ($3.50), which has some equally delicious grilled steak and some super flavorful sauce slathered on top.You also get to choose either a corn or flour tortilla for the taco. I tried one of each and they were both delicious.I could have easily eaten ten more of these tacos in a row. Two of them are satisfying, but just not enough because they are so good they leave you wanting so many more. This is definitely one of the top choices now for a great quick bite in the already crowded and excellent Chelsea Market.

The only thing I enjoy in the god-forsaken wasteland that is Chelsea Market is Los Tacos No 1.  This Mexican shop should be your number one stop for food in that shopping center hell hole. The fresh off the grill tacos, albeit small, packs a wallop of flavor. The asada (beef) and adobada (pork) are the best of the bunch and could compete with any taco stand out there. Cilantro and onions are all that is needed for toppings.

It was some pretty good tacos, but I'm not so sure about all the 4 and 5 star raves. The tacos were legit and they had plenty of toppings and sauce for you to add yourself as well as freshly cut lime slices. This location at chelsea market invited LONG LONG lines (not sure if it was worth the wait). You choose between corn or flour tortilla and I think corn is a better choice. Then you choose a meat. I got steak and chicken, but I heard actually pork is better. It was average and maybe slightly above. I saw someone else order a "secret item" called a quesa-taco which was not on the menu. It was like a taco-empanada kind of thing. Would definitely go try THAT next time and write back about it. Other than that, I really didn't think the tacos were all that. Or maybe it's just my particular taste since everyone else on yelp seems to rave about it!

Really enjoyed adobado taco, little pineapple in the top, Delicious! I had tamartindo, it was Good. big line, but it moved fast, music too loud. no place to sit, it was really bad, no even place to be standing.

WOW! worth the line up and crowds and having nowhere to eat your taco ( try to go on a weekday) because this was simply the best Mexican takeout we have ever had outside of Mexico.  Hands down the best taco I have ever eaten and the best salsas I have ever had. There is a tendency with "cool" taco places to make especially the vegetarian tacos over fried, overly rich with tons of cheese and even ugh mayo. This place was incredibly fresh and light and thus so tasty. will be back over and over

Woaah. These tacos were some of the best I've ever had. Probably only below Tacos El Gordo in Vegas. I got the Carne Asada and Adobado, as mentioned by my fellow Yelpers. These were excellent choices. The service was quick and very efficient (not super courteous.)Both types of tacos I had came with crispy meat and fresh vegetables and salsa. They give you the choice of flour or corn tortillas (I opted for flour.) While both tacos were an excellent experience, I have to favor the Adobado. The pork had and insanely tender interior while still maintaining an intense crisp. The freshness of the salsa perfectly complimented the meat. As for portions, they are small tacos as any street taco. Get three if you're hungry. It's surprising how good and authentic this place is for being in the uppity Chelsea Market, but somehow they pull it off. Well done!
This place has the best tacos in time the only thing is that there is no seating available. Line is long at some hours of the day but its with the wait! Service is fast and the tacos are amazing

The only reason why I did not give his place 5 stars is because no alcohol and no seating! Other then that great prices . The tacos are slamming !! I mean excellent ! I got 2 chicken tacos and one steak. With chips and salsa ! Excellent !

deducting a star for lack of seating, but otherwise Los Tacos is great. it's moderately spicy even without add-ons, but that's not something I mind. I'm a vegetarian, so I had a nopal taco. cactus is one of my favorite vegetables--definitely worth a try if you've never had it. at Los Tacos, they cook their nopales with spices :) my meat-eating friends enjoyed their chicken and steak options, too.Los Tacos has a simple menu done well. it's not a steal because it's portions are small, but won't break the bank either. definitely worth a visit, even for a vegetarian like me. just take caution because the wheat tortillas are cooked with lard.I'm a fan :)

Straight up 5 star no doubt!
