It was funny how I never even plan to visit this place.  Was just walking around Chelsea with the wife, waiting for her sister and brother in-law to come.  While I was there,I turned on Yelp and BEHOLD Los Tacos No.1 just POPPED up in my face!Los Tacos No.1 is inside the Chelsea Market, it's easy to miss but if you look for a storefront where they sell spices or the big BIENVENIDOS sign, it's just right inside there!I came on a Saturday morning at around 10:30am and the place wasn't open yet.  I didn't want to look like a jack ass standing around waiting for the store to open so I play it cool by pretend to look at spices at the first store while looking at Yelp for some good recommendation.Once 11am hits, guess who was the first on line to get their tacos like a BOSS?Their menu is pretty simple, 3 types of meat (chicken, pork, steak) and a cactus.  My first go (yes there was more than 1 go) was 2 Carne Asada and 1 adobado but  I stupidly ordered it with flour tortilla while the whole timeIi'm looking at this lady behind the counter pumping out fresh corn tortillas... felt so stupid but at least I got my food.  Took 1 bite out of the adobado and I discovered what true love is (don't tell my wife I said that jk)The adobado was so juicy, tender and flavorful, they event add a slice of sweet pineapple to balance out the adobado, top it off salsa and guacamole and you have a mighty fine taco... you better have a bib with you while you eat this though because that juice will flow and burst onto your shirt like it did with mine but that's okay, nothing beats a good pork flavor cologne!! The Carne Asada was a little less flavorful than the Adobado but still very well made.  It was cooked perfectly so it didn't taste like rubber and the guacamole definitely added a layer of depth to it but I still like the adobado better!TIP: Be very careful with their salsa, I can handle my spice but even the medium salsa was spicy enough to get me to plow through my horchata (BTW the horchata is a MUST TRY!! so smooth so rich and so cinnamon-y)Because my first go wasn't enough, I went back again and this time got myself 3 adobado with corn tortillas and another horchata to wash it all down.  The corn tortillas was amazing! it's a lot more filling than the flour tortilla but it was nice and fluffy.  awesome chewy texture and best of all, it soaks up all the juices from the adobado.  YUM!!!!Price: $3.5 for the Adobado and $3.75 for the Carne asada- WORTH!Overall: Can't go wrong with freshly made corn tortillas, the adobado= to die for... just make sure you go early to avoid the long line and go with an empty stomach!!!

The Secret of Los Tacos Numero Uno is that your tacos or quesadillas are made from fresh, raw ingredients to finished perfection in a matter of minutes. They make your tortillas fresh, by hand, to order (choice of corn or flour). After ordering at the cash register, they yell to the cooks how many tortillas to prepare. You then take your receipt to the person who prepares your order to your liking. Don't want onion? No problem, he or she puts everything together right in front of you. This place is truly deserving of a full 5 yelp stars. Bonus points for: novelty bottled sodas, reasonable prices, whole chipotle peppers in the garnish bar.

I wasn't really looking for food, just looking around. Actually I walked away at first but said "ok, tacos sound fine."  And dam they were awesome! Tried one pollo, one adobado and fell off my chair. My wife didn't care for the texture of her cactus. But I freakin dreamed of mine for days after.

Slightly hidden inside the Chelsea Market. You actually have to go inside the big spice shop to access this place. I passed by it once with all the rest of the bollixed tourists before I figured it out.Carne Asada tacos are the way to go. The meat was tender and flavorful. The corn tortillas were excellent. They put on a good amount of sauces, including a runny guac, which complimented the meat. You don't really need any additional sauces but they are available if you want them. As it is, it's difficult to eat these delicious tacos cleanly. You'll most probably need a fork to scoop up the remnants from your plate. Also tried the adobada. Didn't love it. Very similar to an Al Pastor*, it needs good quality pineapple (aka juicy) to break down the meat. Maybe the pineapple wasn't juicy enough but I needed more flavor, more succulence, more pop in my mouth.  It wasn't bad to be fair but probably wouldn't come back here for this again. But dang that corn tortilla was so good. Also, I love saying adobada. It's one of the coolest words out there. ADOBAAAADAAAAA. See what I mean?*I was later informed that adobada is just a regional variety of the al pastor.

Everything I could ever ask for in a tacos place.I will walk a mile in order to eat good food. I will walk five miles in order to get good tacos. I will walk to Chelsea Market any day of the week in order to get THESE tacos. It really is everything I could ask for in a taco shop. The taco choices are simple: chicken, steak, pork, and cactus if you're weird. They give you a choice of corn or flour tortillas, and they have JAMAICA, HORCHATA, TAMARINDO juice, which, if you've spent any time in mexico or latin america, means you will come to this place again and again just for that. My only complaints are that it is a little pricey, and they definitely definitely definitely should use two tortillas per taco. That is EXPECTED with good tacos. Even with that, I had no regrets eating here.

oh my god, what did I just eat and where has this been in all my life?The Especial quesadilla, people. I repeat, THE ESPECIAL QUESADILLA. How do I describe thee? A fried quesadilla that tastes almost like a cheese empanada with their green sauce and other toppings (onions, cilantro and salasa from their add-your-own salsa bar). You can add meat if you want to the especial, but this flaky fried piece of perfect will taste great no matter what. I also got the Horchata. So refreshing and cinnamony. Everything here is so cheap, it makes me wanna cry.I can't wait to go back to this little shop in Chelsea Market and get another Especial and try more!
Great soft tacos! The ordering and pick-up process can get a bit hectic and disorganized, but tacos are worth the hassle.

Los Tacos No 1 lives up to its name. These are definitely some of the best tacos I've had. I opted for the steak and cactus tacos with flour tortillas, but you cannot go wrong with any of the options. Everything is fresh and hot. I also had some horchata. Like the tacos, this was some of the best horchata I've had.The service is super fast even when busy. You'll have your tacos in under 150 seconds.Note, there is a $5 minimum for cards and tacos cost under $4 per taco.

My favorite tacos in NYC so far! Usually I'll try a places tacos and be satisfied enough to finish the meal but don't usually want to go back. This place is different. My cousin and I stumbled upon it on a whim when we were hungry and decided to give it a shot.  Both the chicken and steak tacos are yummy as are their sauces. The line was quite long, but these guys work fast. I highly recommend it!
Had two flour carne asada tacos with everything and it was everything. That meat was so good.

Good chicken tacos and guacamole. This cute place is tucked into the middle of Chelsea Market, had a bit of a time finding the location. Ordered from counter and had to stand and eat at the counter.  A good place from tacos but the quesadilla I ordered looked like a taco.  The price was reasonable and bottled Coke was a nice treat.

The line is insane and there is no where to really sit and enjoy and the staff is pretty rude and crabby. So I took a star. That being said the food is authentic and incredible. The pico is rediculously free and the gauc is amazing. If you don't mind trying to find an open spot to enjoy and waiting this food is great
Incredible tacos. Go next door to Los Mariscos to enjoy your meal in a laid back atmosphere with some Mexican alcohol.

Delicious tacos. The carne adobada was seasoned to perfection. Carne asada mulita was yummy and the quesadilla was on point. Tamarind water was good / refreshing and not too sweet. We'll be back to try the nopal plate.

We had to stop in after spotting the recommendation on Travel & Leisure article. Los Tacos ranked as Top 25 place for tacos in the US. The especial quesadilla with carne asada is the family favorite, a fried taco that gets stuffed with steak, guacamole, cheese, onions, and cilantro. The chicken tacos were great as well, but being a first timer when asked if we wanted everything on top we just said 'yes' not knowing that included a spicy salsa. The salsa or sauce made it too spicy for the kids unfortunately.

We were in line at Chelsea Market to buy some spices.  Along side of our line was another line and it was moving fast in the opposite direction.  Curious to see what the line could be for, I figured out quickly it was for Los Tacos No.1.  A quick YELP check showed that people loved their tacos!  After finishing up at the spice counter we immediately joined the taco line.  The line moved fast and soon I was ordering a pork taco and a chicken taco.  You order, pay, and they give you a receipt.  You move over to the taco builders and hand them your receipt.  They ask if you want corn or flour tortillas and give you several additional options like cilantro, onion, etc.  A few minutes later, tacos are in your hand!!!  The one downside is that there is no seating nearby so we milled around the counter and ate our tacos.  The pork one had a spicy kick and the chicken was flavorful.  The tacos are small but inexpensive.  I would go back and have a couple of the pork tacos because they tasted amazing and pork is my favorite!

Overall, the line is too long and unpleasant, and the tacos are good but not out of this world. I'm not sure if there is an "off" time, but every time I've been in Chelsea market there are at least 25 people waiting on line, and about 10 or so waiting at the pick-up. If you can get someone else to pick them up for you, then go for it, if not, there are plenty of more pleasant places to get a decent taco in New York. The tacos are pretty good - but I'm still not sure what all the fuss is about considering that you have to wait in line getting elbowed for about 45 minutes - and then you can stand and eat getting elbowed for 5 more minutes.
Unreal tacos. Best I've ever had. Service is fast and the guys making your table are super friendly and accommodating. Would highly recommend

Best. Tacos. Ever. I cannot emphasize this enough. Let me lay this down for you; If Jesus (The son of God, not some guy with a sweet name from Mexico) could operate a grill and build tacos, he'd likely work here. These tacos are heavenly and will baptize your mouth with flavor. I recommend the Steak or Pork. Either way, it'll be the best damn decision you make this month.

Came here with a homie on a Saturday afternoon after hearing scathing reviews from two of my friends (they're obsessed). It was packed, but the line moves fast. Food: Authentic. I've had authentic tacos before out of the country and even some legit ones here in Long Island (shoutout to Nellys in Hicksville). I ordered the Carne Asada, Pollo, and adobada, on corn tortillas. Corn tortilla had great consistency, not flaky or hard. Regarding the carne asada and the adobada, the thing to note is that the meat is marinated very well. The flavor is deeeeep. As expected, the meat was also very tender, not very fatty either, the chew was nice. My friend also suggested the pollo, which I thought was alright: Chicken was not dry, and very flavorful. My only gripe would be that the tacos had a little too much going on; with the guac (they give a lot), in addition to the lime, pico, and salsa you may add, the flavors just don't come together too well. The bite is tasty, but not specific. You just get a lot of everything, and it tastes good, but if you don't have a sharp palate, you're just gonna taste a whole lot of flavors (again, not a bad thing). Seating: Nonexistent. Chelsea Market is poppin' with tourists, so don't expect to find much seating around the area when its packed. Me and my friend ate on the little ledge where the food comes out, where they have the salsas, lime wedges, etc. I think the one thing I didn't enjoy about this place is that it isn't inviting necessarily inviting for a conversational meal. If you have a sudden craving for tacos and you wanna get your fix and bounce, this a great spot. But because people are reaching over your shoulder, pushing you aside to get some salsa, and there really is nowhere else to go, you can't really enjoy the meal to the full. This atmosphere creates a sense of urgency that makes you feel like you need to rush and be out, like you're being obnoxious almost just standing there trying to eat. So my suggestion would be to get your food, and find a place to sit and eat, even stand in a corner somewhere where people aren't getting up in your personal space. Pricing: At $3.75 a taco, its a bit steep. The pricing is only fair because there aren't many places where you can tacos this authentic. But if you can find somewhere close to authentic with a lower price tag, I'd pass on this place. Conclusion: If you want the experience, and you're just craving tacos in general, drop by and get a taco or two. They're flavorful, and they'll satisfy your craving. But if you're looking for an economic, conversational go-to spot, keep looking. It's worth the visit, but not your subscription.

I came all the way from Utah to try these tacos and they did not disappoint! Make sure you go and eat here. I got a carne asada taco and a pork taco. They have great flavors the right amount of spice and a Tangy flavor.
Most amazing tacos! Tried out Pollo asada and Carne asada, really yummy and flavorful.
Yup yup yup yup - these tacos win! Pressed at the moment corn tortillas filled with super fresh ingredients and succulent meat, all made with such a ferocious speed.Winner.
First time in Chelsea Market and stopped at the gem! Great place to grab a quick taco! Lots of flavor, and fast service. Definitely a neat place if you're feeling Mexican food!

Los Tacos No.1 is the steadfast culmination of hype, convenience, and the use of quality ingredients for taco variety not commonly seen in these parts. The rise to stardom is somewhat impressive, considering there isn't a lot of seating and the menu isn't particularly big. There is a gringo contingent at work here, but the question remains: Are the tacos good? And the answer is yes. A big fat, yes.Folks who are seeking to explore the Tijuana / Southern California (Hola, San Ysidro!) style really need look no further. Tacos come in either asada (beef), pollo (chicken), adobada (pork), or nopal (cactus-vegetarian). The option of flour vs corn will come up and one should *always* choose corn. The difference is staggering compared to the regular flour tortillas and the juice soaks it all up so much better.The other thing that makes me excited about Los Tacos No.1 is the mere fact they offer adobada. Most of the Pueblan style taquerias around NYC will offer a similar variant in al pastor, but the seasoning on this marinated pork is definitely stronger. Northern style Mexican food just is a rarity in these parts and I love the fact they've continued to serve it via a rotisserie spit. Just thinking about it makes me hungry.If the tiny tacos don't curb the appetite, perhaps a large version in the quesadilla will. The meats are still on the table, along with a solid helping of cheese and salsa / guac. Feel free to decorate your plate to your hearts content by utilizing their condiments. A squeeze of lime, dash of radish, and a few drops of salsa verde is enough to give any taco / quesadilla a nice flavor boost.While it would be true that there is really no true seating, the same could be said about the taco trucks out on the street. And even though the place mildly simulates the truck experience, this shouldn't hinder anyone unless they have a large order. For some people (myself included), spending $3.50-$4.50 for each taco/quesadilla admittedly feels pricey. It might actually be the most expensive street style taco in NYC. I jokingly asked one of the guys in Spanish behind the counter if he'd pay this much for tacos and his reply was "son gratis para mi..." (it's free for me). That said, there aren't a lot of Mexican folks hitting up this line if you know what I mean.In the end, Chelsea Market and the surrounding hood has significantly pricier options than Los Tacos No.1. Considering how expensive the rent must be the markup on the food seems justified. With all the crowds that flock here every day, something tells me the rent is getting paid just fine.

Honestly, this is heaven in the form of tacos. That's all I really need to say, but I'm sure the details won't hurt!We got the pollo asado (chicken), carne asada (steak), nopal plate and a horchata. Also, I got my tacos with corn tortillas but you have the option of flour tortillas. There is no seating so try to find some empty counter space if you can. Anyway, I must say that each and every bite that was taken during the course of this meal was CRAZY. The meats were so tender and juicy and oozing with flavor. The guac and veggies in the tacos tasted super fresh, and I am so grateful that they did not hold back on the cilantro (this place already wins). I've never had nopal prior to my experience here but I LOVED it. Also, the corn tortillas were soft, not grainy at all, and the best complement to such a fantastic array of flavor.I didn't forget the horchata. Super yummy and refreshing - if you plan on coming here, make sure to get it to wash down your meal. Delicious with more delicious is never a bad idea!

I saw the great reviews this place got and decided to give it a shot. The line was long but definitely worth the wait. I ordered the chicken tacos and they were delicious- very flavorful and fresh tasting!! The price was also very affordable which is always a plus, especially in NYC.
Hands down best tacos in NYC! The lines are always long but goes by pretty quick. Just get it. always worth it.

I discovered this back in 2014 and really loved how the portions in the tacos are made - no skimping on ingredients. My favorite has to be the Carne Asada! Be sure to go here during non peak hours because the line tends to snake around even until the next establishments beside it. Don't forget to try some guac and salsa (which is available on the counter) with your taco!
Had 2 rounds of tacos for lunch ! That's how tasty this place is !!  (you gotta have a good vision to spot a place to devour the yum)

Yummy tacos! Super crowded and busy but I think that also adds to the experience. There are no tables or seats so be prepared to eat standing up and also getting your hands dirty bc they don't skimp out on the meat so your tortilla might have trouble holding up all the toppings. I personally think that the carne asada was the best one and I also love that they handmake the corn tortillas on site
Best tacos!!!  So amazingly good!  Can't just eat one... I'm always thinking about going back for tacos!

This place has the best tacos in NYC!!! They also just opened a new location on 43rd St. near Times Square, which has a lot more space to stand and eat. This is a can't-miss when visiting NYC or as a local. I recommend getting the "mula" on a flour tortilla, al pastor (this is similar to what's known as a "gringa" in Mexico City - somewhere between a taco and a quesadilla because it comes with cheese :-)

My mouth is watering writing this review. Omg, these tacos are EVERYTHING and then some,imo. Los Tacos offers no tables to sit at, like more than half of the other spots at the market don't either. The line was composed of about 40 people when I got there, and the wait was probably about 10-15 minutes.... but the wait is extremely worth it. Their steak and pork tacos are fantastic. Their pico de gallo is tangy, but not over the top spicy. Holy crap. These are by far the fastest and tastiest tacos that have ever graced my mouth. Their pork tacos have freaking pineapple in them? I've never had this combo and I'm dying to have some more of them right now. The employees are really friendly and move efficiently fast. The price? about $3 dollars a taco. WHAT? yes. The tacos are made by a Mexican staff? YES! That's probably why they're so damn good.Something to keep in mind though, after you pay and receive your ticket, move quickly to the other side and give that other person your ticket. If you assume that after you pay, your ticket number or order will be called out for you to come get it, you will be waiting there for a longgggggg time.

This place is as god as it gets for fresh tacos...it doesn't disappoint. Sommmeeee dayssss the pork is a little salty but it doesn't change much in terms of my review. Love ya Los tacos, glad I work across the street lol

Went with a couple of girl friends and none of us were expecting the quesadillas to be so small. They're about the size of a taco. BUT it was amazing regardless. We've been craving it ever since! Warning- the spicy option is REALLY spicy.

Love this place ...not cheap but you pay for what you get in life .The adobada is my favorite but highly suggesting getting a little selection .I only wish they had somewhere you could stand and eat them with out getting in everyone's way . But if you want a fast food hit on the run then this is your place .

After reading all the raving reviews, I wanted to love this place.  Really, I did.  The reason I'm giving 4 stars rather than 3 (which was about how I came away from it) is that my criticisms are in no way their fault.  To sum it up:  it's not Los Tacos No. 1, it's me.As others have said, Chelsea Market is a zoo.  I went close before closing, so it wasn't too bad; not really a wait for the tacos, and we were able to snag a table nearby.  The tacos come with guac, and they also have an amazing spread of toppings for you to add:  3 different salsas, turnips, lime, anything you could want.  The tortillas are fantastic (I had the corn), and it's fun to see them making them right in front of you.Sounds great, right?  The one problem with me and Los Tacos No. 1 is simple:  I'm a vegetarian, and as it turns out, I don't really like cactus.  It's alright, but it's kind of slimy and weird tasting.  I still enjoyed my tacos, mostly for the tortillas, but I'm probably not going to go out of my way to get them again.Perhaps someday my palette will mature enough to enjoy what I'm sure are fabulous tacos.
Best tacos in NYC. Get the adobada taco with corn tortilla!
This place is delicious!!! Don't let the crowd and the cramped eating space scare you away! It's part of the experience. If you really dislike crowds Go early or late and on weekdays! Yummy!!

If you like chorizo and you like breakfast burritos, you absolutely have to try the chorizo burrito here. You will find them selling the burritos from a cart on weekdays from 8-11. In December 2015, my wife and I happened to be walking through the Chelsea market checking out the shops and we came across the cart. I bought a burrito and it was game over. We went back to NYC again this December and I made a point to go back to Chelsea Market just for the burrito. I have only tried the chorizo burrito here but I can imagine the rest of their food is probably awesome as well. I'll be back again next year.

Oh my gawddd. The single taco I ate here was better than any other I've ever had. Carne asada on a corn tortilla with melted cheese, onions, cilantro, guac, and salsa... the meat was juicy and tender, and everything else was fresh and flavorful.Wait in line, order and pay, then give your ticket to the delicious taco creators who will prepare your food with your choice of toppings. The line may be long, and you might have to eat right there at the counter, but it's worth it.They're small, so order two or three. But I promise you'll want more!!

Delicious tacos. Most delicious tacos I have had in the United States. I tried the steak, pork, and chicken tacos and they were all good, but my favorite was the steak, then the pork, then the chicken. The tacos come with veggies and a spoonful of guac. On top of that you can get for yourself lime wedges and mild/medium/hot salsa. You also get a choice of corn or four tortilla.It can be a bit messy to eat, but who cares when it tastes so good. But beware, the lines can get pretty long during the busy times and it can be sort of a free for all after you get your ticket for the food. This is definitely a must try for anyone who likes Mexican food.

I dont even like Mexican food but these tacos are the sole reason why I want to keep visiting New York!!! I am super picky about meat and this place does not disappoint .. The only downside is you want to keep eating them Head to doughnuttery and get the green matcha donuts too ... Yummmm
Tacos are good. Quesadillas are EXCELLENT! If you're new to Chelsea market, you HAVE to eat here. Don't worry about the long lines, they move quick.

I'm not really a taco person, but this is hands down the best tack I have! The only problem is the seating, since Chelsea market is always crowded, you might have to stand to eat those delicious tacos

I love tacos! And i really like this place. It's kind of confusing to order but you order/ pay first  and then you can tell them what toppings you prefer or not afterwards. I had the chicken and steak taco on a corn tortilla and they were both seasoned well and cooked to perfection. My bf had a chicken quesadilla on a flour tortilla and they aren't much bigger than a taco BUT we both agreed that the flour tortilla is so much better (i had a bite of his lol)! I didn't give it 5 stars because the Horchata sucked especially because i'm familiar with the taste. It felt like i was drinking watered down milk with cinnamon. Bleh.Overall this place was worth the price.

My friends were telling me that Los tacos no.1 could easily be the best tacos eatery in North America. I haven't eaten a lot of tacos in my life, but this place was smokin'! I got 1 chicken and 2 pork tacos with everything on it. The tacos themselves are really small, but filled with goodies. Get around 3-4 if you want to get full. They're also quite spicy so buy a drink to help out the lips! Definitely a must go in the Chelsea market!

Excellent tacos and quesadillas. Everything here is amazing all the time. All day everyday. The chicken the cactus the beef. Chips and guac. In the morning these guys all do amazing breakfast burritos in carts outside.Pro tip from someone who spends a lot of time in here - after you order, hand your receipt to one of the guys behind the counter.

This place definitely lives up to the hype!You can easily get a filling meal for less than $15 and it sure is worth it. The food is authentic Mexican (coming from someone who has had one too many tacos in Sunset Park, Brooklyn - Tacos El Bronco all the way!).I had the pollo asado taco in a corn shell, which was delicious and moist. Sometimes chicken can be too dry, but this chicken melts in your mouth! I also had the carne asada quesadilla on a flour tortilla. Again, the steak was very moist and the flavors were killing it! The quesadilla is served open faced. Make sure to get all of the toppings (like guac and onion, it's included in the price!!). I also had agua fresca (hibiscus) and it was lovely.I think the biggest thing here is the service and the free (well, included) toppings. They also have a self-service topping bar with salsas (mild/med/hot), radish and lime. The only bad thing is there is no seating and eating tacos on the floor of Chelsea Market is quite sad.

Ever since Los Tacos opened, the line has been insanely long during lunch. I finally dropped by after work and there was no line, hooray! Best tacos I've ever eaten! The guy making them recommended I eat them right there when I asked if I could get it to go. I know I should, but I work nearby so I can always do that, and opted to take it home to eat (they will wrap it in foil for you to keep it warm). There are also condiments and garnishes on the counter for you to add to your food, consisting of various sauces, grilled jalapenos, grilled green onions, limes, and radishes.Got 3 different tacos - the carne asado (grilled steak), pollo asado (grilled chicken), and the nopal (cactus) - all "con todo," which means "with everything," for the sake of easy ordering. In this case, everything meant avocado/guac sauce, cilantro, onions, and salsa/tomatoes. The great thing was when I got home, the tacos were still very tasty, beautifully seasoned, juicy and warm. The tortilla was fluffy and not chewy, definitely handmade. You could taste the authenticity of the food. I wished I had ordered 2 more.I went crazy trying all the sauces (salsa verde, salsa roja, habanero peanut, and pico de gallo aka salsa fresca) by itself and with the tacos. Faves are the green and habanero.The tacos are on the small side and costs $2.50-$4.50, but seriously, best tacos ever and they're filled to the brim so you get a pretty fat taco, sooo worth it. 3 tacos didn't fill me up, but I wasn't starving either. Can't wait to come back for the other stuff!

As transplants from the Midwest, finding real Mexican food here has been a challenge. When you only have to go as far as your kitchen for amazing dishes (I miss you abuelita), you get spoiled.I still can't believe the best and most authentic tacos are in Chelsea Market.We usually start with 2 Carne Asada tacos on corn tortillas with only cilantro and onion. I'm not sure of the origins of that runny guac sauce but the consensus between me and my boyfriend has been #NotOnMyTacos. Add a squeeze of lime and the medium salsa from the molcajete on the counter and you are set.If you make it in time for the Adobada tacos, go for it! The gentlemen behind the counter already know I take my Adobada on a corn tortilla with cilantro, onion, and a slice of the pineapple on top. Salsa is optional on this since the taste of the meat is so delicious.Back home I would drink horchata almost as much as I would water and I am so glad their agua frescas are top notch. While I'm not a jamaica or tamarindo fan, my boyfriend is and was quite surprised by how good they are. If you need carbonation, try the Jarritos or a Coke in a glass bottle...I'm not a pop (soda) person and those always hit the spot.The nopal tacos are delicious. I'm used to eating nopales as a side dish but now that Lent is upon us and I'm not eating meat, they are my saving grace.My only complaint is that each taco is almost $4 but when the ingredients are right, the meat is perfect, and there is a woman standing there making tortillas BY HAND, I'll gladly pay up.

Awesome adobado, which at this place is the same thing as al pastor, my favorite.Oh...and homemade corn tortillasAuthentic Tijuana taqueria experience.Tacos, Tostadas, and stuff.Best thing they do there is called a vampiro and its not on the menu.Its a tortilla fried into a tostada with cheese melted on top, then meat and lettuce, pica, ajs everything else. Really great.Only detractions from this place is the lack of a dining area and on one of the four times I ate there, we had upset stomachs afterwards.

Met one of the owners while driving my Uber, Jacob, really nice guy.  He was getting some kitchen equipment to his Chelsea Market restaurant when we strike a conversation.  He then offered me a FREE taco.When we got to his restaurant, he went inside and got me a pork taco in no time. Talk about a genuine guy.All I have to say is wow, it was delish!Def coming back for more and recommending it to people I drive to the Chelsea Market!

Not only were the staff polite and cheery, you get a lot for your money!  I know I should have had a taco - which I plan to get next time after I saw all the tacos being prepared.  I opted for the Nopal with meat plate.  It was a healthy dish with nopal under the meat, some cheese, sauces cilantro, avocado sauce and your option to add more garnish such as radish, grilled jalapeno and grilled whole spring onions!  There was always a line with people going back for more.  I certainly will be back!  Welcome to NYC!Just found out, this place is from California!I actually requested the owner to include a fish taco or a seafood taco.  I hope they do!

Best tacos in NewYork! A must in your visit to the Chelsea Market  love the adobados since they have the same taste as the mexican "trompo" tacos!!! The salsas have a great taste too! Delicious will go back soon!

I've never really contemplated becoming a competitive eater before, but the tacos here are making me reconsider my stance on that.  Dang.I went with a chicken and a pork taco and both were delicious.  A little on the small side (I was thinking to myself, "I should have ordered 17 of these."), but not insultingly so.  Three probably would have been perfect.  I finished off the meal with a horchata and that was also excellent.The only bummer is that there is really nowhere to go with your food once it's ready, so I just posted up at the counter in the corner to the right of the registers and went to town.  Don't worry, you won't be the only one doing it.Go there now.

Decently authentic, affordable Mexican food. Very cute little stand in the Chelsea Market. There was a ~15 minute line and then a 10+ wait at the ticket counter. People were eating at the ticket counter which was rude and held up the line - I wish someone had said something to them. I had a pollo and a carne asada taco- the pollo was delicious but does have a little bit of a kick (in a good way!). Delicious guacamole. I'd eat there again.
I hate that it's in the Chelsea market I do not like it there. It's always so crowded with people visiting and is not really a great scene. THESE TACOS MAKE ME GO. YOU GOT ME GUYS!! YOU GOT ME!

I would say 4.5 because of the prices but it was DELICIOUS! Inside Chelsea Market youll find this Taco Stand that always has a line (moves quickly though!) We were there on Friday night at the place was poppin'! Half of the market was holding tacos. And the staff is bilingual (English & Spanish.)Tacos range 3.5-4$. Not awful prices for Chelsea Market. My friend and I tried the Adobado (their take on the al pastor) and the Carne Asada. She had them over flour tortillas and mine over corn.  I was a HUGE fan of the Adobado- fatty in a good way, juicy, and great flavors. My friend is all about the meat (pause?)* so she liked the carne asada more and we both agreed you could really taste the beef. They lay out some lime (definitely squeeze some over your tacos) and mild, medium, and hot salsas to add to your tacos/meal. We also got the guac-- pretty good! (4$)They would really up their game if they could somehow keep the chips warm. Its basically the size of the Chipotle guac side (for your reference...but much better!) My friend had their sidra soda (a red apple soda) and she said she liked it but nothing like a Mexican coke in terms of that sugar factor. Definitely would be my food stop in Chelsea Market! OH! They dont own any seating and I wouldnt recommend you eat on the counter where they have all the salsa, you'll just be in everyone's way. Just steady yourself and balance your food and ask to share tables around Chelsea Market. You'll be fine. Promise. *I can be like five years old sometimes so apologies for my immaturity.*
LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! The food is GREAT!  Lots of people, but you still get your food rather quickly! Will definitely return on our next trip to NY.

4-star. Legit tacos. I got the carne asada as well as the chicken quesadilla, which were pretty good. The tacos were slightly better. They are good, but honestly, I am not sure if it deserves a 5-star all the way.
Best carne asada tacos, with guacamole (avocado) sauce and great price!

We're west coast taco snobs and my whole family (of 6) loved the tacos. If you like things mild, hold on the house salsa that comes with the taco, my kids thought their lips would burn off and we "had" to get them a shake from a store next door to stop the burn. Love that we can add our own amount of pico! Who gives unlimited pico?!!

Surprising to find good tacos that are more mexican than texan/korean/random these days.This place hits the spot. Quality ingredients and simple menu.Food:Quesadillas: they are on the menu, there for gringos who need something familiar to order.. please skip Tacos: You have your options of pollo (chicken), asada (beef), adobada (pork) and nopal (cactus). If you are going to order chicken tacos... please step aside, you are embarrassing. Get pork tacos, read this again: PORK, got it? good. Put some condiments on it and you are good to go.Other:They are small tacos, but really good. They are the most expensive "street" tacos I've had. I wouldnt normally pay $4.50 for this, but considering the location it's a decent price (that's my nyc delusion kicking in, justifying insane prices).Overall, great spot if you are in the area and need a quick bite.

After building up a hunger from an evening run with my girlfriends starting from Central Park, down the West-side highway, and ending in Chelsea market, I enjoyed three (yes, three!) hearty steak tacos.  They are fresh, delicious, and I love that you can add your own "fixin's."
Two words : Perfecto Tacos!Lines can be long, it can be hard to find seatings or standing rooms!I'm always a corn tortiila fan and love it here too!

Long line but it moved quickly.  Others yelpers do not lie, these tacos are the best.  I ordered two pork and one beef.  My husband took one bit and of the pork and got in line to order a few more.  No need for salsa.  The sauce is perfect and spicy.  Another happy customer.

There's really only one thing you need to know about Los Tacos: get the adobada taco. Like don't even think about not getting it (unless you're adverse to pork). With the warm corn tortilla, the assortment of toppings which included guacamole and salsa, this was absolutely worth the walk to Chelsea Market...second to only the rag & bone sample sale I walked in on when I arrived.  Nothing screams NYC more than a solid sample sale and kick ass food.

This restaurant made my list of "must try" for our NYC vacation.  So glad we did because the carne asada tacos were delicious!  The horchata was good too.  On the last day of our trip we hopped on the subway just to get a couple more tacos before flying out!

Holy cow, this place lives up the hype!!!Expensive? For a taco, yes.Inconvenient? With the lines and lack of seating, yes.Worth it? Absolutely!!After waiting in a long line, I decided to order three tacos and try all the meat options. Usually I don't eat much pork but thought I'd try em all. To my surprise, pork was hands down the best. I don't know how they get that amazing flavor on it... You really do t even need salsa!!!Washed down the three tacos with a tamarind agua fresca/ the perfect complement to an awesome tray o tacos!

Can only comment on the fried cheese quesadilla with carne asada, which is incredible! As someone who was born and raised in the midwest, I am a natural lover of all things fried, this did not disappoint! It only costs 5$, is decently sided, filled with a lot of good meat, creamy melted cheese and the cook was extremely generous with guacamole! The fact that they dont charge extra for guacamole is a miracle in this day and age, and that alone warrants 5 stars. My friends who all went to num pang were super jealous of my quesadilla when they saw it with a heaping pile of guac. They were also light on the cilantro which is a good thing in my book, because I think cilantro is very strong and some Mexican places overdo it. I am not sure what all the drinks in the coolers in the front are (one is some type of horchata), but the other patrons seemed to be going crazy over them so maybe I'll have to try one day!

Excellent tacos but very overpriced for Mexican standards :O carne asada comes and adobada are my favorite! The come with toppings (cilantro cebolla ) Get them with everything and corn tortillas! The corn tortillas are handmade right there! The salsas on the counter are delicious, salsa verde is my favorite! Loved the agua de tamarindo! My favorite taco place in NYC!I'm from Mexico City and for the price of one taco I would get 4 and a drunk in Mexico but I love this place anyway!
Marinated pork on corn taco is heavenly. There's a line but it's definitely worth it!!!!

Honestly the best tacos I've encountered in the city! I've come back and brought friends. The whole industrial atmosphere of Chelsea Market is awesome, but Los Tacos' tacos are bursting with flavor and fairly inexpensive. And everyone in the kitchen has been really nice and accommodating. So if you love tacos, or have never tried them, this is the spot to come to!

My 12 year search for a simple perfect carne asada taco like you find almost everywhere in Los Angeles has finally come to an end. Best taco I have had in NYC hands down. Thank goodness I found it - the airfare to get out west to King Taco was getting pricey :)

Hands down my favorite tacos of all the places I've tried in NYC. I would eat here everyday if I could. The ingredients are super fresh and the corn tortillas are handmade. Can't beat that for the price! The adobada (pork) meat is the standout item here. The marinade is really flavorful and topping it off with pineapple and all the fixings make it even better.Do me a favor and don't be one of those people who eat at the salsa counter! How am I supposed to get my salsa through a wall of people?!

The most amazing chicken tacos I've ever had in my life.  I'm salivating now just thinking about them.  I'm very picky with chicken; I only eat fresh, well done/carefully sliced white meat and that's all they serve.  No disgusting dark meat gristle (i.e. Chipotle).Also, the sauces are fresh, homemade, and bursting with flavor.  I love their variety of hot sauces that range in spiciness.  Yum!

They tell me it's the best tacos in New York, and I could believe that. This place was good. It wasn't FABULOUS, but it was pretty good. I'm from SoCal, where taco stands are literally in every corner of Downtown LA. I guess you could say I am a taco connoisseur in New York (although I wouldn't be able to call myself that in LA). I didn't appreciate the line they had though. The line was kind of crazy and the way you get your food was ridiculous. You basically have to give them a ticket for them to call out your order when everyone out there is pretty much getting the same tacos as you.

$4 tacos!I had people from Mexico in tow and for them to say OMG! and Amazing! makes me wanna write this 5 star review.They have an amazing drink called Horchata, if you don't know what it is then you have to try it! Its actually made from rice and cinnamon, add ice and Voila! A tasty, iced treat.I ordered chips and salsa along with a Carne Asada Taco. Man.. that's some bangin' tacos! And in NYC?  Not off a truck?? God Bless us. Everyone

Two Carne asada and one chicken taco please. The service was great for a Friday night and the line wasn't that bad! I recommend to stay and eat your food there. They have a bar setup on the side in the back and also plenty of "random" seating. They take card and cash so that's a plus! I also noticed the mild salt was killing me and I LOVEEE spicy so beware overall I got my taco "fringe" on!!! E n j o y..
YUM! Sucked down my two tacos like I'd never seen a taco before in my life. I had a steak taco on flour and a pork taco on corn. Pile on the pico de gallo and go to town.
Don't get the hype about this place. The tacos are ok but nothing special. I wouldn't go out your way to visit as there is better places in NYC for tacos.

I cannot get enough of this place. The chicken quesadillas are soooo good. Super flavorful, a little spicy, and great combo of textures. The guac is amazing, and I love the toppings (like the pico) that they have on the counter. I always order a Mexican Coke when I'm here.The prices are great. Hands down my favorite (and my boyfriend's favorite!) Mexican restaurant.
The line isn't that long, and it is definitely worth the quick wait! Affordable prices for yummy food - sign me up!I got the chicken taco with a corn tortilla and I loved it with all the toppings.

I'm not really a big fan of Mexican food but recently I have been coming out of my comfort zone a little more with food and decided to stop by here for a quick lunch with a friend. After seeing and hearing countless things about this place from friends and even the Yelp instagram itself I stopped in to try two Pollos Asados tacos and grabbed a Fanta Orange soda as well.The tacos were $3.50 each was a great price to me here in New York when I have definitely paid more for tacos at pricier Mexican places. Overall, they tasted great and the guys who work here hustle and bustle to get you your food as fast as possible. There isn't any seating but this place is meant to be somewhat of a fast food. There is a bar that you can stand and eat at that is supplied with everything you could possibly need from flatware to extra condiments.I had a good time and if I'm looking for a cheap eat in Chelsea I would not mind stopping in here.

This place is the best tacos I have had in the tri state area!  Very authentic, tasty, fresh and friendly service. You cant go wrong with anything on the menu, so order what you like. Please let me k ow of anyplace that is better or on par with this taco spot!

OMG!!!  they make a taco shell out of cheese!!!  are you serious?!  i saw this place on facebook.  we go to NYC pretty regularly because of family living there.  when i saw this i told the boyfriend i want to go.  its in a little market place and i would have never found it on my own.  once we got there the line was soo long but moved pretty quick so it wasnt too bad.  i got up to order and explained i had never been but i wanted the taco shell made out of cheese.  you walk down the line the cooks ask what you want on it.  cheese, guac, tomatoes, and onions.  they hand you your tacos and you step aside for whatever salsa you want.  unfortunately there is no seating so a lot of people would literally stand in front of the salsa and eat.  huge turn off!!!!  but when i tasted the tacos nothing bad about the place mattered.  this taco was heaven even though the they were smaller than i expected for the price i would go back without a question.
The best tacos I've had in NYC! The portions aren't as big as most places, but the flavors are incomparable. I'd recommend the carne asada tacos with a flour tortilla.

Fun experience to have food, which is brand new in my life.Location: Los Tacos No.1 deserves their No.1 Reputation among all other mexican food stand in Chelsea Market. Why do I say that? Cuz I guess there is no other mexican food stand in Chelsea Market. LOL. Anyway, it is bit hard to get Los Taco since they are mixed with other food stands in Chelsea Market. And with all the flood of people and lots of food stand, it took me  10 mins to actually find that place. And when I got there, there was already a long line in front of me while I am starving to death. Service: there is no such thing as service since they do not even have any seats for you to enjoy their delicious taco. But they do have lists of food on the wall while you are waiting in line. However, one thing to notice is that although their line is extremely lone sometimes, it moves really fast!Food: what I found very interesting is that they have Nopal / Grilled Cactus taco. Tell me, have you ever thought about eating cactus? No, not at all. All though stings and all those ugly appearance, hell no~ But as a crazy foodie, I have to try to satisfie my curiosity. So I did order it. And it tasted really weird. It's chewy but tasteless. It is not typical veggies that I can related to, tastewise. A word to describe that taco, weird, is all I think about. It is not bad with spicy sauce but still, I asked myself, what is it? I do not know this time, I will leave the answer to you to fill in.Price: taco for 3 dollar for one . Pricy!Overall: Well, it's good, even though my order is weird. But the flour is good , tasteful and good to eat with spice. Combing all those factors I listed above, I would rate it as a 4 star place and I will come back again to try some more.
Good tacos but I wasn't blown away. Worth the 15 minute wait and chaos in getting my beef taco, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here in the future.

Holy guacamole. And tacos.This place is INCREDIBLE. Had it delivered to us for a work lunch, and nobody left disappointed or not stuffed.The meats they cook here are cooked to perfection and are left very tender and juicy, especially the steak. You will not find anything dry or less than succulent. The guac was fresh and had the right balance of tomatoes, onions, etc.Must stop by if you are in Chelsea Market and looking for anything to eat.

Compared to what's offered in SoCal this place definitely holds its own. Not a big fan of the prices but if you're a SoCal native who's having taco withdrawals in New York this is a great place to feed your addiction.
Carne asada tacos are life .. point blank period! I would stay away from the adobabo quesadilla it was too greasy and salty for me

These tacos are honestly the best tacos I've ever had. I love the hospitality, the quick service, and how friendly the cooks are. The only downside is that it tends to get packed a lot, and it's in a small place with three other vendors so that makes it all the bit more cramped. But other than that, the food is phenomenal

Sorry, my beloved Taqueria Diana on the East Village. I had you as my favorite taqueria for quite a while now, but I now must remove you from the top of my list and introduce Tacos No. 1 as my new top Taqueria in the entire city. What can I say, I've been to many many taquerias around the city as well as a couple in Cancun and Mexico D.F. Nothing has come this close to those taquerias in Mexico until now. This place is absolutely amazing! All the way from the decor, to the sodas, to the juices, to the smell, to the music, and its entire staff. The adobado tacos were to die for! Those tortillas are authentic! Perfect!. I can't wait to return tipsy on beers :) so I can engulf on the rest of the menu. Salud and see you soon!
Amazing little street tacos. Excellent guacamole and many choices of meat etc. They need more seating.

WOW,  OMFG these were the best tacos al pastor that i have every eaten in the world.  yes they were that good.This place is in the Chelsea market. They server you line style. Order, pay and see your tacos made before your eyes while you wait.They had a huge spit of meat roasting on a flame. I ordered mine served on  nopales which is a cactus that is eaten a variety of ways. I got mine with cheese, cilantro, and some amazing hot salsa.  The meat was seriously better than anything I had south of the boarder. Magnificent!

This was the one place that I was told I must try, and it makes sense why. Los Tacos No. 1 is nestled in the middle of the busy Chelsea Market, sharing a space with an Asian themed restaurant and a tea supplier. They have a very simple menu with about 5 taco styles, and if you want cheese on your taco it is labeled as a quesadilla. I ordered a chicken 'quesadilla' with the horchata that they had. The taco was by far the best taco I have ever tasted. The Guac blended perfectly wth the seasoning of the meat and zest of the vegetables. The horchata was good as well, but was overshadowed by the amazing taco. The restaurant itself has no interior seating space and is actually just a taco line if you think about it. You place your order, move down a few feet, hand a guy your ticket, and he had a you your food. If you're lucky you will find some standing seating right outside the spice stand. I absolutely will visit this place the next time I'm in NYC and I recommend it without reservation to any traveler wanting a taco that has earned the title of No. 1
This is hands down the best taqueria in NYC. Hand made tortillas and excellent quality meats says it all. They also make very good salsas to go with your tacos.

Stand only spot so get in where u fit in :)... 4stars for the slammin  tacos ..seasoned well ..fast.. and tasty not dry or chewy.. they also let me sample the juice (Jamaican one to be exact which is hibiscus).. decided not to get..thanks for the sample I would not have drank all if purchased..no small cups

I am so sad how quickly this experience came and went because 5 minutes, .5 hours, 5 hours, and now 25 hours later I'm still wishing I could do it all over again. Tucked away in a corner of Chelsea Market, these are hands down some of the best tacos in New York City. It all starts with the handmade tortillas, which you can see being pressed and grilled fresh to order. You can pretty much see and hear all the other components being made. Keep your eyes and ears pealed because the line cooks will make tacos for the next person in line if you don't keep up. This is why, albeit long, the line moves really quickly. I ordered Adobada and Carne Asada tacos with everything then topped them mild pico and a squeeze of lime. After getting our food, the next mission was finding a place to eat. Thank god for the holiday and a number of shops being close because it made, finding a table quick. Even though we would be standing, we picked the first available tabletop. I would go as far to recommend eating these standing up because it gives you the right amount of leverage with these overflowing tacos. Plus you can step out of the way or dodge some of the drippings that are sure to pure down your hand/arm. Yum. The meats were so juicy, all the condiments (onions, cilantro, and a mysteriously spicy green sauce) were on point, and the tortilla held up to all the weight. Even though I inhaled these 2 in under 5 minutes, they were extremely satisfying and I maaaaaaaybe could have squeezed in 3rd but only because they were so delicious and I didn't want it to end. Defnitely No.1 in my book.

These are seriously the best tacos in NY, and some of the best I've ever had. Really, you need to have the Adobada taco. I basically just get that now, the pollo and carne asada tacos are good but not nearly as special as the adobada taco.
Just average flavor，not sure why the ranking is so high. Got the marinated pork taco and the steak taco. Need to find somewhere else for a seat, we just stand there and finish them.

I. AM. IN. LOVE. WITH THE TACOSI've been on a taco crusade for a while now and this place has beat all the other taco places I've been to. A small stand, a small menu, but the flavors and their tacos pack such a punch. Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything here. It's very small so most people eat and go, please don't spend an hour chit chatting when you get your food. What makes this place so great is that it's got a steady flow of traffic coming in and out, everyone gets the hint that you get your tacos, you eat it as fast as you can, and then you go.

So Mexican! One of the best tacos places outside Mexico. Los tacos N. 1 always finds a way to make us happy.   Recommendations: - everything! - Cactus tacos are my favorite although I am bias as I am vegetarian According to my husband (taco expert): - Pastor tacos and quesadillas as the ultimate winners. You will feel like in Mexico City. - Steak is a safe beat, don't forget to add spicy sauce. (Mild sauce, although tastes great is for beginners) - Nopales salad and diet coke if you are watching you waist line ;) Don't forget to try Jarritos and Horchata to pair with your tacos. Red Mexican Cola cola may also be found. Sunny day, rainy day, celebration day, I-hate-my-boss day.... Tacos will always make you feel better. Viva Mexico !!

Nice little gem inside the Chelsea market. Recommend by a friend and naturally being from California we crave tacos every 2 seconds so we had to come. The place is nice and definitely lives up to the it's 4.5 stars. There is no where to sit so you'll have to walk around and find a place to sit that's honestly the only reason I gave 4 stars. Otherwise if you wanna spend $22 bucks on 4 tacos and a Horchata come here and you won't be disappointed.
I can't get enough of these tacos. I  can't say i love the cactus ones, but the chicken and steak ones AHHHHH amazing.

Came here to grab quick bite before the wine tasting event at Chelsea Market. Wasn't expecting much since all I needed was food in my stomach. Line was long but quick during dinner time. Literally was served a few minutes after ordering. Got the Carne Asada tacos with everything on it. It was good, but what stopped me from enjoying it too much was the "mild" salsa which set my mouth on fire. For those sensitive to spice, "mild" is a term I would use loosely, there were a few peppers I found in it so expect it to have a kick of spice. Also the tacos were just watery as I tried to eat it. Possibly from the filling, but it got so messy.

Wow! The best tacos in all of New York. They taste as amazing as the tacos I had over the summer in a small town in Mexico. I had 2 tacos de carne asada which cost $3.75 each and a drink for a total of $11. That's the best $11 I've spent in a long time. The meat is juicy, tender, and full of flavor. The tortilla is made fresh and taste like heaven! The line was long but they work fast so I didn't wait very long and honestly I would wait forever to eat these tacos. If you love Mexican food you must try this spot, trust me!

YES to their tacos! A MUST TRY. My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out while we were walking around Chelsea Market and it was one of the best and quickest meal I had during my time in NY. Each taco is around ~$3.50 and it was worth every cent. We tried the chicken, steak, and pork tacos and all of them were so good and filling. The seasoning for each taco was done perfectly, but the mild salsa definitely made it better. ALSO, they add guacamole on their tacos!.. for no extra charge!!!!!!! (which was surprising to me, because most Mexican places I've gone to, they always charged extra for guac...). Staff is nice and food comes out pretty quick!Definitely recommend.

The apartment was great as well as the location. It was literally a five minute walk to Bunker Hill and 10 minutes to the U.S.S. Constitution which is one end of the freedom trail. Melissa was a gracious host and the apartment just as advertised. All of the conveniences that you would need, shopping, restaurants, etc. are all within walking distance. I would recommend this apartment to any one looking to enjoy all that Boston has to offer. We can't wait to go back!

They run a fast, clean and tasty operation here. It's a tough market to survive in if your sub par so long! I love that I can fill up often for under $5. I love the Shrimp soft shell taco and the Shrimp quesadilla. The meat and chicken often can be confused which is a worry but I haven't ever become ill so I'm continuing to take my chances.When you order deliver I think you get a free soda. All round a good option if your in the 'hood or want to dial a meal.

I still can't believe how good these were!! Pretty inexpensive, if you get three it's a little more than chipotle but the quality is a lot better. Really recommend the medium salsa. I got the chicken tacos on corn tortilla and fell in love.

On the go food with flair! Los Tacos No. 1 has perfected the taco. Lines are long at times but staff are efficient turning out food quick. In my efforts to attempt to eat at every joint that appeals to my stomach, friend and I ordered one of each taco to try- Asada Asado (grilled steak), Pollo Asado (chicken), Adobada (pork), and Nopal (cactus). My favourites were Asada Asado and Pollo Asado. The cactus I would liken to an artichoke not a stand out but would recommend trying.Although small, don't be fooled by the size of the taco. Packed with toppings leaving you with remnants of sauce dripping down your hand. Napkins and lots of them are required.Grab and go joint doesn't overlook presentation and customer service. After devouring our tacos within minutes we lined up for seconds- stomach takes over and you just can't resist! Standing by the bar eating round two we were given an Especial (fried cheese quesadilla) on the house. The boys know a way to a girls heart- cheesy goodness was divine!Located in middle of the Chelsea market, hard to find with a small sign. Look for a line and you are on your way. No seating however there is tons just outside the market- sit along the river or find a bench and people watch at Highline Park.All in all fresh quality ingredients (gluten free joint) and no shortage of toppings. Save the cost of dinning in and get yourself some dessert.

Coming from 5 years living in San Francisco eating great mexican, these are pretty much the best Tacos I've found in NY.  Hard to find anywhere to sit and enjoy them, but the food makes it worth the trouble.

Wow! I think I'm a pretty good judge of authentic Mexican food having had lived in southern Mexico for a time, and this place is solid! Great flavors and ingredients! I had the beef, pork, and chicken tacos (pork and beef slightly better than the chicken) as well as the horchata and it was all fantastic. I recommend the medium salsa and the pico also (the hot salsa was also very good, but the medium had a better smokey flavor in my opinion). I will definitely be back for more!

The tacos are THE BOMB! The guys behind the counter are also super friendly and nice. I highly recommend getting the quesadilla option - takes the taco to the next level. Chips + guac. are also a must.

Delicious tacos - enjoyed the 3 I tried (Chicken, Beef, Pork). Only thing that's annoying is the set-up. It is not the typical sit-down of any sort - you have to stand and eat your tacos and go walk over to get salsas, most likely where someone else is standing and eating.

Some of the best tacos I've had in Nyc! Not too expensive, located right in Chelsea market. If you are on a food tour around Chelsea and need a taco fix this is your joint! The pork is outstanding, they shave it right off the rotisserie! Eating there with a large group could be an issue, not too many seats available since is always busy. Don't forget to give them your ticket, that's how they know to start making the food. Odd concept but it works!

I love this place! To say it is magnificent would be an understatement. Never again can I just go and enjoy a taco anywhere. Los Tacos No. 1 literally ruined regular taco experiences elsewhere! Thanks Los Tacos! HaHaBut no, seriously... I can't emphasize how remarkable their tacos and guac w/ chips are. They have an extremely fresh taste to them and they are quick. It is as if the items used to prepare the food were harvested or slaughtered earlier that morning. I can recall going to visit Los Tacos soon after getting both of my lower wisdom teeth removed. Did I know I was in for a challenge? Yep, sure did! Not a care was given! It literally took me an hour and a half to nibble through the continents of the two tacos. Listen to what I said, the contents, which means I completely skipped the nice fluffy corn shells. Guess what? I enjoyed every splendid second of it!Am I rambling? Yes! Why? Because I feel like an excited hyper little kid as I think about these amazing tacos.What tacos should you get? It doesn't matter! You can't go wrong so just go with whatever you feel like!The only tip will be to relax. Chelsea Market moves at a different pace. I always feel like I'm going 100mph when I enter because everyone is moving on a none NYC time. Try to walk extra slow and you will fit in with what seems to be majority tourist patrons.

There was a decent line when we approached this place. The wait wasn't bad at all cause the employees work super fast. Tacos were delicious - I got the chicken and steak. Get the steak. Matcha wasn't too sweet which was preferred. Overpriced, but you're in New York...

Expensive!!!! But this isn't surprising for the east coast. I've been desperately looking for decent tacos since moving east and I finally found some to satisfy my cravings. Salsas are spicy and the meat is flavorful.

Man what a gem this place is! Tucked away in the Chelsea Market this place is a must go if you're craving some AUTHENTIC Mexican cuisine. When I first arrived the line snaked all the way to the main hallway in the market so I knew I was in for a treat. After about 15 minutes of waiting and line and chatting with others who already got their meals I finally got to the front. I ordered the pork and chicken especial. They give you a ticket and you bring it to the cooks who then can customize the order for you. Took about two minutes to make and the fun began. I bit into fried corn tortilla wrap and it was bliss. It was the perfect amount of cheese, salsa meat and sauce. The pork especial is hands down the best item on the menu (cashier recommend it as well.) The chicken especial was good as well but couldn't hold a flame to the pork version. Next time I'm in NYC I will be visiting this place again.
My favorite tacos in the city. The carne asada tacos are the absolute best.Great for a quick bite, but you'll either have to stand or go hunt down a seat in Chelsea Market (not an easy feat).
Best tacos in NYC - best part is the topping stations. One star off for the limited seating.
Best tacos in NYC!!! Fast service, smiling employees. You can choose your tortilla (flour or corn) and add whatever you want in your taco. The guacamole is delicious. And good prices

I have been here a few times and awesome.liytle place. The tacos are great any one of them.  The lines get long but they tend to move quick. Be prepared to give you receipt to the guy so he can prepare your food. Most people stand and chat and then wonder why it is taking so long, he needs ur receipt. There is really no place to sit but find a place to stand and enjoy your taco. It's good stuff.

Oh it's true...these tacos are DELICIOUS!! I had my doubts since we have great Mexican food in CA and there's a lack in NY...but I'd have to say these are the best!!I had the carne asada tacos-those tortillas were pipin' hot and homemade, there was plenty of fresh meat and I loved how you can pile on salsa, limes and peppers yourself-just like topping off sauces when you're with the halal guys, I tell ya!The line seems long since the place is narrow and small, but it goes by quickly. Take your tacos and eat 'em at the standing tables nearby-yum!!

Los Tacos No.1 has the art of taco making down to a science, serving endless line-ups of hungry guests while maintaining a high standard of freshness and quality. Located in Chelsea Market, this is a perfect stop for a snack while enjoying the market. Menu is simple and made up of a few variations of tacos. We opted for two grilled cactus and one Pork taco on corn tortillas. Once you order you get to witness the speed and precision in which the tacos are made; one lady making fresh tortilla, one man carving pork from a shawarma like spit, and one man putting all the magic together. The result is a miracle of food assembly that will tickle your taste buds. Grilled cactus was definitely the most interesting taco I have ever had. Slightly sweet, slightly smoky with a green bean texture, this was definitely something different. The pork was well seasoned, with the perfect amount of spice. The tacos are loaded with guacamole, tomatoes, and other toppings (onions, cilantro etc). There is an additional topping bar of salsas, hot sauces, radishes and things of that sort. The corn tortilla had a great texture and was clearly handmade shortly before consumption. All in all this was one of my favourite places to eat in New York; it is certainly a gem in the breathtaking Chelsea market.
my favorite taco place! i always get the al pastor mula- good size, great price, friendly  service and delicious.

I decided to come here based on the hype of friends and Yelpers showing an overwhelming outpouring of support for this establishment.The first question I have is: Did I come to the same taqueria everyone else went to?  I'm going to be one of the outliers here and unfortunately, go against the grain. Perhaps some of the blame should be on me for coming here on a dismal thunderstorm-y evening of 7/14, but I caught them at 8:30pm on a Monday (some time after a Yelp event in nearby West Village), and they were absolutely not on their game.I'd ordered a horchata, a carne asada quesadilla, and an adobada taco and sadly, none of which satisfied my palate.  Both were soggy, dripping and flavorless. Upon picking up the taco, a stream of water came pouring out. 0-for-1. (I have a witness that swears by it and loves Los Taco No.1) Ok, maybe that was an aberration....I picked up the open face quesadilla (yes, it looks more like a giant taco... They DO know how to fold things in half, don't they?) and still it fell apart before my very eyes and hands, a sloppy mess, one which I had to eat with a fork.  Not going well I'm afraid. 0-for-2.If that were not an indictment, the third strike goes to flavor. It was simply bland beyond words.  I had expected savory and flavorful and my tastebuds were bereft of that small pleasure tonight. 0-for-3.To add to my misery after paying for this experience, I also had to hunt for seating somewhere or eat fashionably at the pickup counter.  Luckily, found a table outside after standing some five minutes or so.Even (name-your-baseball-player) has bad nights so I'll give them another chance, however, as it stands, the experience earns them two stars.

I'm born and raised in LA, and Mexican food in NY leaves much to be desired. It's just never right. That being said, Los Tacos No.1 are my favorite tacos in the 5 boros and quite possibly at the top of the list including California! Yes, it's pretty pricey, and you don't really expect to find the best Mexican food in Chelsea Market of all places--but it's legit. I've had everything on the menu before and it's ALL good. Of course I always prefer tacos in the end, but whether you go flour or corn tortillas, the end meal is outstanding. There's always limes (sometimes sliced a little too thin), and the salsas are so satisfyingly spicy! I always go with the adobada now-a-days as it's too amazing to pass up, and usually pair with an horchata to cool my burning palette afterwards. To be honest, I don't even feel robbed paying $3 a taco because you really do taste the quality -- in the meats (not fatty or gristley), the tortillas (hand made and fresh), the salsa (real chilies), and the Spanish language as music to my ears.  Go and you'll fall in love too! Just nobody tell any of my friends back home that I'm shelling out $15 for tacos and a drink.
Dont be dumb. Los Tacos No. 1 has the best tacos in NYC. Enough said
Best tacos in NYC. These guys are located in the touristy Chelsea market but they don't miss out on authenticity in their food. I have found better tacos in NYC. So fresh. Great portion size.

There are too many places to eat inside this amazing market.  I decided to give this taco place a try. I had a rather unique taco...grilled cactus taco.  I didn't know what to expect but it was quite sweet, like similar to a green pepper but with a different kind of taste.  It had all of the usual ingredients including a healthy scoop of guacamole at no extra charge.  If it was not spicy enough, they have freshly made spice sauce in the front with a spoon for those who want extra sauce.  The tortilla was done perfectly. I would stop by here again if I come back.

Solid pollo adobo taco, excellent guacamole. The space is small and a bit confusing, wish there was a bit more space for tables and stools. Still, I'm not quite sure if it's the best taco I've ever had. It got a bit soggy while looking for somewhere to set up and eat. Next, I'll check out the pork which looked really good, roasting on the spit.

OMG! I have to say these are some of the best tacos I've ever had. The corn tortillas are handmade practically when you order and they're very good. I had a carne asada quesadilla and a adobada taco; perfectly seasoned. Also added they're mild homemade sauce, very good. Had a side of chips and guac which was also very good and an horchata to drink. My husband had 2 tacos de pollo and he fell in love as well. We are most definitely coming back again and again. We are fans of Tacombi but I think Los Tacos No.1 is our new favorite! Only downside is that you have to find a spot to eat because they don't have a seating area but it's totally worth it.

The line was really long, but it moved quickly. My boyfriend and I got the steak taco and the cactus taco both on corn tortillas with the mild salsa. The steak taco was PHENOMENAL. The taste and texture of the cactus taco wasn't for us, but it was still interesting to try. Due to the lack of seating at Chelsea Market, it was hard to eat and really messy. We also thought that the tacos would be a little bigger for the price we paid for them, but we'd go back and try the other things on the menu.

Holy hell- this was quite possibly one of the best things I've ever eaten!! Adobada meat is unbelievable, just a bit spicy. I also had the chicken which was ahhmazing as well. How've I come to NY all these times and not been here yet? I just found my new fav spot!!

I love any type of veggies and was super ecstatic to have cactus tacos. The spicy sauce is seriously hot so beware. Everything was tasty although pricey! Great thing is you can find anywhere to sit although next time will look for a table so that my clumsy ass could get less messy!

So I had low expectations coming here although there were so many rave reviews. It's been a bad summer for me when it comes to tacos. The line was a bit busy so that was a good sign in itself and it moved pretty fast. We ordered a few tacos and quesadillas and boy were they good. After getting our order it was a pain to track down some seats. Luckily there were standing tables so we were able to eat without causing too much of a mess. I debated on ordering more after finishing but I knew I had to maintain self control.

What do I love you ask? TACOS!My love for tacos can be compared to that of a parents love for their children; I love them all but I have my favorites.I'm sick of gringo restaurants putting their "twist" on the taco (looking at you Chipotle; I still like chipotle). Sure I'm biased, my grandmother knows how to make tortillas by hand and Mom's Guac is priceless and taco trucks are native to my home-state CALIFORNIA, but that does not mean I can't judge a taco by its taste. My Order: (2) Carne Asada (seasoned grilled steak) on corn tortillas w/ everything(1) Bottled Coca Cola (imported)(1) Side of Chips and SalsaThe TacosI handed my ticket to the sorcerers behind the counter. Had to pick between flour and corn. (Tip: Always go for corn, leave the flour for the tortillas) Toppings include fresh onion(diced), cilantro(chopped), house salsa(mild) and guac (no extra charge!!; again, looking at you chipotle)At the bar there are different salsas and garnishes like fresh limes, mild, medium, and hot salsas(fresh) and last but not least, Radishes(its a staple in Mexican tacos and soups).They were great! The steak was lightly seasoned so that I could taste the fresh cilantro and guac. The tortillas were fresh and handmade (just might be as good as grandma's)The Chips & SalsaThe chips (obviously corn) are also homemade. They were fresh and had only a pinch of salt. The Salsa was extra spicy but man was I not expecting it! This is not your average salsa. You can taste the blood sweat and tears in it. Give em a shot but be prepared to stand, theres no seating near by but plenty of counter space.
Really good, inexpensive food! I love Mexican which is not always easy in NYC. There is no seating and it's really busy, but worth it. You can always take your food to the Highline on a nice day.

$3.75 for an amazingly juicy, flavorful taco on a handmade corn tortilla is too good to be true. BF and I got a carne asada taco and a pollo taco with everything and topped them with their perfectly spicy salsas. We came to Chelsea Market close to closing so the line wasn't super long, but we still ate standing up. However, that did not detract from the deliciousness. These were actually the best tacos BF and I have ever had.

Lies! All lies! I really wanted this place to be enjoyable. About once a month, we go steps away from this place to eat at MokBar, which has excellent ramen, and are always curious about the long line we always see waiting for these so-called delicious tacos. Finally, we decided on this particular day to try out these tacos and see what all the hype is about. The service is friendly and efficient, but it turns out there is nothing special or particularly delightful about these tacos at all. Did not enjoy the flavor, and thought it was a total waste of money. My recommendation - if you really want amazing, out-of-this-world tacos, go to Choza Taqueria at the Gotham West Market. Much better, tastier, fresher tacos, and you can get three for $8. And, for all those reviewers who keep on praising this place - stop smoking acapulco gold! You're confusing all of us by going to this place with the munchies.

First time in Chelsea Market and absolutely loved it. We went for lunch early int the morning so weren't too hungry but had the chicken taco with guac and their homemade hot sauce salsa on the side, it was scrumptious! Everything was delicious and so fresh and it was super juicy, had the taco with flour tortilla - wanted to go back but didn't have time. So can't wait have it again!

I was born and raised in Mexico City. I've tried tacos all my life and I'm completely sure Los Tacos No. 1 is  a great place to eat real high-quality Mexican tacos. Quesadillas are the best, even better than many I've eaten in Mexico.

I think I'm in love. My new favorite Mexican jump off. All you need is the adobada especial!! Thank me later. So freaking good you'll slap your mama! Carne Asada was also pretty good. Free salsa and condiments too!
OMG!!!!!!!!!!  Just had my first tacogasm!!!!!!!!!! Seriously the best tacos in the world......
Amo este lugar!  Soy de Texas pero estos tacos son casi tan buenos!  Seriously, I don't know much spanish but I do have an expertise in Tacos.  Daddy like!
The best tacos I've ever had! I'm from Austin, Texas, a city known for their tacos and these blew anything in Austin out of the water.
The best taco in town!! They are amazing! We go there almost every week. They are very fast and friendly. During the weekend the line may be a bit longer.

Came across this place while wandering through Chelsea Market, and it is SO delicious! Ordered the adobada mulas-around $4, and you get a pretty nice portion that comes very quickly. Was here around 8:30 on a Wednesday night, and the line was very small and moved quickly. The pork is well marinated and cooked very well, somehow tender and crispy at the same time. There was a bit of kick to it, and the corn tortilla tasted fresh and delicious. I would do the long walk from my office across town to this place any day. Can't wait to come back!
