A taco express stop.Hailing from Southern California and a member of the Hispanic race myself with an extensive history in taco consumption.Authentic, is the word I'm applying here to describe Los Tacos No. 1. Food was great and delivered timely. Only down part is there is no area to sit an enjoy the food nearby. Also the Tacos are a little in the upper price range ($3.75 for a taco) but the high demand of authentic Mexican food with a low supply justify for me. Or at least that's what I tell myself.

let me just say, I'm not a crazy fan of tacos to begin with but these tacs would have be going back for thirds. Chelsea Market is located on 15th and 9th av. and has numerous restaurants, clothing stores, grocery stores and more. It's a really funky place to just hang because they seem to have everything. Inside the market is a place called Los Tacos No. 1 and it was beyond what I expected. Their tacos are around $3 each which is not going to burn a hole in my wallet, and each taco is unique. They even sell a cactus taco (although I'm not too big of a fan). The pork taco is the best. It's served with pineapple on the top and they ask you if you want all the toppings. It's juicy and moist and everything I was anticipating.

I didn't really know what to expect. The smell was incredible. Fast paced, great prices it's hidden in Chelsea market so what's the catch. Nothing. I had the steak quesadilla and it blew my mind! It even came with guac, which most places want you to pay more for! The meat was fresh aromatic and juicy. Plenty of salsa lime and radish to help yourself to. The quesadilla had the cheese all crispy where it had overspilled on to the hot plate DELICIOUS! I will definitely be back maybe in 5 mins because my mouth is still watering!

Hands down my FAVORITE tacos, possibly in the whole entire world. They are california style and all the flavors are amazing but I especially love the pork tacos! Its like extra crispy extra flavorful bacon with a great sauce and other toppings! You order at the register and they ask you what kind of tortilla you want over the counter and what kind of toppings. I also love that they have a variety of self serve salsa to add to the wonderful tacos that are already so full of flavor!

Oh I love Chelsea market , and this is a must when you are there. Super fresh and authentic( even down to the soda which is in glass bottles made with real sugar from mexico). Top the tacos how you want and enjoy. But good luck finding space because it is packed there.

Honestly, this place is really over-hyped. The meat was not that flavorful and the salsa was bland. I had the adobada taco, the carne asada, and the pollo asada. All were very mediocre. I appreciated the black ceramic bowls that held the sauces though because they do that in Mexico. But seriously, the meat was pretty bland and disappointing. If you want really good tacos, go to Tacos El Bronco in sunset park in Brooklyn. The meat there is SO flavorful AND it's cheaper (only $1.50 per taco whereas here it's around $3.75 per taco).But then again I'm from California, so my standards for Mexican food is higher than most.

Five stars for the food, three stars for the service. But it's a hole-in-the-wall, order at the counter and sit on the floor to eat type of place - who cares about the service?I came in with a friend on a Sunday night around 7:30, and there was a line of maybe ten or so people waiting to order. I went with one each of the pollo, carne asada, and adobada tacos. The system is very confusing - after you order, you go to the other end of the counter, where you're supposed to hand your receipt to the employees there. They will then make your tacos for you. I was under the impression that they were given the orders by the people at the register, and you were supposed to use the receipt to claim the tacos after they were made, but no - if you don't give your receipt to them, they will never make the tacos. So hand your receipt to them as soon as you get to that end of the counter.At the register, I was able to order the adobada, but once I handed my receipt over, they said they were out of it. Obviously some logistical issues going on here that they should fix, but whatever - I just asked for a second carne asada taco. I love that guac comes automatically with the taco.There's no seating, so you have to go back into Chelsea Market and hope for an open counter, at which there will also be no seating - strictly stand-and-eat only - or just ignore the signs that say you can't sit on the floor and sit on the floor anyway. (If you don't want people to sit on the floor, maybe you should provide some damn chairs.) The tacos were totally delicious - messy as all hell, especially since I was sitting on the floor and basically hovering over the plate so that all falling ingredients would land on it, but worth the trouble.Overpriced? Yes. But I'd come back.
This place is always a go to whenever I'm in the city. Closest I can get to authentic Mexican tacos, and fairly priced as well.

I had the beef platter. With some fresh grilled beef, beans, onions and some other vegetables like tomatoes. Guacamol was too less... same here for the cheese. There was no bread or tacco to the platter which i think is a bit stupid. I dont wanna eat a beef salad...  I want some taccos or nachos at least to dip the shit

I was suspicious at first because it is hard to find a good taco place with reasonable prices in the city. Los Tacos proves me wrong! It is housed inside Chelsea Market and there is a long line waiting. It did move really fast and we were ordering our share in no time. I got the Carne Asada and Pollo Tacos to go. They were all freshly made and you can add your own hot sauce after it is made. I like how it is made to order and it is not too stuffy or overly greasy. I would recommend at least 3 to be filling. My recommendation is eat it while it is hot because the shells are grilled slightly so if you wait too long, it gets soggy after a while.

The only eatery at Chelsea Market sans the market/neighbourhood vibe ...customer service is pretty matter of fact :) but the food is awesome and fresh....the lineups are testament to them.Dishes tried: pork tacos (even the traditional mild hot sauce is spicy!)Repeat: yes

Just trust the reviews and go!  The adobado tacos are out of this world perfect.  Don't mess around with the others.  I tried it and one of the carne asada.   The carne asada was good, but the adobado was music to my mouth.
Best tacos in NYC...hands down! You do not need to go anywhere else...just go to Chelsea Market. There is nothing left to say...

Totally authentic and perfectly delicious. As a native Texan who frequently doubts the capability of NYC to produce excellent Mexican food, I was blown away. An absolute must if you're visiting Chelsea Market!Highly recommend the adobada tacos and carne asada quesadilla!

Visiting Google one day for work, I planned my day specifically so I could visit Los Tacos No.1.  I mean, you know, priorities.  The main thing I miss about working in the Bronx is the great, cheap Mexican food.  No chance I was going to pass up the chance to get my fix while I could given that Midtown lunch options are generally horrible.  I got here right when they were opening so there was no line.  Los Tacos is kind of in an odd pot crammed with 2 other vendors but it's actually the size of a typical taqueria.  I got my food quickly and made my way to a table outside to feast.I got a pollo asada taco as well as the much raved about adobada taco (roast pork).  First off, as others have noted the corn tortilla is the way to go here.  It's the best tortilla I've had on the East Coast.  The adobada was a bit overhyped but was still great.  Still if you like rich, caramelized pork, this bud's for you.  I actually enjoyed the pollo asada a bit more.  Probably one of the best tacos I've ever had.  The given toppings were sufficient if a bit heavy handed but complemented the tacos well (my apologies for not remembering the list), and there's always more stuff on the side (radish, hot sauce, etc.) if you need it.If you're in or around the Chelsea market and you love Mexican food, this is a must visit.  Outside of the Bronx and parts of Brooklyn and Queens I'm not sure if there are any serious competitors.  I have to assume there usually is a line--others on here certainly say that--and I'd say that it's probably worth it as long as it doesn't go over half an hour.  Great Mexican food is hard to come by in Manhattan, especially for a reasonable price.  I'd kill a man to have this as a lunch option by me (maybe not but it is really good).

I came here twice in one week...no shame.Okay, so you're going to be waiting in a line, after having pushed through piles of annoying tourists who stop to take pictures in the middle of Chelsea Market, but it's only a small price to pay to get to Los Tacos. As long as no one gets in your way to get here, you're all good.I've had my fair share of tacos in the city and in LA, and Los Tacos is one of the taquerias I can say reign supreme. It's almost always a long line, but it moves quickly. The first time I came, I will admit I may have slightly shoved someone to get in line (more like actually gave them the biggest death stare), but after all the hype that this place has received, I was excited and ravenous.I got two carne asada tacos, and while $3.75 for one seems outrageous, it really isn't for what you get here. You get a choice between flour and corn tortillas, and you can get three kinds of salsa along with guacamole included, and if you think about the charge at Chipotle, the price really isn't much for the tacos here. The steak was literally falling out of the taco because there was so much meat, so you really get your money's worth here. I liked my tacos with a little spritz of lime to wake them up even more, and I was actually heartbroken when I found the carnage left on my plate. To conclude my first time here, I tried both my friends' tamarind and jamaica drinks, which were a perfect way to end the meal.My second time back here was just as incredible, if not more. Los Tacos taught me why Vampire Weekend wrote a song titled Horchata; I became hooked right on the first sip. I thought it was a milk-type drink at first, but it's actually a drink made of ground grains and spices. As if I didn't eat enough carbs, I'm happy I found a way I can drink them now, too. On this time, I had the adobada, which was just as good as the carne asada I had the first time. I liked seeing the guy carve it fresh from the revolving contraption it was on.Los Tacos really is my favorite taqueria in the city. It's pretty straightforward; it has a small menu and it's all done so well. I can't believe it's taken me so long to try this place, but now I know where I'm always going to head to for a quick bite whenever I'm in the Chelsea area.

5 star hands down!!!These are the best tacos I have ever had! You don't know what you're missing till you try it. I've been meaning to come here and I finally did the other day and I cannot wait to go back. Everything was sooooo beyond delicious & absolutely Devine! Their guacamole and chips is also something you shouldn't pass on! They're my all time favs! What are you doing? Go there now!!

holy moly these tacos are the bomb dot com nestled in the bustling chelsea market is this wonderful hole in the wallonce you arrive you see an assembly line: one person making round mounds of dough and producing fresh tortillas right before your eyesanother person grilling the meat and shaving off what looks like a kebob wheel (like the ones you see in gyro places) another person assembling the tacos and adding the toppings. the adobada  was my favorite -thats the meat coming off the kebob wheel. It was so juicy and flavorful.  I also tried the steak (which was a tad bit dry) and my friend had the cactus and said it was nothing special.  Also wash this all down with the horchata drink I would come back and just order the pork tacos!

Fantastic Mexican food at a very good price. I ordered the chicken taco, and the chicken quesadilla, both of which were fantastic! The line may seem long but they are very efficient and it's worth the wait.

I came here with a few friends for a spontaneous meet up after work. And let me say, we were all incredibly sad to have finished our food!We waited about 10 minutes on line (this was around 6PM) and ordered the chicken, steak, and pork tacos and also the quesadillas. We also got the chips and guac on the side. Each item is $3 - $3.50 which is a little bit on the pricier side for tacos but for NYC standards, it's a steal!The tacos itself were just amazing. Absolutely delicious. The pork taco especially was the best out of the other two because it was just so tender and flavorful.The guac was pretty insignificant (I've had better) but you're crazy if you're just here for guac. This is probably the best taco joint in NYC!
Los Tacos No. 1 has the best tacos around!But because it is located in Chelsea Market, and space is limited, I recommend going at an "off-time" for an enjoyable experience.Aproveche!
The best tacos in the city amazing if you want to go for a walk to mexico just go there The tortilla is fresh the ingredients are fresh Nothing like a fresh taco Tacos tacos tacos

Literally the best tacos I can remember eating! My husband grew up in Southern California and often laments the lack of good authentic Mexican food on the east coast. He also thought these were some of the best tacos he has ever eaten! He even went back through the line to get another one after he was done with his first order! Prices were great too for the typically pricey Chelsea Market. We will definitely be coming back!

So many shops in Chelsea Market and yet this is the one with the line (aside from Fat Witch, which is understandably crazy). $3-4 tacos $4-5 quesadillas seem a bit high, but taste wise, these guys got a lot going for them.Got the Carne Asada taco ($3.75) and Nopal quesadilla ($4). The taco was amazing, guacamole on top added great flavor to the moist meat, added medium salsa on top for the extra kick it needed. The quesadilla was okay, wasn't a big fan on the way they prepared the cactus. Would stick to another meat next time.Quick despite the line, able to add your own sauces/salsas. Wish there was a place to sit to enjoy a very messy meal.

Came here yesterday with my group of friends. It seems like there is a long line, but the line moves rather quickly. After taking your order, you give your receipt to the chefs and they remember who ordered what. I had 1 chicken taco, one pork taco, and 1 steak taco along with some horchata. The tacos looked so appetizing and they definitely did not disappoint! Came with a ton of flavor! It was a little more on the spicier side for me since I can't handle a ton of spiciness. Other than that, it was pretty much on point! It was my first time trying the horchata and it was pretty awesome. Has a floral taste to it!
best Taco in NYC~ super tasty and satisfying~!very authentic and joyful experience in Chelsea Market~!

This place has amazing tacos.  Get the carne asada on a corn tortilla instead of the flour and you won't be sorry.  The corn tortilla tasted fresh and homemade so you can't go wrong.  The chicken taco was amazing even my 11 month old baby liked it .  The adobada which was their pork was too spicy for me but then again I'm not big into spicy food but if you are you will love it.  The line seemed long but it moves fast so don't be scared.  I didn't mind that were was no place to sit since I ate my tacos in 2.5 second anyway.  The only downside of my experience was that I only got 3 tacos.  I'll be going back and this time I have plans to load up! Eat here and you will be in taco heaven.

Glad I made the trip to try out the tacos. Absolutely delicious. I got the secret queso taco which is also fantastic but it's fried cheese which can be a bit much and I love cheese! But eating some of my carne asada without the queso taco shell was even better because of the quality of the meat, salsa and guac. I would definitely recommend this spot.
Best tacos hands down. I have had many tacos but Los Tacos No.1 takes the cake. It really is number one. Super cheap and worth the hype.

Truly worth the trip to chelsea market for these wonderful flavorful tacos!!The staff is amazing! The place has no seating at all! You just have to grab your tacos, grab a place by the counter and enjoy these pieces of heaven!

Quite simply the best taco I've ever had. I tried both the carne asada and the adobada (marinated pork) tacos, and they were absolutely scrumptious. The meats are seasoned perfectly. The various toppings including the pico de gallo and salsas (varying degrees of spice) are spot on. The tortilla itself is fresh and doesn't have that 'floury' taste (if you know what I mean). Really can't go wrong for the price. I could probably eat about 10 and enjoy each last one more than the previous. A must have!

Best authentic tacos in NYC! Verified by many of our authentic friends. ;-) It is our standard stop for friends visiting the city. It is hard to find open seating in the Chelsea Market hallways though, so be prepared to eat them standing.
Best tacos and quesadillas in NYC. Tortillas are made literally in front of you, and the service is superb. I recommend the carne asada and the adobada :) THE BEST.

OOOHhhhh Lordt! kldjfa!jksdhf!When I tell you. Like... TELL YOU "This was the best chicken taco I had in my life"I mean - This was the best freaking taco I've had in my life. I arrived earlier than my date for our dinner reservations for Buddakan, right next door.  Since I was starved, I decided to take a walk through Chelsea market and discovered Los Tacos was actually in there. Line was quick and the meal received in less than 4 minutes. Once I bit into my meal... the motherly looking woman near me was just spared from getting a slap. You heard me. The food's sooo good you can smack someone's momma.If you don't believe me go try it for yourself. Just wear something with pockets.Anyway, my friend was running late and I almost wished she was so late we'd lose our reservations and would have to dine at Los Tacos. She made it right on time, unfortunately.But until next time... I'm just salivating
Nothing I'm gonna say that hasn't already been said. Stop reading and get your ass over there!!! Done, out.

I'm from California and I have eaten some pretty great tacos from California and Mexico! Los Tacos No.1 tacos are up to par! They are each fully loaded with meat. You can't go wrong with what you choose. There are not many taco places like this in New York City so to have one in Chelsea is amazing! I enjoy the flavor and the friendly staff. They are welcoming and talk to you when you sit at the bench after you picked up your order. I ordered the adobado and carne asade taco. The spice and the sauces that go with it are phenomenal! I wish I could have more, but the only problem is the price. I'm use to seeing tacos for around $1.25 but seeing one taco for $3.75 is a bit much for me. Once in a while, I will drop by and eat some!

This place is a hidden gem!!! So authentic, fresh tasting, reasonable prices (especially for the area). I tried their carne tacos on corn tortilla which was very flavorful and delicious. Comes with cilantro, onions, guacamole and salsa. The tacos were def good but I think the star of the show at this place was their carne quesadilla especial! Picture a quesadilla inside of an empanada type casing. DELICIOUS! Chips and salsa was also very good. If you like spicy, this is the place to come to. Everyone working here were also very friendly. I ate a chili that was hotter than I thought and one of the workers got my a glass of water to help. Very nice. I'll def be back!!!!

I got an al pastor taco and a chicken taco. The boy got tacos and also a quesadilla, which surprisingly looked exactly like a taco except with the addition of cheese, so don't picture the typical large folded over quesadilla in this case. I liked the al pastor taco's topping of pineapple, or something yellow pickled. The pico de gallo here is very fresh-tasting and flavorful, too. They have a nice salsa bar.

The tacos here are juicy and delicious! What more can a SoCal native ask for in NYC? This is a standing room only kind of place, so it's quick to get in and out with your food. You can also search the halls of Chelsea Market for an open table if you want to sit.Tacos in order of favorites:1) Adobada - marinated pork2) Pollo3) Carne AsadaI haven't tried the nopal (cactus) taco yet, but maybe next time! I love the way they lay out their salsas, roasted arbol peppers and limes. It's convenient for  dressing your tacos to your hearts content. The hype is real - this place serves up no-nonsense quality tacos at a decent price.
California deliciousness has arrived. Make sure to lime up your taco, like 4 limes per taco - because this is just how we do it!

Adobada Tacos!!!!!!!!!!!I tried all four of their tacos but this is their best one and the only one that matters.  They were all good but adobada made the biggest impact.  I'd rather get three adobadas than getting a variety.  The adobada is a marinated rotisserie pork with pineapple (similar to al pastor) on a handmade corn tortilla.  It's so thinly sliced, juicy, a little fatty, sexy, buttery and tasty. You can get the either the taco for $3 or the quesadilla (a bigger taco with cheese) for $4, both are amazing.  Wash it down with some horchata or Mexican coca cola and your day just got better. The line moves quick and the staff is super chill and friendly.  No seats or tables.  Minimal communal counter space.  Eat standing or you can walk around the chelsea market and find a bench to sit and eat.

As a San Diego native with a father from Tijuana, I think I have the authority to say that these are the best tacos in NYC.Huge thumbs up for perfectly nailing the experience of street tacos in Tijuana.  The smoky flavor of the meats and salsa.  The radishes, limes and grilled onions.The Al Pastor is a special standout as are the home made corn tortillas.Also, ** pro-tip ** ask for the Vampiro!  Trust me.The last thing I'd say is that Christian, Tyler and Kyle are also three of the nicest guys you'll meet.  I wish them all of the success that I know is coming their way.
Best tacos I ever had!!! I'm already planning my next trip. The chicken taco was good but the carne asada was perfect the meat was season to perfection

BEST TACOS EVER! I only tried the pollo asado and I wished I tried the others as well! IT WAS SO GOOD! My friend got two more after he ordered one! Get your tacos with corn tortillas for a more authentic taco! The horchata was also good! This spot is touristy, but don't be put off by the long line. It moves pretty fast! Once you order, make sure you give the receipt the people next to the cashier that are making your food, so they know your order! I would recommend coming at an off time, as there are already so much people in Chelsea Market alone. I will definitely come back! P.S. It is completely normal to crave for these tacos after you tried them. I know I am!

These tacos are amazing! Line can get long, especially if you come on the weekends but it moves quickly. I got the steak and adobo tacos based on the reviews I read and I definitely recommend it. I love how the tacos are straight up meat, guac and your choice of the amount of spice you want from the salsa bar. No cheese or sour cream, I'm not a fan of those two anyway and they were definitely not needed. Some good old authentic yummy tacos that don't require anything else.My two tacos came out to around $6, they're small but they filled me up pretty well. Beware of "seating" as it can get pretty crowded. You'll be lucky enough to find a table just to eat off of. But it's worth it! I will definitely come back when I'm in New York again!
They best tacos in Manhattan - hands down. I would go here when I missed LA style tacos. A bit pricey, but cheaper than flying to Mexico for decent tacos, right?

Good tacos, but new york prices. I had pork, chicken, beef, and cactus. Ranked in that order. They are very flavorful. They look small, but fill you up pretty quickly. Would probably not recommend the cactus. The pork and chicken were great. It's new york, so they go for $3-3.50 a taco. Not terrible, but not LA either.

This place lived up to every single expectation I had. Quite possibly the best tacos in nyc. I usually only order chicken tacos but decided to try the steak as well. So glad I did because it blew the chicken taco away! I also really love that they have classic coke bottles. It is quite hectic and crazy so prepare yourself but it's worth every second! I just wish there were more places to sit or even more high tops to just stand and eat. Can't wait to come back
the tacos here are amazing! they make it fast and serve you with a salsa bar but there is barely any place to eat. a lot of the times, i'm eating standing

Goodness gracious. These tacos are amazing and bursting with so much flavor. I had the carne asada and cannot wait to come back to try the other ones. The steak was slightly crisped and spiced, and was perfect with the avocado sauce. Surprisingly, they piled a good amount on the corn tortilla.I'm drooling thinking about it now. I'm going to be thinking about their tacos for a long time.

I stopped by while browsing Chelsea Market and got Carne asada (steak) and pork, marinated.  They were 3.50 and 3.00, respectively, a bit on the expensive side for a single taco but not that bad considering that Chelsea market is a big tourist spot.  I liked the taste of both meat, but also liked that they added guacamole for the steak taco.  Garnish for the pork one was pretty good too. As everyone may know it is very hard to get a seat in Chelsea market for eating.  Not just seating, but even standing for lunch or dinner.  This is pretty convenient option in that sense, too.  Just keep in mind that it will be very hot to grab for the first 5 minutes or so.

Excellent tacos! Tried one of each (chicken, pork, and steak) with all the toppings (fresh guac, cilantro, salsa, etc.) All three were equally fantastic, so fresh and the flavor was awesome. They come on perfect corn tortillas and you can load them up at their topping bar. Three is more than enough to satisfy anyone's appetite, and I would recommend trying all 3 because each is unique and delicious in flavor. Definitely one of my favorite places to go in Chelsea Market
Hands down the best tacos in the city. Staff is always on point and super friendly. Keep up the good work !
I have not had better tacos in the city. Every type of taco is delicious! Despite the long lines here, I keep coming back for more!

Do not be deterred by the long line!  It moves fast.  As someone who eats A LOT, three tacos are actually more than enough in one sitting...  Although a fourth is pretty tempting.  Huge fan of the carne asada taco!  Be sure to grab plenty of condiments while you're there :)

The most awesome tacos and quesadillas I have ever had. The only thing is that it is quite expensive. Especially for the small size tacos and quesadillas like they serve here. It is $3.50 for a taco and $4.50 for the quesadilla. Overall the food was the one of the best Mexican food I have ever had in New York. It's also includes all the small Mexican joints I have been to in Queens and Brooklyn) I came here with a friend, we were looking for a cheap Mexican joint to eat and I am so glad we found Los Tacos. The quesadilla was just like a taco, but with melted cheese in it. It was fresh, delicious, and with everything good. Try not to go at noon, because you'll will end up waiting for 30-40 min in a line.

By far this is the best taco spot in NYC.  No doubt about it.   The only complaint is the setup as there is no room to eat your food.  It pretty much becomes a mosh pit of people holding their tacos and trying to nudge their way in for the salsa on the counter.

OMG TACOS!  There are few places with tacos like this in NYC! Cheap! Fresh! Delicious!The only downside is no seating, though as long as it's not the weekend you'll find a spot in the market. Every time I go to Chelsea market, I plan to tey something new but I always fall back on Los Tacos, and am never disappointed. Had the bahn mi place-that was a mistake. I prefer the chicken tacos, the pork are a little greasy/fatty for my taste, but the husband loves the pork. Get the chia and guacamole, and get yourself a Fanta. It's the drink that goes with tacos (assuming  a beer is not an option).

This is what you call Authentic Mexican. Steak supposedly has more flavor and it rocks my world so I refuse to try anything else. I want to give it 3 stars because a quesadilla really looks like a taco except a tiny bit bigger but its soo worth it. I've come 3x since I tried it and my bf is even in love.PLEASE GIVE BIGGER PORTIONS! It will make it so much worthy. It's already a bit too much.

Keepsake rosaries 25 Hester Pl, Garnerville, NY 10923 I sent in roses from my husbands funeral to be made into rosary beads as  this company claims they do with a check for 90.00. They cashed the check and it is a  year and a half later and I still have not received the rosarys I have called numerous times left VM messages and wrote a certified letter with no luck so be ware of this company they just steal your money

These tacos are everything you've been looking for on this planet. They are authentic TJ tacos that melt with every bite. They are pricee, but well worth it. I suggest between 3-4 tacos per person. Order the Adabada Tacos, they are pork and slow cooked, which makes it melt.If I had to eat one thing the rest of my life, this would be a top contender. Thank me later and come here to eat. There are no tables, this is a walk up and stand at the taco counter type of place. No time to waste, this fits perfectly in NYC, located inside of the Chelsea Market.
The reviews do not lie. The tacos are delicious! There's a line but it moves fast. Take it to go and eat upstairs on the high line under the stars.

Pretty good tacos, but the ordering process was a zoo.  And one of the guys working there had a real bad attitude.  We ordered our tacos at the counter and paid for them, but no one told us we had to bring our receipt to one of the guys working behind the counter.  After we realized that they weren't calling out numbers and that we weren't getting our food, we showed our receipts to one of the guys working there and it was if we were totally inconveniencing him.  Sorry dude.  Just wanted the tacos we paid for.  Anyways, the tacos were good, but with the bad attitude, I probably won't return.

SO flavorful. Best tacos I've had so far in NY. The adobada and the steak are my favorite. The quesadillas aren't your traditional quesadillas--they seem like a somewhat larger version of the tacos with cheese. (BUT STILL SO GOOD!)
Great location and good tacos. The line is worth waiting in.

This is the only state-side taco place I can confidently bring my dad to. He's from D. F. and if he approves, that's all you need to know. Oh and the Nopales plates are the best. And the bistec.And the horchata water.And... just don't worry 'bout it and order one of everything.

Talk about amazing!! Me and my wife constantly go to Mexican restaurants and always have a way the food could taste more authentic. Not here!! Everything was fresh, perfectly seasoned and quick delivery. They offer traditional Mexican juices along with their amazing food.

Woooooow! Will never forget this experience! It was actually there, in Chelsea market, where I had my first taco ever ;) Was really hungry and passed this stand by chance. Ordered randomly and was very suspicious about the strange looking thing on my plate and then, BOOOOM! Never in my life had I tried something that looked so ugly and tasted so amazing! I found those tacos delicious and cannot wait to visit NYC to have some more!

I usually avoid Chelsea Market because it's so hectic, and becoming filled with tourists more and more. But after hearing Los Tacos was serving vegetarian tacos with grilled cactus, I had to come.I tried both their flour, and corn tortilla with the two nopal tacos ($2.50) I got. Either one is a good choice, they're both pretty tasty, it's just a preference of corn or flour. The cactus itself wasn't what I expected, but not in a bad way. It reminded me a lot of eating okra. It's got a slimy exterior, but its crisp when you bite into it. I really enjoyed the taste, and it's definitely now one of my favorite vegetarian taco choices. Grab tons of napkins, these things get crazy messy. Also, any taco joint that gives you free guacamole on your tacos is solid in my book.The only downside of this place is location. I really wish they had another storefront away from Chelsea Market. When you get your food, you're left walking around the place looking for a table, maybe even a just a seat. Food is fresh, and made to order, and staff is really friendly. They let you put on your own salsas and hot sauce at the counter which is nice. I came right as they opened to avoid the rush, and there was already a line piling up, so the sooner you can get here, the better. I can't speak for the meat tacos, but the vegetarian ones are definitely worth the hassle!

I'm not really sure how to put this.......This is the best tacos I've had yet!  I ordered the marinated pork on a flour tortilla.  Put some lime and mild salsa on the taco before I ate it.  Could have killed like 5 of those things.  My wife got chicken and loved it.  We also shared a side of guac and chips.  Everything was soooooooooo good!!
Love it, the tacos are amazing.  Pricey, but it's the trendy area so it's expected.  The workers are incredible.  My fav. taco spot right now! Hope they expand to more locations.

Yum yum. Fast and delicious. Reasonably priced. Your choice of corn or flour tortillas and the counters set up so you can pile on however much salsa/hot sauce/lemon/lime you desire. Will definitely return!

I absolutely love tacos. I am a huge critic when it comes to them.Well if you want some amazing tacos, stop right here. No way you walk away disappointed. Like they are really good. . Right around the corner there is also a mini donut shop. Yeah, thats amazing too.

It's pretty audacious for a place to call themselves "Los Tacos No. 1". How can they make that claim? Have they tried every taco in the world?Well, I also haven't but I'm on board: these are truly los tacos numero uno.It's a little pricey for a taco (3.75 per) but for perfectly spiced and cooked steak, soft but slightly crispy tortillas, and the greatest guac I've ever had, it's totally worth it.It's tough to eat because counter space is so scarce but if you walk around Chelsea Market, you'll find plenty of tables to enjoy the food.

First time in Chelsea Market and I was trying to figure out what I wanted to eat, so I stopped at Los Tacos because I really do like tacos! If you go here, expect to be in a long line of people (especially if you're going at a peak time like 1pm on a Saturday). But the line moves fairly quickly as the staff are really efficient while not compromising on freshness or quality of the food. Menu is simple, with only four options for tacos: carne asada, abodaba, pollo, and nopal. I got the carne asada and abodaba and both were fantastic and unique from one another. Meat was very tender, very flavorful, and they generously fill the tacos. The corn tortillas were fantastic, unlike other store-bought corn tortillas I've gotten in the past. These were a lot softer/more tender, while still having the great corn flavor. The only reason I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars is because of the price ($3-$3.75 for a taco depending on which one you get, which makes sense for being in Chelsea Market), and the lack of seating in the area (I had to wander around the market and luckily was able to share a table with a few other strangers.)But overall, great place!

Flour tortilla steak and pork tacos are the best. Cactus and chicken are okay but lack the same flavor profile as the slow cooked meats. Horchata is popular and light but I prefer my drinks are lot richer. Sodas are real sugar variety not corn syrup so keep that in mind too.

This tiny taco hits you with a might bite in flavor. After getting a food coma from the Swiss Roll from Empire Bakery, I needed something salty to stabilize my blood sugar levels but was too full to eat a lot. Lo and behold, a taco place with a limited menu that actually has a vegetarian option! You place your order at the right side of the counter, pay, present your receipt to one of the friendly cooks on the left side, pick corn or wheat tortilla and it's cooked up before your hungry eyes. The nopal had square chunks, tasted as if somehow they managed to get fresh nopal and not the overly salted and vinegared nopal from the cans. The cilantro, onions and guacamole on top made it tasty and the salsa, tomatillo sauce, and pepper sauce you can load up on from the filled earthen bowls before you made it even tastier. I'd come back for the nopal taco here anytime.

Best tacos/quesadillas I have ever had. I especially like the chicken.  I don't think any place in NYC comes close (for tacos). The owners need to partner up with a big player and open many more locations.  They will become rich beyond their wildest dreams and be doing a mitzvah by providing New Yorkers with a more delicious alternative to Chipotle.   I only wish they had burritos on the menu, not sure why they would not.I had originally given this place 5 stars but I'm taking away 1 star after going back several times.  Two reasons.  First, their stupid retro-novelty 3 sip soda bottles, if I'm spending 14+ bucks on 3 quesadillas then kindly give me an ample amount of beverage! I literally drank the entire tiny bottle between paying and collecting the food (no exaggeration).  Sure, those bottles have more personality than a can, but I'm there to get my eat on, not appreciate some trendy/eclectic notion of what soda once was. Second reason for losing a star is that the lady making the tortillas kept speaking on the phone, touching the phone with her gloved hand, and then going back to making them with same gloved hand. Not at all hygienic. For the love of G-d, while making  tortillas by hand, change your glove if you are going to touch the disgusting phone receiver!

Not often I discover amazing food in high profile places at very good price. We were just walking through the Chelsea Market and saw some people eating some awesome looking snack size tacos, and when asked where they got their food; they pointed me in one of the corners of Chelsea market. No tables, no room to stand, get in line order your tacos and be amazed. We had chicken tacos on fresh made corn tortilla, when I say fresh made I mean someone back their was making it from scratch and serving then hot of the flat top. The hot salsa and pico were out of this world. It is the handy Mexican food made right. I can't wait till I go back. As always you have to try it to believe it. #happyeating

Best tacos I've had in New York. The chef wearing a Padres hat served as a good omen, because I haven't had Mexican food this good since I was in San Diego.Honestly, you can order anything here and it's going to be bomb. I had the chicken and carne asada, both so good you won't want to go anywhere else. No, there's no place to sit (there are standing stations) but you don't need to spend a long time chowing down on these creations. Plus it's cheap!

Everywhere I travel, I try to find the best pork taco on a corn tortilla. This place is number one so far! Their corn tortillas are handmade right in front of you, and you can absolutely taste the freshness. Los tacos son muy bien!
I moved back to Austin a couple years ago and am still craving Los Tacos No. 1.

The new highlight at Chelsea Market. Their Adobada is a must have with that fattiness and beautiful charring on the edges. The cactus is actually the best I've had as it tastes towards eggplant, so don't be worried.

Best tacos in Manhattan! The al pastor tacos are to die for! The tortillas were tasty and fresh! Although there isn't enough place to sit down the food is worth standing for! Make sure you ask for your tacos on a corn tortilla:)
Best tacos in NYC, fresh, cheap and amazing. But the *thing that makes me come back time and time again on our holiday is the Horchata! You won't be disappointed, this Mexican cold eggnog is choice

Probably one of the best tacos in NY that I've had so far. I've never been to Cali, so I can't say it beats LA tacos, but at least in NY, los tacos no 1 is truly #1. The tacos always taste fresh, they give you the guac for free (which is a big plus for guac lovers), and they also have other items including the horchata drink (freshly brewed from a huge mason looking jar) and Mexican plates. I've gotten both the pork and chicken tacos, and I think for its quality, the price is not bad at all - although I could honestly eat way more than just 2 tacos for ~$6. If you're stopping by Chelsea Market, this place is a must! The only con is that there are no seats - so you either have to stand or walk around to find a spot that probably isn't close to los tacos, but I didn't mind walking and exploring other things in the market. I come here every time I go to Chelsea, and have never had a bad experience. I wish they had this near me :(

So I HATE going to Chelsea market - but a friend recommended to me this place as the best place for tacos and as I am a sucker for such things, I put my aversion to the venue aside and ventured out on a Saturday afternoon.  I don't eat pork or beef, so chicken taco it was.  Amazing.  The corn tortilla - if you get the flour, you are a FOOL  - was the best tortilla I have ever had.  The chicken was grilled right, a very healthy portion.  I had it with everything - onions, cilantro, quac and salsa.  I think the flavors might have been sharper if I went without the guac (they use dairy in their recipe).  I tried both the medium and spicy salsas and both were excellent.I will be back since I now know where to get the best taco in town.

Keep your filthy fingers out of the communal radishes and limes!Best tacos that I've found in the city. The line is long but moves pretty quickly. Hand the one of the prep guys your ticket after you order (they'll be asking for it), tell him if you want corn or flour tortillas, and if you want everything on it. And don't be afraid to order the horchata if you'll feeling thirsty.  It's delicious.
Those were some damn good tacos. We were a little concerned by the line upon arriving but it moved quickly. The tacos had a lot of flavour going for it and well worth the stop
After apartment hunting all day I stopped in and was NOT disappointed. There is no where to sit but that is part of the cham (=
It's pretty good - but I wouldn't say the best tacos I've ever had.  it's really great that they have Cactus tacos for vegetarians!

These might be some of the best tacos I have ever had, and it one of the only places I've been able to find horchatas in NYC. It's pretty cheap too- four tacos, a bag of chips, and two drinks came to $26. I got the pork tacos, and although they were very spicy, they were also very amazing (my mouth is watering just thinking about them). The chips were the right level of thickness, and the salsa was perfect. It is in Chelsea Market though, so don't expect to find anywhere to sit- we ate at a standing table before continuing to shop.Worth it though. So, so worth it.

Best tacos ive ever had in this area. The chicken tacos are a must. Definitely go on a weekday when theres no line. Even on a weekend, the wait is worth it. There will be a bunch of sauces that you can add but the tacos are so perfectly made that they aren't needed.   The texture and combination of flavors make for an experience. The tacos arent too small or too big. Getting 3 on an empty stomach is the perfect amount. The negatives include no place to sit and the crowd on the weekends. But if you dont mind that then you definitely wont regret it.
These might be the best tacos I've ever had. Growing up in Texas, those are strong words but these are some seriously good tacos.
Best taco in NYC!  Indeed!  My favorite is their chicken taco, freshly made and great portion size!
I am from Los Angeles and come from Mexican heritage.  Believe me when I say, these are the best tacos north of the border. Period

These tacos are amazing. You can see the whole process with their open kitchen. I love the decor. I find this place to be the best out of all of the stores in Chelsea Market.Tips: - Get the flour tortilla. So soft and goes so well with the meat. - Get the steak! I'm usually a chicken person but I think that the beef is jucier. - Do not be intimidated by the long line. They go by very quickly and it is definitely worth it. - Make sure to give your receipt to the people who make it or else your order will never come through!!

I haven't tasted much of their menu but the little I have had was amazing. That adobada taco is so damn good... I mean THIS is how you season meat!!! So well seasoned and delicious, and it's filled up. My only thing is that it's $3.75 for 1. Sheesh. Should be more like $3. Just another way that NYC robs people. Also the Chelsea market is overpriced anyway so I figure that's it..

Came here on a Thursday night around 715pm and there was barely a line. I chose the adobada taco and especial quesadilla with chicken (you have the option to add meat). The adobada taco was good, but I thought that the pork meat was actually a bit too salty for my taste. Adobada usually tends to be my favorite, but in this case I liked the chicken more - the meat was juicy and the flavor stood out even with the cheese and dough fighting to steal the show. Then again, I will say that while the especial was certainly tasty with it's tender chicken, globs of melted cheese, and fried doughy goodness, I kind of felt that it ultimately wasn't worth the calories. I'm glad I tried it, but personally I thought the normal tacos were satisfying enough. I'd rather leave the indulgence for a chocolate dessert or something. But judging from the other reviews, maybe that's just me. These are definitely some of the best tacos I've had in NYC and not far behind the ones I had in San Diego at La Puerta. I'll be keeping this place in mind as a good option for a quick, cheap, tasty bite to eat in Chelsea.

These are indeed the best tacos I've ever eaten.  This place shows up time and time again of "best of" tacos in the nation for a reason.  You Can't go wrong with anything from this place.  I especially like the quesadilla.  The meat is charred and fresh tasting, veggies are always refreshing and you can pile on as much of the hot or mild salsa as you want.  For about the price of chipotle, you can be out the door with two delicious authentic tacos, I don't know why you would go anywhere else.  Find a corner of Chelsea market to set up shop and chow while you do some people watching.  This place should be a destination or an every day spot if your lucky enough to be local.
Do yourself a favor and go get tacos from here. It is the best in NYC.I ordered the steak tacos and it was delicious. Definitely going back there for more.
Best tacos in NYC. There's always a long line but it moves pretty fast and def worth the wait
Best tacos I ever had no complaints! Toppings are free and the tacos are cheap. Definitely a place to check out! Only complaint is really long lines due to the popularity.

Got the Pork and steak tacos. Pretty great food. A nightmare to order at peak times (lunch -early dinner). It's worth braving the crowds if you like it authentic and spicy (if you grab the hot salsa, a dab'l do ya) a bit pricey for what you get but there's really nowhere better in Chelsea for tacos..

Best tacos and quesdilla I've ever had. Super authentic seasoning. Get the Especial with your favorite meat. I BEG YOU!Also got the taco and steak tacos with both flour and corn tortillas. All combinations to see which was best. They were all damn good and too close to judge.

Holy moly, these are the best tacos you can get in the city (that I know of at least)! And the prices are great. And the lines are relatively quick. Carne asada tacos are probably my favorite. I usually get two of those and 1-2 chicken or al pastor tacos. I tried the cactus tacos once, but couldn't appreciate it.
OMG carne tacos! Mother of all tacos that was amazing! I can't have any other Mexican food! It's truly that good! Only shortage is that you have to eat while standing, but it's totally worth it.
Best tacos I've ever had. I had two steak tacos with everything on them and they were amazing. The tortillas are fresh, the guacamole is delicious and the onion a nice crunch. Love it!
Amazingly Yummy! Can't get enuff of their food. Frequent this place often and highly recommend the soft tacos! Yum!
My favorite taco spot but pretty bummed because I just found out their flour tortillas are made out of pork lard. So if you're vegetarian or kosher make sure you order the corn tortillas
Best tacos in NYC, hands down. Apparently the owners are from a border town by Mexico. It was really good. I had the chicken and carne tacos.
AMAZING tacos, best in New York in my opinion. I hail from California and I give these a 100% stamp of approval. The adobada taco is NOT to be missed. Guac is also delish!
Best. Tacos. Ever. I'll be thinking of these whenever a taco craving hits. So worth the crazy line and weird service.

Great tacos.Very flavorful, fresh homemade corn tortillas, and tangy salsasCarne asada - hot off the grill, great tomatillo salsa on topCarne adobada - delicious spit grilled pork, not as sweet as al pastor. Great roasted chile flavor, and the pineapple garnish adds a great touch
Their tacos are so authentic as well as their beverages. Their salsa is also to kill for.

First time at the taco place. Place was packed as they told me. Line move fast. Prices are high compared to byying high quality tacos in mexico. Living in guadalajara for 5 years 3.50 per taco is pricey. But they are absolutely worth them. Just like back in mexico the salsa and meat where made to perfection flavor is the same. Employees very friendly and fast. Highly recommneded for any one. The adobada and carne asada tacos where great. Highly recommneded. Becoming a weekly cuatomer.
The BEST tacos in New York City. Trust me, I'm from Mexico.
Incredibly tasty tacos. This is one of the best taco places I have ever been to. Try the chicken or carne asada tacos.

This is probably the best veggie taco you are going to get in this city.  Except this one taco truck I found on a drunken night that seems to have been a mirage.  Oh how I miss west coast Mexican food.Nopal (cactus) taco with corn tortilla for $2.50 -- great deal for a great taco.  Or you can get a quesadilla will be the same with melted cheese.  They really load on a ton of cactus.  Love their salsa bar, so I can load up on pico, radishes, salsa, peppers and lime.  Line can be long and intimidating, but it moves fast.

Probably the most authentic Mexican tacos in town! I've been here a few times already (every time I crave tacos). My favorite is the carne asada taco (beef). They also offer quesadillas and special options like cactus tacos. They always have loud Mexican music which makes the experience even more fun. I love it! You know it's good because there is always a long line at this little place.
Great Mexican fast food that is also authentic. I recommend trying the fresh water as well as the carne adobada.

All the other reviews are on point. I went here with my sister and we were blown away. We are from SoCal originally so we are used to good Mexican food but we haven't found a really "Mexican" Mexican restaurant yet in NYC. I guess we just weren't looking hard enough because Los Tacos is legit and right in front of us. I got a Carne Asada, Adobada, and Especial quesadilla; she just got the nopal.  We also split chips and guac. The guac was the perfect texture and I could tell it wasn't the "sour cream added" kind of guac, it was actual guac. The steak was very crispy as I like it and the pork was flavorful, moist, and juicy. I didn't like the Especial quite so much because I don't like fried food much in general but I had heard goo things about it so why not. Service was quick, price is reasonable for location, food definitely lives up to the hype. I would definitely go again and I recommend.

Had the chicken taco and of course chips and guacamole... delicious! All fresh ingredients, homemade... what else can I say? There's a reason this place is crazy busy. The only drawback is there are no tables at which to sit and enjoy this fantastic Mexican fare!

Amazing tacos... And everything you've read about the quesadilla Especial - it's true. Just go and enjoy this place. (There's an Asian bar /restaurant across the hall that won't let you eat tacos there - ridiculous - but they won't be upset if you order a beer and wander to the other corner to enjoy your tacos and beer. Consider sending your companion there while you wait in line lol)

I can say with extreme confidence, that these are the best tacos in NYC.  I tried three of their tacos and their chips and salsa.  Make sure you get your tacos on a corn tortilla.   All the tacos come with guac on it also. They also have mexican coke!!!!!!Ranking of Tacos:1. Adobada: The pork taco with two strips of pineapple.  Wow. When i come back I am getting three of these. 2. Carne Asada: Steak was tender, but no comparison to the above taco.3. Chicken: Nothing special about this one, but that's not to say it wasn't F***ing awesome. If you go outside, back into the market, there are tables and chairs that you can eat these in.  I will most certainly be returning
This is a pretty great place to have some genuine tacos. They taste great.

Tacos were to die for. Authentic Mexican food. Line moves pretty fast so don't walk away. I was not impressed by the guacamole- I will certainly skip it next time I'm there. It's difficult to find a spot to sit down on Chelsea Market, so you probably will eat standing or on some random corner- but totally worth it.

Omggggg bestttt freaking place ever MUST TRY THE PORK im from LA visiting NY for my bday and me n my friends were walking by and thought to try this place out and no regrets whats so ever long story short you must try this place if u r ever in Ny

Authentic, accessible and delicious tacos are finally making a scene in NY and the latest is Los Tacos No. 1!  These tacos rate a 5+ star rating, because they are, well damn amazing.The location is is the midst of Chelsea market and shares a space with a spice shop and some fried chicken (which is now closed).  Los Tacos was the only one with a line, quite a long line honestly.  Don't get me wrong, waiting on the line is totally worth it.  Get up to the register and place your order.  You'll also see 3 large jugs filled with aguas frescas including hibiscus (delightful) and tamarind.  Pay your tab and get your ticket, but remain on line.  Move down the counter and the guys preparing your food will take your ticket in order to create your order.  The counter is also aligned with lime wedges and salsas that you can use for your tacos, however I don't think you need any of that.The tacos are outstanding.  You see the tortillas being pressed, the meats being cooked all in front of you, talk about fresh.  Get the tacos with everything; which includes, chopped onions, cilantro and a green sauce.  You also have a choice of either corn or flour tortillas.  The corn tortillas are a work of art.  They are chewy and delicate, but at the same time hold everything together.  Both the carne asada and adobada tacos were melt in your mouth good and bursting with flavor.  The pollo quesadilla was the same size as the taco, but with melted cheese, it was heavenly.These really are the absolute top of my 'best of taco' list and I'll bet they'll be yours too.
The tacos were average a little over priced if you ask me. I had the carne asada tacos with everything and my husband had the pollo tacos. Mine were better, just saying.

Seriously, 10 stars. I used to eat at a place in San Diego near the border from Tijuana and this is the closest thing I've found to matching that quality. It's in Chelsea Market of all places. These tacos are so fresh and tasty it's not even fair we don't have them in Boston. On my recent trip to NYC, I ate their carne asada tacos on a corn tortilla for all 3 days in a row. We had a 2 hour layover in Penn station to Boston too and made a bee-line to Chelsea Market to grab some of these tacos. The lines are usually long and a bit hectic but it moves fast. Next time I'll have to try the drinks. No doubt, some of the best tacos in this country and in all of Manhattan.

Vegetarian options are just ok. I had the cactus plate which was cactus, beans, guacamole and some salsa. The cactus on its own is weirdly filling without tasting like anything. Together, the flavors are good and the beans complement the cactus well, but it wasn't savory like a meat taco, which I assume they do well.
ProsVery tasty $3 tacosReally succulent and tasty grilled meatsRed & green sauces with cut lime on the sideReasonable pricesConsCan't think of any

food: all the tacos. my favorite was the pork. all the toppings were on point and every bite makes you crave for more. ***5/5service: there are no tables. we found a cart nearby and ate on top of it. all the cooks were cool. you order straight from the kitchen and they handle your orders on the spot. love it. ***5/5value: yes they are expensive tacos. yes they are worth it. of all the places i visited in new york, this is the most memorable spot. ***5/5

Summary:  Well flavored meat and fresh ingredients.  Lines can  long. A little too "trendy" to be truly 5 star, but not bad for the area.  Use waiting time to decide on salsa preference.Atmosphere:  Clean. It's Chelsea Market.Service:  The line moves quickly, but I got to admit.  For 3 tacos, it took longer than expected.The food:As my fellow yelper Wahed mentioned, the carne asada is really the way to go.  You'l want to try the salsas.  The adoba's is pretty good as a second choice.  I would skip the chicken.I was disappointed only because my expectations were high.  I think it's more the location of this place rather than the "awesomeness" of the food.  For $3 in chelsea, it's a worth the try.Helpful hints:Hybird NYC next door has a little Hybird box with two thighs and a bisquit.  Check out my review.  You can do a two-fer if you try this place.  ALSO, there tends to be less hype surrounding  Hybird, so that little yummy purchase may buy you access to standing bar area.
Totally a fan of this place now! Tacos were delicious! :) Thanks Yelp for suggesting this location!

Came here on a taco craving and it lived up to the hype. I ordered the carne asada and adobada on flour and corn tortilla respectively. As I lay my eyes upon the two scrumptious pieces of perfection, a thug tear rolled down my cheeks cuz they were so beautiful. After I devoured both, I went back and got another adobada cuz the meat was so bangin. And it was 3.50 for a taco so you really can't complain about the price for the quality and authenticity. Overall, 5/5
Best place to get me some good tacos! You must try the nopales!

So. So. Good.I had the steak and pork tacos on corn tortillas, and they were both amazing - particularly the steak. Definitely worth the line. The guy next to me got a quesadilla and it looked freaking delicious too.
Best tacos I've ever had in my life. I just wish they had somewhere to sit down to eat them. If the weather is nice, take them to go and eat them on the High Line.

My husband and I were trying to find a place to eat in Chelsea Market . The only place that we could agree on was Los Tacos No 1. It was an excellent decision.It was busy, but the line went quickly. The employees were pretty cheery for having to work on Thanksgiving day too.When you get to the counter you order the main taco filling and then you are able to add cilantro, onion, guacamole, etc and there is no extra charge for it.We both ordered 2 tacos each (each being around $3-$4). We also both got carne asada and adobada tacos. The abodaba taco was good. I have had abodaba before but sometimes it can be really salty. In this case, not so. The carne asada taco on the other hand was excellent. We were both glad that we saved that for our second taco to eat: it melts in your mouth and it's full of flavor.They also have an excellent horchata with none of the horchata-cinnamon sediment that happens sometimes at other places. Very smooth and refreshing. Corn tortillas (my sister was very happy with them).2 tacos may seem like a small meal but it was definitely just enough for a lunch.The only issue for this place is the seating. There isn't really any. The ramen bar nex door was closed and had a counter so people sat there. There were also a few tables but I think it was also for the ramen place. When that ramen place is open I don't know the seating situation. Don't let that discourage you though. It is eating even without seating available.
LOS TACOS No.1 is the best in Manhatten. Pricey but worth it. The marinated pork is the best!!!!!

Let me prelude this rating by saying this: I HATE CHIPOTLE WITH A PASSION! The reason is I am paying at non-McDonald's prices for food under a McDonald business model. Honestly, I don't really care if my food is really organic or locally sourced because healthy eating would mean eating a home-cooked meal. Eating meat that is organic or veggies that are locally sourced do not equate to healthy eating habit especially if they are heavily doused in sauces for taste. So Los Tacos No. 1 is a taco shop. I love tacos as I traced it from my childhood visits to Taco Bells. It makes great tacos such that all the components of a taco-the shell, condiments, meat, and sauce really complement each other. It is obviously a superior product compare to a taco from Taco Bell or Chipotle. It is a mom-and-pop shop. The downside is that it is located at Chelsea Market, which is becoming more populated with out-of-towners. It is hard to find a good taco shop at a reasonable price in Manhattan.

There are no seats, but the tacos...holy smokes!!!! The cheese taco shell was bomb, and I had the vegetarian cactus filling with onions and mild salsa. I didnt expect it to be spicy at all, but it was just the right amount. Delicious!!!

Absolutely delicious!  The line is usually so long, which is a bummer especially since it gets really crowded, but the tacos are so worth it.  They're relatively cheap as far as New York food goes and they taste absolutely amazing.  One time I got the nopal taco and didn't much care for the flavor (kind of sour/bitter), but everything else has been great.  Wish they had better seating.

The fav tacos I've had in the city so far! If you see a line, don't leave. Get in line, it'll be worth it!Take your receipt and proceed to the counter. Tell the guy behind the counter whether you want corn or flour tortillas, which are freshly grilled. The texture of the tortilla is a tiny bit chewy, so they don't rip as easily as other tortillas I've had. As for fillings, my fav is the pork, followed by the beef, and then the chicken. You really can't go wrong with any of them. I haven't gotten around to trying the cactus yet.The tacos come out warm and juicy and flavorful. I appreciate the toppings on the ledge that you can help yourself to.

The portions were smaller than I had expected, but so good. I ordered the carne asada taco and it came with guacamole. The line wasn't too long and the servers were really friendly. Would definitely recommend to a quick eat by Chelsea.

The last time I was in the Chelsea Market, I got the Thai Food (Meh) and my sister got the tacos......She gobbled them up quickly before anyone could ask for a taste.  She also paid a fraction of what I paid for my bland Thai Food.Sooooooo this time I got the tacos - one chicken and one steak.  Perfect tacos al carbon.  Meat was flavorful, corn tortillas were pretty fresh, nice choice of salsas, pico de gallo, limes, etc. to top it off.  This time I gobbled them up.  Next time I think I will order 3 of them - I was still a bit hungry after 2.This place is on my go-to list now.

Los tacos is one of my favorite places in Chelsea Market! Super filling tacos with delicious meats and guac on superb tacos! Can't go wrong with any of their selections and definitely don't sleep on the horchata! YUMZ

Omg, omg best taco EVER! We've been wanting to try these tacos forever, but every time something comes up or the line is too long. We ordered 4 tacos: beef, chicken, pork and the cactus. I didn't care for the cactus but the other 3 were amazing. We also tried their drink, aguas frescas and it was surprisingly delicious. You can watch the lady make your tortilla for you. The only draw back is space. No tables to sit at but I was happy eating standing in front of the place. I've recommended this place to a few of my friends and everyone who's tried it loved it.
Basically the best tacos I've ever eaten.  Get the adobada ... better than the chicken and steak tacos.  No seating but who cares ... the food is where it's at.

Didn't expect much from a taco shop in a trendy food market in NYC being that we are from California where the best tacos are the street tacos in the most ghetto parts of town...but, this place holds its own.  We had been grazing all morning and really only walked into Chelsea market to check out the Lobster Place. We kept seeing people walking around with tacos.  As we walked up to the taco shop, I looked at the BF in dismay...as if to ask, "what is the point?"  Well...glad he didn't order just one for himself but forced me to try one as well.  The flavors were on point.  My only complaint would be the greasiness of the tortillas...but, the filling was fantastic and I cannot wait to visit this place when I am actually hungry. We only tried the adobado (?) as it was recommended by the cashier...but the carne asada looked delicious, too.  I don't remember how much we paid for the 3-4bite tacos but my guess is they were more expensive than California Street Tacos - that's expected though, right?

Loved this place! It's nestled in a corner within the Chelsea Market, and offers delicious food with great sauces at decent prices. There are even some off-menu "secret" options you can order if you ask about them, including something that sounded delicious with melted cheese. The hot sauce is actually hot, which is nice, and the meats are well-marinated and delicious. Stop by!

These tacos are probably the best I found so far in New York.  I tried the Carne Asada (grilled steak) and Adobada (marinated pork) on corn tortilla.  The grilled steak was cooked to the right tenderness, and the marinated pork had a special seasoning flavor that my wife wants to pay top dollar to get the recipe.  They put the standard ingredients and dressing in the tacos, but when you bite everything altogether, the combination was just perfect.  I highly recommend this place.

BEST tacos in NYC...or in the USA.  Warning:  they may cause addiction and 'taco-only' one way thinking.  I'm from Southern Cali and these tacos made me feel like I was at home (but they are even better)I'm sure everything else is wonderful but all I can seem to order are the tacos..

Wow. I finally found a great taco place in NYC (I'm from California). The menu is simple and straightforward with a very limited number of choices. The tacos are made from fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor and umami. The pork/adobado taco was my favorite. The guys behind the counter are also super nice! My first time there I was scoping out the various food counters and one of them told me try a taco on the house. Great marketing. haha. I've been back multiple times since then! I love the fact that they have fresh limes there, too!Just a food counter in Chelsea market with a raised counter on the side for you to eat at. Or you can take your food to go and eat it on the Highline!

Nopal Tacos and the Quesadilla!Need I say more? And they are cheap, oh so cheap!Don't fear the line, though, it moves very quickly and this place is definitely worth the wait.I think we spent $15 for 2 and still had leftovers.
Probably better than any of the taco places I've had in Cali or in the Spanish neighborhoods in Queens. Stop reading this and get one of everything.

This is my 5 start Taco place outside Mexico, the tortilla is fresh made right in front your eyes if you pay attention to details, the meat is fresh and well done! my regular order is 2 carne asada tacos with everything!!!!! Give me that spicy salsa ya!  than I make the line again for 1 more taco because I'm already full but I am too excited that I want more!!! ;) I don't particular enjoy standing up eating, but, is cheap delicious food.

They truly are number one. By far the best tacos I've had in NY. The pork tacos are truly magical. The chicken was probably the least good one. I also recommend the flour tortilla. Expect a long line, but it moves fast.

Great place to get authentic tacos! We got 6 in total and got to try all 4 fillings. The pork and steak were amazing and the chicken was good too. The cactus I probably wouldn't order again since it was somewhat bland. Sorry vegetarians, this place knows their meat and the cactus was meh. If you want amazing MEAT tacos, go here. They're super fast too.

Could it be that there's actually good Mexican food in NYC?  I mean, you can get the best of nearly every world cuisine in this city, but my experience with Mexican food has been more miss than hit.  But, Los Tacos nails the street taco experience by churning out almost perfect 2-3 bite pockets of Mexican delight.  Everything is super fresh, the tacos are properly dressed and the flavors bright.Oh, and the prices are very un-NYC.  For what you'd spend for a meal in Chelsea Market for one could feed 3 or more at Los Tacos.
Awesome tasting tacos. Guacamole and salsa was delicious. Chips weren't the greatest. Staff was very professional and worked quickly.

I have had tacos at many joints around NYC, but Los Tacos is hands down the best tacqueria in the city. Literally everything about this place is perfect; I don't even have words. It's cheap, oh so scrumptious and delicious, and above all authentic. The tacos are so flavorful and have the perfect spice. Adding the extra salsas at the bar make them even better. If you don't make your next taco stop at Los Tacos, you are seriously missing out.

Amazing tacos. Don't let the size fool you. They might look small but damn, they are just packing with flavor!!! Savory meat with that melted cheese on a soft taco shell topped with errythang! For the decent price you pay, you get a smack of flavor with satisfaction in your bellay!Get the nopal with meat on a plate. With EVERYTHING. DO IT. Or else you're missing out. You have been warned ;)

Get to the Chase:Pros:1) Fantastic morsels of awesome!2) Simple, delicious, affordable and quick3) $3-$4/soft taco for the quality of food is outstanding5) In Chelsea Market you'll easily spend $25+ per meal, whereas you can get fresh guacamole, grilled meats and flour/corn tacos! MMM6) Great service (pleasant staff) Cons:1) The cooler looks a bit iffy...rusted edges with a vat of water holding some bottles of soda (opt for the fridge that they have instead of the cooler)2) Can get quite busy/packed by meal time3) No seating

Every time I am in Chelsea market I have to have one or two of these adorable tacos. Now, just because they are smaller don't knock it till you try it the flavor is unreal very delicious you see them pressing the masa and cooking the tortillas to order.  This place is truly the shit.

I cannot believe I have not reviewed this place before. Hands down, the best tacos I've had in NYC. And trust me, I've had a lot of taco in my day. I have had the adobada taco (which is basically taco al pastor), adobada quesadilla, and the steak taco. My favorite items were the adobada. The pork comes straight from the spit, and the meat is juicy, succulent, and flavorful, Combined with the pineapple, cheese, and sauces, it is a taste sensation that you will not easily forget. The quesadilla with the melted cheese is also a hit. While I loved the steak taco as well, pork was hands down my favorite.Pair this with either the Mexican Coca Cola (or Fanta) if you like soda, or the horchata, and let me tell you, this will hit the spot. I would have to say, these compare to the tacos I've had in Mexico.
Somebody pinch me! Ugh, I wish this place wasn't so far away from DC otherwise I'd be here every day. Carbe Asada is the way to go!!

These tacos are INSANE! I can't think of any better quality Mexican food in NYC, and I've done Suenos, Dos Toros, Jackson Heights, Spanish Harlem, etc... Los Tacos No. 1 is hands down the best. The Menu:Comprised of tacos and quesadillas mostly. The quesadillas are the same size as the tacos, but griddled and with cheese. They also do nopal (cactus) plates, chips/salsa, and various Mexican sodas. The Spread:Select your taco filling: grilled steak (carne asada), grilled chicken (pollo asado), marinated pork (adobada), or cactus (nopal). Then choose corn or flour tortillas. Finally, choose your extras: guacamole, cilantro, onions, and salsa. Afterwards, you can garnish everything with cucumbers, limes, blistered peppers, hot salsa (red), and mild tomatillo salsa (green). The Set-up:Place your order and pay at the first register on the right counter of the stand. Then move over to the left counter, give the man your receipt, and tell him which tortilla/extras you'd like. There is ample counter space at the stand, and along the windows facing W. 15th St. The Locale:Once inside Chelsea Market, you will be able to locate Los Tacos No. 1 from a few visual clues. It's off a southern side passage from the main drag. Just find the spice store (or sniff it out), then walk south. It's directly across from Hybird. The Meal:I wasn't sure how big the quesadillas would be, so I went with one steak quesadilla on a flour tortilla with guacamole to start. I love that they don't make you get onions and cilantro! I know it's authentic, but I don't like raw onions, and I have a strong aversion to cilantro. I sauced it up with both hot salsa and green salsa, and then some lime juice. After one bite I was in love. The steak was so juicy, but still maintained the charred taste of the grill. The soft flour tortilla was great quality, and all the flavors worked together to form a complete package. I finished eating, but still had some room, so I decided to maybe try an overpriced Questlove Hybird drumstick, or maybe some Mexican corn from nearby Num Pang. But Num Pang didn't have any corn, and I couldn't shake my desire for another Los Taco No. 1 quesadilla. So I got back in the line (which was much longer now), and went with a pork quesadilla on corn tortilla this time. The pork is actually cut from a rotating spit (!), like gyro meat, then thrown on the griddle to add smokey char. As I waited again, I noticed the women in the back actually making the tortillas in house from masa. Now that is a fresh tortilla. I gobbled down another quesadilla, and by then I was satisfied, though other people could probably eat another taco/quesadilla or chips, additionally.The Verdict:I don't give out many 5 star reviews. I mean, I just gave one to Momofuku Ko, but like... that's Ko, that's to be expected. I wrestled with giving it a 4 because of the disorganized line situation. Honestly, one of my BIGGEST pet peeves of this city is that New Yorkers are notoriously aggressive line-cutters, and on a busy day I could see that being an issue, especially as this place gains in popularity, which I see happening in a big way. However, the food is too fantastic to care about any other minor annoyances. 5 stars.

My meal here made me miss California, but in a completely good way. It was my first time trying cactus...which basically tasted like aloe! The tacos are a little small and fall apart easily (no double tortilla-ing here, but they are as fresh as can be--you can watch the lady press the dough in the tortilla press and put it on the stove). They are also a little expensive for the size, but I guess that's not too surprising given its location in Chelsea Market. You can get corn or flour tortillas, and you customize your taco, and there is a salsa bar to extra-top your taco if you want.

Great great great!!  Their tacos r huge!! And so delicious.  I love doing my groceries at Chelsea market.....and if u do .... Stop by here end try those amazing tacos and the refrescos !!!  EXELENT concept . So refreshing!!!

I ordered 2 steak quesadillas ($4.50) and both beef and chicken tacos ($4.00). The servings sre small yetvstuffed making the price an ok value. Taste was good (I have personally had better), rather stingy with the cheese for the quesadilla, and the tortillas are more hearty and thick than I normally have come across which is definitely a plus as this makes the small serving size more filling. It is good for a quick bite of fresh Mexican  cuisine.

Not only are the prices great but, so is the food. It's not very often you find a taco shop that make tortillas by hand, that makes a world of difference. If your a meat eater, I will tell you this Is a must have!
Yes! These tacos are absolutely the best. It will change your life. My favorite are the carne asada tacos mmmmm Love the chips and guac.

Really good authentic Mexican food. The drinks were also pretty good. -I have to give them 4 stars instead of 5 for some nuisances. The order taker doesn't tell you that you have to give your receipt to someone at the counter who will then get your order. -because of the cramped space and odd way of getting your food, people are on top of each other. -the salsas, lime, straws, napkins are all at the same waiting/receipt counter so again you have a ton of people on top of each other. The prices are a bit high so it's hard for me to determine if it's worth it or not. I had two carne asada quesadillas and a drink which were satisfying and came out to about $15. Each quesadilla is pretty small but the ingredients are good and can be satisfying. The quesadillas are about the size of your palm.
Great authentic tacos in the city. Great fan of these style taco places popping up throughout jersey and the city.
These are the best tacos in the city. On par with the best tacos in Mexico. I highly recommended the Asada tacos.

A favorite place for a quick bite in the Chelsea Market....simple menu and they get you in and out of there quickly. The chicken cheese taco loaded with everything on it, a side of chips and guacamole and the punch is all you need but you can't go wrong on this menu, everything is really going to hit the spot.

Easily the best Mexican food I've had on the East Coast! I had the quesadilla and some chips and guacamole, while my coworker got two tacos and a quesadilla. The quesadilla was packed with flavor and with the chips & guac, I was very easily full. I didn't quite like the chips and guac though- the guac was a little bit bland and the chips were inconsistently salted.
