I'd take a bite and wouldn't have tasted anything special, and the next bite would be overly salted. Only minus point.Would definitely come back again, but wouldn't order the chips & guac again. I'm definitely glad we were able to find Los Tacos!

New fav mexican in nyc! Chicken taco and quesedilla were awesome! Be warned, quesedilla means openfaced quesedilla or more like taco w melted cheese but nevertheless it was delish. Everything comes w guac, onions, and cilantro and you can add their pico or sauces at the counter. Food was ready fast too. Only downside is lack of seating area in the market.
Got the adobado quesadilla and it was so good. I wish you could get two for the price. The setup of the place can get a little hectic but the food is worth it.

I've had many, many Tacos over the years, however this was easily the best.I had the pork taco with everything on, on a corn tortilla.  If you're there, get one.  If you're not, make a trip for it.  It's worth it.  Best food I had in New York.

ZOMFG!!!! THIS IS AMAZING!!!! ($@%$($$##!That was pretty much what was going through my head upon my first bites into my carne asada and adobada tacos. I honestly *did not* expect the tacos to taste waaaaaay better than normal tacos (and I had a tuna one at Takumi the other day), but they did! (AND I'M FROM CALIFORNIA and have eaten amazing tacos all up and down the west coast into Mexico). These tacos really are amazing in the best ways possible- really great flavor, rich meats cooked perfectly and just the right amount of each ingredient in each taco so that each bite is an explosion of delightful and tasty fresh flavors.I regretted not ordering 2 of every flavor even AFTER scarfing down my two and being incredibly full and satisfied.

The longer I live in NYC, the more comfortable (not by my own volition, necessarily) I have become with the fact that little "street" tacos seem way overpriced to me. The way some people say the chicken at Hybird across the kisok from Los Tacos No. 1 is overpriced (in ways I don't quite understand; I think it is pretty fairly priced), I'm thinking to myself: "$3.50 for a flimsy corn tortilla that's going to break under the weight of too much juicy chicken pieces while getting all over my hands and clothes?!" At least the fried chicken doesn't completely fall apart in my hands after one bite. Ahhh, screw it. It all tasted good. Ha! The options are plentiful enough. One can get tacos with chicken, beef, or even cactus. Same goes with quesadillas. The chips and gauc are very reasonably priced. (Only $3 for a good amount!) I ended up getting the pollo asado taco; it was made fresh to order, and my server was quite happy with me when I said, "Yeah, you can put everything on it." What I love are the bowls full of extra ingredients for further customization / contentment. An extra spoonful of salsa fresca on the side and a wedge of lime, and I was good to go! It was flavorful, indeed. My favorite part was the avocado cream drizzled on top. Such a velvety compliment to the strong flavor of the chicken.I'll definitely be back to try some of their other options; nopal (cactus) sounds too interesting to pass up! The founders certainly succeeded in bringing some of that Cali / Mexican simple flavor into NYC!

This place was great. The tacos were amazing. I recommend the steak and chicken tacos. The only bad part was that there was no seating. But if you go past the waterfall you can find seats and tables there.  The chips and guacamole is really great but the guacamole is small, so is the salsa.
This is that good shit beyond compare. I love the atmosphere of it inside of Chelsea Market too.

4.5 Stars I lived in California for too long so I just couldn't give a perfect score to a NY taco spot.Where to start...ok so first it's located inside Chelsea Market and it doesn't really have a store...you have to go inside another shop to locate it....it's going to be on your left if entering from the 9th ave entrance.The steak taco was insanely good...that beef was different from any other beef I have tasted from a taco...juicy, fresh, flavorful...it's like little pieces of hanger steak cooked to perfection....3 different types of salsa at the counter with different spice levels (the spicy one was really spicy) gives the taco the whole package...At $3.50 a taco, the quality definitely justifies the price.
The Pollo Asado quesadillas are SOOOOO good, the way they cook and serve them up is perfect! I'm definitely going back.

I was a little let down by the visit here. It's highly reviewed and can see why. The tamarindo was tasty and The tacos are delicious- the pollo asado and carne asada were both good with a nice selection of fresh toppings to put on it. The problem is they're small. Again they're good but they're fit to be appetizers, I had to eat 3 of them before I kind of full (probably could've had another one still) and at $4.75 (?) per taco thats adds up if you want to be satisfied. I also had some of the 'nopal' which was a cactus salad dish with cheese. It was lame. I expected it to be interesting but nope tasted like string beans (which I hate) and they were just soggy. So I'd say unless you like that, its a waste of money. We also got the tortilla chips with guacamole which also seemed like just an appetizer and at any other spot probably would be. So the tacos are good, but I think this place is a bit overrated for not getting bang for your buck.

Stopped by here on an impulse while my girlfriend and I were exploring Chelsea Market for the first time.  I had a craving for tacos all day and couldn't resist the allure of this casual, yet bustling taco stand just off the main drag.  Upon approaching the register I was welcomed by an active but quickly moving line.  After some deliberation I decided to try an Adobada taco and a Pollo Asada quesadilla.  There is a bit of a quirky ordering/serving process so, as another reviewer pointed out, the uninitiated may want to stand back and observe the ebb and flow of traffic before diving in on a busy day.As for the food, WOW.  I absolutely love Mexican food and after having spent the last few years working with a native mexican I have learned a thing or two about authentic dishes.  This place certainly has a noticeable "tex mex" flare but the balance between true Mexican street food and the flavor profile Americans have come to expect from what we call "mexican" is elegantly executed.  The pork and chicken were superbly well cooked and the various accoutrement were bursting with authentic flavors.  You can taste the quality and freshness of the ingredients.  I was initially flying solo into this experience as my girlfriend was not hungry at the time, but boy did her tune change once she had a taste of what I was ravenously devouring in front of her.I vaguely remember hearing her say "it sounds like you're having an orgasm" beyond the din of battling this culinary delight into submission, but I can't be sure.

A fan. Small place that sells only tacos. They know what you are doing.No seating place but you can do take out and find a place in the market or outside to sit. Or stand the finish your tacos with the salsa and hot sauces.

Decided to try this place last night after all the glowing reviews and it certainly did not disappoint.  Got to Chelsea Market around 8pm and Los Tacos still had a substantial line.  I ordered one of each taco to try and got 2 of them on the flour tortilla and 2 of them on the corn tortilla.Surprisingly, out of all the tacos, the grilled chicken tasted the best.  It was very tender and flavorful.  The steak tasted okay, the pork was a bit too sweet for my liking, and the cactus I just didn't really care for.  The size of the tacos was very decent and sensible for under $4.  Eating 4 of them def felt like a full dinner if you come in feeling very hungry.  If you're feeling okay hungry, getting 2 of them would prob be sufficient.While the tacos still are not on the same level as tacos from San Diego, for New York tacos, they are def above average and are not your standard run of the mill.  Loved how there are unlimited salsa toppings and limes available to put into the tacos.  Next time I come here, I would prob just stick to the chicken and steak tacos and just get them on the corn tortillas.  There's nothing too special with the flour tortillas, but the corn ones have a hint of taste that make them stand out more and seem to go better in enhancing the filling inside.  For anyone who has eaten corn tortilla based tacos in San Diego and worried about the strong smell and taste, need not worry about that here at Los Tacos - they are much more mild in comparison, which I felt was a good thing.

FROM TIJUANA TO THE REST OF THE WORLD!!!! I was born and raised in Tijuana, and moved to NYC about 3 years ago... it was my delight when a bit over a year ago I found a NYT article about the best taquerias in NY, and this Tijuana-style was one of them... so I had to be there immediately! First of all, I've always say the best tacos come from Tijuana (many will agree, some haters I respect). Are less complicated and full of flavor. Tacos No. 1 is the ultimate best execution of what a Tijuana Taqueria is: the stand, the coca cola colors, the music, the kitchen smoke, even the salt shakers in Gerber glass containers!  I understand that many people complaint about the lack of seating, but trust me: TIJUANA PEOPLE EAT TACOS THAT WAY! And I understand this is NYC and not Mexico, so an alternative is to place your order as "to go" and find a table towards the back of Chelsea Market.About the execution: if the salsas over the counter would be more liquid and spicier, these tacos could be ultimate perfection!  The main difference between these and real Tijuana tacos is the quality: Tacos no. 1 has much better meat without all the fat, tendon, nerves (ha!), but the marinated is the same. The signature taco of Tijuana is the Carne Asada (grilled steak), but I noticed that most of my non-mexican friends go crazy for the Adobada tacos at a point that is their ultimate experience (I don't eat pork, so I will relay in their picky palates). The tortillas are amazing, just the way how my favorite taco stand back home makes them, you can even see a lady making them right in front of you. Mulitas are also a signature Tijuana dish (don't try to order this in Mexico CIty), and they do it just the right way. Personally, I like to add Frijoles de la Olla, you can ask the taquero for a side order if they're available. Without a doubt, this is the best taqueria in Manhattan and I'm glad to know is reachable without going to Queens or Uptown. Yes,they're bit pricey, but everything in this city is pricey, and for the spot it's still worth to pay the price for something authentic without having to get out of the city. Just a side note, a good friend from Tijuana who now lives in Miami made fun of me about how crazy I get when talking about this place. He was here this past weekend, and paid 3 visits during his short stay.... authenticity and quality are the reasons why he kept going! Enjoy!

So good! Highly recommend the adobada quesadilla and the horchata too. Super affordable, friendly and efficient staff - honestly couldn't ask for a better place. So much flavor! I'm in love with every aspect of this quick-bite place. I only wish every food court was as clean, quick, delicious, and affordable as this one! I guess if I really had to scrutinize this place I'd wish that there were fewer ice cubes put in my drink, but the fact that they let you taste the drinks first more than makes up for that.
you win los tacos no.1.best tacos i've had in nyc thus far. delicious carne asada. only annoying thing is the seating situation, but who cares..you got great tacos with freshly made corn tortillas.

OMG probably some of the best tacos I have ever had!!! If you haven't tried these, you better get yourself to Chelsea market today and make that long line for your taco. I was pondering whether I should make the line or not but I'm so glad I did! You can see the ladies preparing the corn tortillas hand-made. And once u get ur taco u can add any toppings u want, like pico de gallo, hot sauce & lime. I really wish I could get this quality of Mexican food somewhere closer to home (Queens). I'll def be back here every time I'm in the area.

i havent had mexican food this good since leaving california!my gosh this is my go to taco spot. i typically opt for the chicken tacos on corn tortilla con todo and a mexican coke or homemade horchata. two of these taco orders typically fill me up. yes the line can get long but they move thru orders very quickly while still managing to pump out fresh good quality product. the one thing i am knocking them down one star for is seating which is close to impossible considering there is none. TIP: if you go out the exit to the left and take a right keep walking and you'll hit a park. on nice days, i choose there for my dining area, otherwise, you'll be walking around cheslea market for a good ten minutes looking for a table. definately a downfall but trust me, the tacos are worth it!

First off: THIS PLACE IS IN CHELSEA MARKET.  If you are confused finding it, it's about halfway between the two main entrances, off on the side past the spice shop.Awesome, awesome tacos, and super-fresh.  If you get the corn tortilla with pork, they shave the pork and make the corn tortilla right in front of you.They also include free guacamole, salsa, pineapple, etc. and there's a bar with additional salsas, radishes and spicy dried chillis.Confession: I always take a bunch of the dried chillis to snack on later :3The downside is the price:food ratio.  It's something like $3 - $4 for a pretty small taco.Also, there's no seating.  If you want to eat, there you have to do it standing up at the salsa bar, in the way of other patrons, or try to find a seat elsewhere in Chelsea MarketBut the quality can't be beat!  And $3-$4 isn't a lot to spend; just don't expect to be filled on one or even two tacos.  It's more a snack than anything else, and if you want a full meal it can get pricey.
Excellent tacos! Really fast service! Would definitely go back.

Im not crazy about Mexican food. But I heard about Los Tacos from my co-workers and they said it was awesome. They said the line at lunch was long. So I played it smart and went in the evening time, there was no line. I ordered a couple quesadilla specials and some chips and guacamole. Two of those specials will have you stuffed. It was really really good. Cant wait to try there other items.
Amazing tacos, probably one of the best I've ever had. However, there is barely anywhere to sit which made it hard for me to enjoy my tacos.

Well deserved name. One of the best - if not the best - tacos I have ever eaten in America. The meat was so tender and the flour tortillas were freshly made before my eyes. The salsas were all very good and full of flavor. There's nothing negative that I could point out.

Tacos No 1 is in my top 3 taco spots in NY. I might just apply to work there so I can stuff my face with these awesome tacos all day. But then they might get worried that I was eating too much and fire me. So plan B is to become best friends with one of the cooks, grease him a $5 here and there and maybe get a few tacos for free ;)But in all seriousness, try these tacos!!
Holy guacamole.this place rocks.their tacos are so delicious and reminded me the ones that I had in Cancun. ask for everything and you won't regret,believe me:)

Definitely one of my favorite Mexican eateries in allllllllll of New York, and I never could have imagined making a little taco out of a quesadilla, and filling it with tasty, tender marinated pork and fresh onions and cilantro and dressing it up at the hot sauce bar that you can go to town on, but that's what happens here, and it's heaven on Earth and I haven't used a period because I could shout so many accolades for this place in a single breath !
The tacos were authentic Mexican style with fresh ingredients. I could skip the quesadillas next time though.
Amazing Tacos!!! Best in the city. The lines get long but it is totally worth it! Note that there is NO seating.

My most favorite taco joint. After having their tacos, I can't eat elsewhere! Their tacos are addicting. The Carne Asada and Adobada Tacos are bursting with flavor. It's best to have all toppings and sprinkle a bit of fresh lime available at the counter and drizzle both salsas that are there as well. After eating two each, I always want to go back for more. Only downfall is no seating but you can find plenty inside Chelsea Market. And usually there are long lines but boy is it worth the wait!!

Order the pork tacos adobada, they are life changing and the best tacos al pastor you'll ever have.Everything about this place is perfect and authentic.  Everything is hand made from scratch.  The tortillas are delicious, the meats are seasoned and cooked just right, and the hot sauce, pico, and accompaniments are all insanely good.They are extremely consistent too.  I have been here multiple times at different times of day on different days of the week and it seems like every time I come they are even better than I remembered.I never get to try any of the other vendors in Chelsea Markets because these tacos are so good that I can't resist anytime I'm in the area.

Coming from a Californian, with great Mexican food at my fingertips, this place is legit. It's authentic, quick, and quite tasty. I always heard that there's no good Mexican good in NY, but people were wrong. I highly recommend this place!

Wow.  If you see a line, even though there are a ton of other places to eat at Chelsea Market, wait.  The line isn't THAT slow, and the tacos are worth it.  I ordered 4 tacos, 2 for me, and two for my mom who happened to be with me at the time.  Two chicken, one steak, one pork.  The chicken was surprisingly not the best, the steak (almost like a skirt steak), was, absolutely, incredible.The taste of all the tacos were fantastic, large portion in the small taco shell.  You wait in line, order, then give your ticket to one of the 'cooks' who'll put your order together, and if you don't want something in it, tell them, or tell them you want everything, come on, we know that's what it's all about.  The hot sauce can be hot, I enjoy that though, so it was not an issue.  At the market, and unsure what to eat, go here.
Oh my god  so so so so so amazing. I got Guac chips and chicken quesadilla and they were super good

I can't find any other tacos in NYC that does it like this place. First, let me start off by saying I used to dislike eating tacos (mainly cause tacos made in school cafeteria ruined it for me)After trying their steak quesadilla, and spicy pork taco, I cannot go back. I also tried other taco places after this experience, but those all taste like halal food.  My point is give their tacos a try. I personally favored the steak, but I heard the pork is the best seller.

Spectacular!Since moving to NY 6 months ago, I've been on the hunt for truly authentic tacos, tasty and affordable.  I'm sure there are a few places out there; but so far the closest I'd come was a taco truck on W. 70th.Then a friend sent me an article about 3 guys from Brawley CA, Tijuana and Mexicali Mexico who opened up a taco stand in the Chelsea Market.  OMG; I went to school in Brawley!!!! (first time I've said it with a big smile).  So of course, I had to check out Los Tacos #1 RIGHT AWAY.It is RIDICULOUS how good the tacos are! They are fresh, tasty, and well-prepared. I've tried all 4 tacos and since I love Carne Asada and Chicken anyway, those are my favorites.  Choice of corn or flour tortilla; made fresh right there? Fabulous! Tacos made Con Todo (onions, guac sauce, cilantro and salsa) or made to order?  Awesome.  All the extra condiments you'd come to expect are there; radishes, cucumbers, LIME, peppers, cebolla's, and at least 3 different salsas.  I only wish they had not run out of "special quesadillas" when I attempted to order one; deep fried and cheesy with chicken or beef is all I would have needed for a complete picture of HOME.  Yes the lines can be long (because it is THAT GOOD), yes, there's little seating (stand up counter only) and yes, it can get confusing as to "what do I do next".  That's what makes it such a great experience!  The employees are patient and friendly, and if you ask, you might just meet one of the owners.  This is the REAL DEAL.  Go. Now. And then, Go Back again; you won't be sorry.

The best tacos I've had in my life. Way better than any fancy Mexican restaurants I've been to in NYC. There's a long line and its cash only and you're definitely going to need to use the nasty chelsea market restrooms soon after, but its all worth it.

Thats some real good tacos! The line was long but worth it. They did a great job l got my food pretty quickly. I was afraid to be hungry but after two tacos I was so full. It's a must if you're around.

I was super stoked to finally Los Tacos No. 1, thinking they would be one of the best tacos I've ever had. I was saving my stomach for a lobster roll so I only tried the pollo. It tasted just like another taco... I think I've had better tacos off of taco trucks and at restaurants, plus it was it was sort of pricey for one taco.
Real tacos Carne Asada and they are a 10 .....  as good a taco you will find any place. If you like tacos and are in the meat packing district you must try Los Taco

Favorite item on the menu - Adobada Taco....yum! Efficient, friendly, tasty food with fun music while waiting in line. Great fresh fast food for that New York Minute. Squeeze of a lime wedge and off ya go. Love it!

Being from LA, I never thought I'd find exception tacos in NY, ever. After a first bad experience back in 2011, I vowed that I'd never ever try any other Mexican taqueria in NY but because I work in Chelsea Market, I had no choice but to give Los Tacos a try. Their tacos are definitely "No. 1."I come here between 2-3 times per week. My usual order: adobada quesadilla on flour with the mix and one or two tacos of either carne asada or adobada on corn tortilla. LOVE the adobada so I get it every time. It comes with about 2 slices of the pineapple. It's sweet and spice. The carne asada is solid and I'm not a fan of the chicken.
Eating here was a religious experience.For context I got the adobada mulas and added nopal, guacamole and horchata.

Delicious tacos at a great price! Long line but it's worth the wait! You order at the counter then you hand your ticket to one of the guys and they make your tacos! They have a salsa bar where you can add everything you want to your tacos! The quality of the meat is great compare to other taco places I have been to! The downside of this place is that the counter can get really pack for you to eat your tacos other than that, this place is legit and great for a quick bite at Chelsea market!
The best taco I've had in NYC/NJ. It's also always so crowded. Tried the cactus and hated it. Had a bite of my bf's steak taco and loved it.
Best tacos I've had in NYC. Too bad they didn't exist outside of the Chelsea Market or I'd go every single week.
The corn tortillas smells really good! Tried steak and chicken tacos, will definitely come again!

If there was a taco heaven ... it would be catered by Los Tacos No. 1I prefer the quesadilla because they have melted cheese on the tortilla ... its gooey, warm spicy and flaky all at the same time! All their taco's are good and the nopal is exceptional. If you see a long line (which is typical because this place is so delicious!!) just join the line - it moves super quick and is absolutely worth it!!! Pair your meal with their iced horchata (best horchata I have ever had!!)

Came here on memorial day at one and the line was enormous and for a good reason. This is by far some of the best tacos I have ever had. You could pick any item on the menu and be more than satisfied with your choice. Honestly just get one of each taco if it's your first time. My personal favorite was the carne asada.

I don't care that the tacos are a bit more expensive- they are the most Cali I've eaten on the east coast. They reminded me very much of my experience at tacos eL Gordo in Vegas which was a 5 star also. The salsa was absolutely killer. I love Mulas they never have them on the east coast. I was skeptical of going to a place like this but I'd make a NYC must for Mexican.

Five stars for that tortilla. Is this best tortilla I've ever had? It could very well be.Stuck in the back corner of that new little section of Chelsea market, the lines can get long. There is no seating, but since that chicken place next door closed, you can eat at their bar while standing up. There's an odd ordering/paying/handing your ticket process that the first time confused me. From a purely operation POV, I don't understand why they do that, but whatever.Did I mention the tortilla? I would just eat that by itself. They are delicious.
great corn tacos, Especially the hard shell ones. Good with chicken or fish

I used to think NYC had the worst Mexican food anywhere. This place has changed my mind entirely. These are some of the best tacos you'll ever have.Although this may appear to border on hyperbole, I assure you it does not: Their pork taco is the single best taco I've ever had. Anywhere. Period. Put that in your pipe and smoke it.

For those of you strolling through Chelsea Market and perusing the various jewelry, clothing, and other stores in the popular Chelsea shopping destination be sure you stop by Los Tacos No. 1 when you get the hankering for some quality Mexican food.  It's an absolute gem. Los Tacos No. 1 is tucked into an area of Chelsea Market with a few other food establishments.  But believe me, it has no peer.  It stands head and shoulders above the other options because the food is delicious and dirt cheap! Win-win! When you get to the counter, you start off by ordering with the cashiers.  I chose the Carne Asada (grilled steak - $3.75 for one) and Adobada (marinated pork - $3.50 for one).  You get a ticket and then walk 10 steps to your left where the smell of cooking meats waifs through the air and gets your mouth watering.  I handed my ticket to one of the staff and I was asked whether I wanted flour or corn tortillas.  Now mind you, these tortillas are being made fresh right then and there.  I chose one of each for my taco selections.  I was then asked whether I wanted everything on my taco; everything being defined as cilantro, guacamole, salsa, and onions.  I said yes.  Seconds later I was handed two tacos to devour.  On the counter are freshly cut limes as well as mild, medium, and hot salsas to add at your discretion.  After adding these additional ingredients, I moved to the right and began to voraciously devour my lunch. Why voraciously? Because these tacos burst with flavor.  You can tell right away that everything is freshly made.  I love steak so I was surprised that I enjoyed the Adobado even more than the Carne Asada.  Don't get my wrong both were tremendous tacos, but the Adobado has a unique flavor. Of the two tortillas, I enjoyed the corn tortilla slightly more than the flour tortilla.  Although I was full after just two tacos,  I decided I had to go back and try the Pollo Asado (grilled chicken - $3.50 for one) taco because the others were just so good.  So I repeated the process above and as expected, the chicken taco was also excellent (though I rank it third behind the Adobado and Carne Asada options).  My one teeny-tiny gripe about Los Tacos No. 1 is that there is no seating area.  However, I was more than happy to stand at the counter and eat these wonderful tacos.  Los Tacos No. 1 is one of the best taco places I've been to in NYC and as the name says, it's certainly No.1 in my book.

As a chelsea market resident (work upstairs) - i have to say Los Tacos is way at the top of my list of deliciousness. The line can get a little crazy between noon - 1pm but whatever the case it's worth the wait.The tacos are small so if you're really hungry order quesadillas instead - they're a bit larger than tacos with the same yumminess and some cheese. The carne asada is my absolute favorite meat - the adobada and chicken are also really great. I havent mustered the guts to try the nopal but one day i will.you cannot go wrong here!!

The food was tasty and fast. The lines were long but it moved very quickly. Only thing they need to do is make sure the people preparing the food speak a little better English. They seemed to be confused at times about the orders. Especially in a busy hectic environment. But over all, great eats and not too expensive!
Great authentic tacos ... always a line, as it is delicious food for reasonable money. The pick up is though somehow a bit too Mexican/unorganized ... though again, it is authentic ;-)

Absolutely lives up to the hype. I lived in Texas for 2 years and find most taco places disappointing. These are very, very good -- though there is disappointingly no carnitas option. The handmade tortillas are key. The salsas are packed with flavor. I loved the char in the chicken, though both meats were a little overcooked, but I don't blame them as they see so much traffic coming through Chelsea Market.

As a California-raised New Yorker, I am usually pretty skeptical about Mexican food in the city. I just haven't found anything similar to home... until this place. I lived in San Diego for 5 years with the best "Mexican" food of my life, and this is honestly very, very close. The carne asada is actually done correctly and is super flavorful. Also, I heard that several of the guys working here are from San Diego -- so that's awesome!It's always very crowded and there is nowhere to sit (just standing room at a bar-type area) so be prepared to stand/walk with your food, but that's part of the taco shop feel, IMHO. Definitely a must-go for Californians or anybody who appreciates awesome tacos!

I was one of their first customers when this place opened up. I was a big fan but everything has gone down since- except the price!!A chicken taco used to be $2 just four months ago. Now u pay $3.95 for a taco. A small taco with 4-5 pieces of diced grill chicken. Come on guys stop getting greedy. U are selling over 2000 tacos and quesadillas a day.. Plus drinks. In other words over $6000 per day in sales everyday.. That's pretty good for a fast food place. Do the right thing and let's get those tacos down to $2.50.. Meet your customers in the middle

Back again for another round of amazing grub at Los Tacos. This place is even better than I remembered and I dreamt about their quesadillas. I'm pretty much looking for any excuse to go to Chelsea Market now. Go for the corn tortillas on everything. They make them fresh right there on the griddle. Even the hubs, who is partial to flour tacos, thought they were amazing.This place is not to be missed!

This location has the BEST tacos in NYC. They were so good I went three days in a row! Pros:-the tacos are filled with meat! Each bite has meat in it. -the tortillas are "hechas a mano" which means, they are made by hand, seriously, the lady is right there making them while you are ordering and eating.-the taste. OMG EVERYTHING TASTES AMAZING! I had tacos de adobada (pork) and a quesadilla de pollo (chicken). My sister had the same tacos and quesadilla de asada (you should know what that is by now lol)-the service. they are fast and always moving. the faster the better, get these tacos in my belly now!Cons:-the space. You can stand around and devour them the minute you get them. You can search for a place to sit elsewhere. -New York. I live in Los Angeles :( ok, ok, thats more of a personal problem but still.In NYC? Definitely a must!

Wanted to order more food even though I was already full! Can choose between corn or flour tortilla. Homemade everything. Get to see how they make the tacos. They give you a taste of their food through the atmosphere. My first time in Chelsea market so there were other places to go to but this place was in my top. Hard to find a place to sit when it's packed but we knew that already going into the market. Guacamole, steak tacos, chicken tacos and salsas all so yummy!
This food seriously blew my mind! We were sad that we had to stand and eat (and even still not much room to even stand) but the quality and flavor of these tacos made up for all other oddities

This place is fire. I loved the first class ingredients that felt like they came right from the farmers market. The service is fast and efficient, my taco was ready in seconds. Highly recommended it if you are in Chelsea Market.

Stellar tacos tucked inside Chelsea Market - the line can be scary but brave it, tacos like these are so hard to come by in nyc. Choose taco always. Choose corn tortilla always. Carnitas is super tender and comes rolled with taqueria style guac. Adobada aka al pastor is smoky and garnished with pineapple. Tortilla is pliable and fresh off the griddle. Portions are pretty generous, my only gripe can be that the tacos can get a little soggy, there is no option for extra tortillas, and the area/line is a complete mess. Also, these aren't no $1.50 taqueria tacos. But deal with it, these are worth it.

Probably one of the best tasting tacos in New York.  I got the pork taco.  There's a mini salsa area at the end of the service line that provides spicy, medium, and mild salsa from right to left.  The service is very fast.  Make your order with the cashier at the front of the line, get your ticket from the cashier, give your ticket to the person making your taco, he or she will ask you, "everything?" then you say everything and he sort of says "everything?" again and then makes your taco in 1 minute then off you go.Los Tacos is a no frills taco joint that has California style type of corn tortilla (my recommendation) tacos without the inexpensive California taco price.  My taco came out to a little over $4 and change for just one taco.  The cost brought down the rating for Los Tacos for me.  If the taco wouldn't have been good, this place would have gotten one star.  Therefore, three stars for fast service, open salsa bar, good tasting taco, but the high cost of a single taco.

I am a Texan who grew up with Tex-Mex and Mexican food along with many other international food. When I moved to New York, it was difficult to compare the food there to what I have grown up with. But this place was one of the few exceptions. It has by far pretty much the best tasting tacos I have ever eaten. Simple but so flavorful and juicy!

I saw great reviews and decided to try los tacos no. 1 this past weekend. I was not disappointed. The Chicken tacos are AMAZING! The salsa is extra spicy, so get it on the side if you aren't sure about how much spice you can handle. The hand made fresh tortillas make this place unique.  We also got a free steak taco with our order, and that was delicious as well. Everything was perfectly savory and flavorful. Prices are reasonable and even with a long line things moved along steadily. I will definitely check it out again next time I'm in Chelsea!
We stopped here after viewing the Statue of Liberty and it was inexpensive and great! Would highly recommend it!

If you're a taco person you need to come here. THE BEST TACOS EVER!!! The line is a little long and hectic but most definitely worth the wait. The adobada was my favorite:) Every time I'm in NYC this is a must have.

At PC Richards you don't always get the best deal.  I bought a dishwasher on 8/23 and paid $150 for installation.  On 8/28 they started a promotion where installation was free.  When I approached them on this matter, they said there was nothing they could do.  I could have waited 5 days if I knew about the promotion but no one at PC Richards advised me accordingly.  The stores say they did not know about the upcoming deal.  Corporate says they do not have to honor it.  Well, guess what, I do not have to buy at PC Richards anymore and I will not!  The prices there are a moving target and you never know if you are getting the right deal!

I had the Nopal taco. It's a veg taco with grilled cactus. Great flavors! And you can not beat the corn tortillas made in front of you as well as the cactus fresh from the grill! Also you can load your taco with lots of accoutrement in self serve. Beware the medium sauce is spicy but really tasty.

I was really looking forward to trying these since I was born and raised in Los Angeles, and I must say these are authentic Mexican tacos. I had the pork adobada tacos which I believe is what this place is most famous for, although normally carnitas (shredded pork)/carne asada are my favourite sort of tacos.I was excited to see that they make their tortillas fresh here as I could actually see them being made right in front of me. I loved the storefront-- definitely giving out an authentic TJ style look. Pork was good, ingredients melded deliciously together, sauces were fresh and full of flavour, but the best thing to me was probably the guacamole. Delicious, delicious guacamole with house-made chips. Yum!I thought the pineapple garnish was interesting, not something you see on a taco everyday.Horchata was amazing, some of the best I have probably ever had.At about $3.75ish a taco, not cheap, but two tacos is definitely enough food for a small lady like me. :) These tacos are good and definitely pretty high on my list of the best tacos I've had. I will have to go back and try the carne asada (grilled steak) next!

BEST TACOS I HAVE EVER HAD. Hellooooo People...this is a bold statement and I have said it!!  :)I was walking around Chelsea Market and wanted to try something different. Almost hidden in a corner, I found Los Tacos No. 1. My first time at Los Tacos No.1, I ordered a chicken quesadilla and a carne asada taco. When I got my food and took my first bite I was BLOWN AWAY! wow wow wow! Now that is what you call authentic Mexican food! :) The flour tortilla was soft and fresh, the cheese was melty deliciousness, and chicken/ carne asada was crispy, hot, and seasoned to perfection. The guacamole was smooth and the sides laid out were plentiful. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive, the owners are passionate about their food, and it shows! Go eat there now! =D

This was probably the best taco I've ever eaten. I got the carne asada taco and my wife got the chicken one, and all I could eye was the marinated pork one.The guac came as a cool sauce (and not chunky and mushy) on the hot taco and was perfect. The only negative thing about the whole experience was probably the paper the taco was in that was melting into my taco. But I didn't care. I ate the paper with the taco. If a bug got on that taco, that bug is going for a digestive system ride.

corn tortillas on point. I felt like it was very authentic in food quality and environment. Loved that they are served in sort of a "food truck style" way, which is exactly how tacos should be eaten. The hot salsa is actually pretty spicy, nasal airways were open and running throughout the whole meal. I got the cactus tacos and I loved the grill marks and charred flavor of the cactus and other veggies in my tacos. Cool place, I'd come here again.

Very good tacos for fairly cheap.I ordered three tacos--the pork, the beef, and the cactus, along with some horchata. The pork and the beef were the better of the three; I didn't really find the cactus all that tasty. The tortillas were probably the highlight of the meal, although all the ingredients were fresh and well prepared. The horchata was decent but a tad pricey. One of my favorite tacos in town, although a tad on the small end; you'll need at least two to make a whole meal.

Great to have quality tacos on the west side.  I like that this taqueria has a limited menu - tacos and quesadillas - and the food quality is very high.  In fact the tortillas are made on premises.  Fillings are also limited to beef, chicken, pork and cactus.  Tacos are small and cheap so, a fella should order three -  a lady might want two.The process of getting food is an assembly line: order, pay, get receipt, stay in line, give receipt to food preparer, get food, eat food.Downside is the location.  As much as I like the idea and design of Chelsea Market, it is a zoo.  This food stand is doing well but will do much better when it moves to its own space.  This is finger food and after I finished eating, the hand-washing option was to stand in a long line for the public washroom.Food is great, simple and cheap!

I'm from San Antonio, Texas. And let me tell you these tacos are bomb. New York has crappy Mexican food but this place really makes me miss home. So good!!! The adobada tacos are amazing! Love it love it love it!!! I'm obsessed! The aguas are so good too! I always treat myself here!!! The wait isn't long at all; the line might be long but it's totally worth it!

I can totally see why people say these tacos are best in the city.  The meats are succulent, the tortillas are wonderful, the spices are on point, and the sauces are amazeballs.  Their horchata is pretty damn good too.I really want to say they're the best, but they don't have beef tongue.  Otherwise, good job, I even ate the paper because I couldn't hold myself back from the beef and chicken taco.  Also, damn good job on the chicken... I never get chicken tacos, but this one.. this one...
This is an easy review.  Quality, tasty affordable taco served in Chelsea market.

Came all the way from Cali where we have Mexican food and taquerias on every corner and must say this place holds its own. I usually get pastor every where I go back home and this was very close to my favorite back home in nor cal.

SO DELICIOUS! I had two chicken tacos and a carne asada quesadilla all with everything on it and it was spectacular. And at $3.50ish a piece well worth it. They are completely stuffed. I was full after just two tacos. Highly recommend this place

Ironically, every spot with "No. 1" in their business name has caused some sort of food poisoning. However, Los Tacos No. 1 actually delivers and is up there with some of the best tacos that I've ever had.Yelp's newsletter actually let me know about this place along w some of the other best places inside the Chelsea Market. I was right next door at the Highline Stages, so I says, "yeah, tacos sound good for the end of the day," and BOOM, AMAZING.Recommend: You can't go wrong with carne asada on hand-made tortillas w guacamole and some hot sauce on top. Just thinking about those tacos get my taste buds wet :PI made my order in Spanish cus I felt like I was abroad for a second, especially w the vintage glass bottle Coca-Cola. Def check this place out if you're around. It's kinda hidden all the way in the back within the food section of the Chelsea Market.

Oh man, this place damn near killed me with their indulgent fare. I'd always thought tacos were only good for a snack and even looking around, the plates looked deceptively small, so I kinda went ham and ordered a taco ($3.50), quesadilla ($4.50), and especial ($5) all with pollo asado. Holy guacamole (hah). Although the tortillas look small, they really load them up with meat and toppings. Two of any of their menu items is definitely sufficient for a good meal. For the tacos and quesadillas*, you have a choice of corn or flour tortilla. I tried and liked both although I somewhat preferred the flour since it was softer. However, even though the corn tortilla is a bit grittier, it sops up the juices better, which might help given how messy the food is to eat. But messiness must be directly correlated to taste, because these tacos were AMAZING! I especially loved the chicken, which was perfectly charred and had great adobo flavor. I've had a LOT of tacos in NYC, and have to say this was probably as authentic as you can get outside of Mexico.The especial though is probably what did me in. It's essentially a fried quesadilla, but looks like an empanada. Served piping hot, it's probably a million calories, but oh so good. Be careful though - the juices WILL drip all over you with each bite since the dough isn't very thick.Btw, if you're looking for a sit down place to eat, Los Tacos No.1 is not where you want to go. They have an open kitchen style with one long bar-style high countertop and NO seats, not even barstools! Although the crowds due to this configuration can be intimidating, the staff is generally pretty good at moving the line along - just try to know what you want beforehand! Also, the stairs are conveniently located right at the end and you can make a quick exit to eat your grub more freely outside, which is precisely what we did.------------------------------------------------------------------------------*Note: The quesadillas are served open face on a slightly larger tortilla than the tacos, so don't be expecting a two-tortilla version!
Hands down best al pastor in the city, maybe in life. Super dope taco place over all

I keep going back to this place because I can't find better tacos in NYC. The line looked super long, went on a friday at 1pm, BUT... I only waited 5 minutes. amazing!This time in addition to the mandatory carne asada taco I tried the special quesadilla (deap fried crispy) soooo good.  Also, washed it down with a Mexican Squirt which I haven't had since Spring Break 2003... memories.  Love this place!!!

Hands Down - The Best Tacos I've Ever Had.The ingredients are FRESH and deliciously marinated. All the flavors complements each other perfectly.The chicken tacos were our favorite. Each bite is delightful- I couldn't stop commenting on the tortilla.THAT CORN TORTILLA DOE. Ever heard of the saying it's the bread that makes the sandwich? [Honestly, I might have made that up] Well, in this case, it's the tortilla that makes these tacos.It just encompasses all the ingredients so nothing overflows - its not crunchy (which I'm not a big fan of). It's perfectly moist and soft.I mean, if even the outside of this taco is this amazing, imagine how everything is together. It's just an explosion of deliciousness.Last thing, the first time I tried horchata was in California; I'm not the biggest fan of cinnamon so I didn't fall in love with it. However, the horchata here was up to par to what's in Cali.Los Tacos No. 1 is indeed #1 & a must-try spot in NYC!!

The best carne asada tacos I've ever had!!! Ordering there is chaotic and has long lines, but is worth the wait. No place to sit so you'd have to eat standing up amongst the crowded market, but the tacos' so fantastic, it's worth it.

I got the abobada taco! For one, it costs $3.81 with the tax and everything. It was super savory and juicy. You can pick between corn and flour tortilla. Personally liked the flour one! Go try it for yourself (:

An absolute must for any REAL TACO lovers! Everything is fresh and delicious, so basically best tacos in Manhattan!!! The line is sometimes long, but what else can you do when the tacos are worth dying for :))

THE BEST tacos I've ever had outside of Mexico. I know it's a strong statement, but it's true. Describing these tacos as breathtaking would not be an exaggeration. The adobada (pork) tacos are the best thing on the menu and are stuffed with such amazing goodness I can't stop thinking about them after I'm done.Not sure why this amazingly authentic place even gives the option between flour and corn tortillas (anyone worthy of eating these tacos would choose CORN) but they do.There are no seats whatsoever in this place, but somehow nobody ever complains. I wonder why. Could it be that the tacos are THAT unbelievable? Order some adobada tacos with everything (just trust them), shoulder up to the people eating at the counter and find out!

Best tacos ever. Definitely do pork tacos and steak tacos. Pork tacos tastes like Chinese sweet roast pork on a taco. $1 extra for Quesadilla which is worth it if you're feeling cheesy. Corn tortillas ftw. Lines move fast.

The best tacos by far!!! I go to Chelsea Market whenever I'm in NYC for their tacos and binge away!! The best Taco Tuesday experience by far!!!   Wish there was somewhere to sit there, but the market has other spots you can sit and enjoy the juicy tacos if not too busy. Love their sauces as well!!! Very affordable too. If you're in the area, you gotta give them a try. You won't regret it

Ahhh! The tacos were so fresh and flavorfull! My sister and I ordered 4 pollo asado tacos with a side of chips and guac. I would probably pass on the chips and guac next time. But the tacos... YUM!! The sauces they have out are great too! The hottest one is HOT! I love my spice so I appreciated it. We also got their mild which was good. Mmmm... Writing about it is making me want some more. :P

I've been to a LOT of taco places on the East Coast and this is EASILY the best of them all. It's most definitely on par with the tacos that I've had in LA. Every time I go up to NYC it is an absolute must that I have these tacos before leaving. Already looking forward to my next visit!

NYC got Mexican food of quality! Alert the media!So far the best tacos in NYC. They make their tortillas fresh and actually use corn rather than wheat. Super fresh, super flavorful, the employees speak English even poorer than I do, but it only adds authenticity to the experience. Just kidding, they speak English pretty good. Well, but back to the taste. Awesome taste! Go taste yourself! Bring your friends! Bring me! Whatevs ;-)This place does not have a TV! Another plus!
Seriously the best tacos I've had since being in Mexico. Do yourself a favor and order the carne asada with everything on corn tortilla with lime; you might just cry.

Really, really good tacos made all the more so by fresh tortillas made by hand. The menu is very simple and brief, which is good and helps keep things moving but I would have liked to have tried tongue and other common taco proteins if the menu offered more.
If you plan on passing out from pure deliciousness then go here. Their pork tacos will change your actual life. I been trying to buy one of their hats for months now!

Los Tacos No. 1 is aptly named, because these tacos legit are number 1The pork is a MUST, corn tortillas are a MUST (they are freshly made TO ORDER) and most importantly the QUESDILLA ESPECIALThe Especial is a quesadilla, deep fried then cut open and filled with what you want (get the pork). It is flakey, gooey, spicy perfection.Pro Tip: DO NOT BLOCK THE CONDIMENT STATION, EAT BY THE MENU IN THE FRONT

"Woohoo! As good as it gets!"And as good as it gets, indeed. Try these tacos in order for a gradually heightening experience (unless you just want to get straight to the top):pollocarne asadaadobado (pork)Don't let my subjective experience bring you down (you can read my other reviews for that). Everything is marinated in different ways with different sauces. And I'm normally not a fan of corn tortilla, but they make it really fresh and moist so it doesn't leave your mouth dry when you're trying to enjoy the juicy ingredients within the taco. Also, their spicy salsa is my new favorite. Everything about Los Tacos is simple, authentic, and well seasoned. If I'm not in Arizona or California, I will be coming here for tacos on this side of the coast (for now).

Let start off by saying that I am not a fan a red meat, I am a chicken kinda girl always have been always will be. There is something about the chewiness of red meet that turns me off and for that reason I never ever order steak or pork. How ever its totally not the case at Los Tacos no1., the name of the joint is real!!! The carne asada quesadilla is so mouth watering!!!! the home made corn tortillas, the beans, the cheese, the steak, the pineapple, and all the works( quac sauce, pico, and hot sauce) OMG!!! Ill admit that for a health conscious person this place is not ideal, but once in a while you have to break routine and come here, plus its right under the high line... It doesn't get better.

Most of my favorite food isn't necessarily mind-blowing, rather it's just right on most levels, spectacular on some. It's food I would eat every day. These tacos are just that, and, if I lived closer, I could see myself getting to know the people here pretty well.I had one each of the meat tacos and couldn't pick a "best" out of them. Joint food is my favorite genre and, to me, this place is perfection.
I ordered quesadillas and they were amazing. Not much room to eat nearby but found a spot elsewhere in Chelsea market. Like I said the food was amazing and definitely filling! I would go back again

Omg this place is SO GOOD!!! We were waiting for our Warby Parker appointment and wanted to grab a quick lunch at Chelsea Marker. Going for Los Tacos No. 1 was the best choice we've made. Like other reviews said, both the carne asada (grilled beef) and adobada (marinated pork) are really really good! The meat is so tender and the corn tortillas are thick and a bit chewy so the sauce doesn't make it soggy. I am still dreaming about these tacos... Might go back again before heading back to Seattle. $3-4 for a delicious authentic meal? Don't miss this place if you are around!!!

Meh save yourself the hassle and go to the Taco Truck on the High Line. It's so loud behind the counter at Los Tacos, was it me or was everyone leaning over yelling, "Sorry, what??" There line is stressful and then there's no place to stand when it's busy, let alone sit down. The tacos are good and the horchata is awesome, but they kill the cactus tacos with the hot sauce.

This place is relatively new to Chelsea Market, but they make a mean taco - easily one of the best ones I've had in NYC (if not the best). The menu's pretty simple - you can choose from tacos, tostadas, or quesadillas, with the variation of the main filling being what you choose. As we had just eaten at Cull & Pistol, we weren't that hungry - but we decided to grab two tacos (pollo and carne asada) anyways. These are pretty small and wrapped up almost how a crepe would be served to you, so be careful of any greasy goodness dripping out. Both meats were very tender and flavorful, and the combination of salsas and fresh ingredients really brings the food to life. The tortillas are small, but these are tortillas done just right - moist and chewy, not dried out and tough to bite into.There's not really any seating, just some standing area along the windows in the back - but there's not really much seating to begin with in Chelsea Market outside of the sit-down restaurants, so it's not something I'd worry much about. For the quality, the price is more than adequate. It may not be as big a taco as you get at Taco Bell, but you'll come away way more satisfied.

Stopped by on my way to the High Line on a sunny afternoon. The tacos are good, but the quesadillas (really a flour tortilla taco with melted cheese) is the better choice (know before you go!). I moved here from Austin last year, and Los Tacos has earned itself a place on my "best tacos in NYC" list. (That list isn't very long.)  Definitely give Los Tacos a try if you're a) in the area already and hungry or b) desperate for a good taco and willing to make a trek to Chelsea.And I shouldn't neglect to mention that the guac was pretty good, too.  I also had the horchata, which was the best horchata I've had so far in in the city south of Harlem.
Best tacos I have ever had in my life, even better than the ones you get in Mexico :)

I work in Chelsea Market for weeks at a time. This is my lunch place almost daily. When I am not working there I miss those tacos with all my soul. The adobada tacos on corn are simply sublime. So tasty. Also the guac and chips is delicious and tamarind fresh water is so refreshing.The place is very authentic, there is no sitting down, only standing.

Food was amazing but there's no where to sit! Smack in the middle of Chelsea Market which can be overwhelming in itself but its worth the treck. Make sure that you order the quesadilla, if you want cheese because that's the only difference between a taco and a quesadilla. Super flavorful and delicious.The horchata is also very good.  :)
This place is so good it must have been a mistake I gave it four stars it's definitely a five star

Everything on the menu here is delicious!1) Get in the line, which moves quickly -it's well worth the short wait!2) Place your order with the cashier & pay. When in doubt about what to order -just ask.... They don't mind questions & always a very friendly staff! (I like everything, but partial to the adobada taco (pork) and the quesadilla especial with pollo.)3) Then, slip on over to the next fast moving line, with your receipt in hand.4) Chef takes your receipt and asks if you want corn tortillas or flour.5) I always ask for my meal to go, even if I eat it at their small stand-up counter or take it with me -there's no table seating. Since it's warm weather, lately I've been taking my meal just one block away & enjoying it at the Highline or the small park at 10th Ave (Bet 14 & 15).6) Don't forget to garnish your own plate with their fresh cut radishes, three different types of salsa & lime wedges -all available at their counter.¡Buen provecho :)

As much as I wanted to love this place, 1st impressions are everything and mine was not good. First, I understood after reading reviews there were no seats, but seriously this was ridiculous. First of all you pay for your order only to find out you have to fight your way through people standing and eating at the counter to give your ticket to a cook. It's super disorganized and seems like you have to fight through to get the food you already paid for. Then the cook messed up and gave my husband's order with guacamole on it which he does not like. I told the cook guy I wanted guacamole on mine, and he got all huffy and said mine had it on there. But seriously there was no guacamole on it, I just think he was annoyed with us. The food itself was pretty good but really overpriced, the tacos should be $2 for how tiny they are. The chips and salsa overpriced for a tiny bag of chips and salsa so hot it hurts your hand to hold. I loved peaking at all the condiments at the counter, dreaming of using them but knowing I'd have to elbow my way in amongst people eating a meal to get any.So no, I'm not a fan. You may have ok tacos Los Tacos but you short changed my guacamole and experience. Not worth it.

Ordered the adobada taco and it was amazing. The meat was tender and the flavors were on point. Their horchata was also very rich and delicious. I would definitely come back for more authentic tacos. The only drawback was the eating area. Very hard to find somewhere to stand and eat, especially during lunch hours.

nom nom. carne asada on a corn tortilla is very good, but skip that and just go for the chicken. that thing is BOMB. i like how you can help yourself to the fixings (radish, pico de gallo, etc)there isn't that much room at the counter to eat, but you're close to the highline and also chelsea market has a lot of seating options available. i can't wait to go back.

Best tacos I've had in NYC. Delicious, cheap and messy, imo three key signs of great Mexican food. The nopal taco is my favorite.Quesadilla can be skipped - it's basically an open taco. Go a little early or late to avoid the long wait.
Favorite place in Chelsea Market. Great food, nice workers, clean environment.I love the beef tacos with that white drink, that stuff gets me pretty hyped.

I had the beef platter. Beef, just beef - cheese was to less. It was taste, but I was expecting a food explosion in my mouth. You can choose between 3 sauces. The spiciest on, was mine! Yummy got that shit

Me and my husband had cam earlier in the week and only tried one Ravi so that we could try other food at the Chelsea market. Let me just tell you it was so good we had to got back. I recommend getting a mula and then making 2 tacos out of that in stead of paying $3 somethings you technically pay $2.50 the meat was so good and the tortillas were so fresh and made in the spot. There is no where to sit but hey it's worth it. I live in LA and these tacos are better than any taco I've had back home.

Best in the city! I dream about their quesadillas. Their quesadillas are not what comes to mind as a medicore Applebee's-like appetizer; the quesadillas at Los Tacos are more akin to a larger taco that has a layer of cheese on the tortilla. I literally want to drink these, they are so good. Damn, now I'm salivating thinking about them...guess what I'm eating for lunch tomorrow...

Sick good! These are arguably the best tacos I've had in the United States.The tortillas are as fresh as they come, you literally see a woman pounding out the little flat sheets of corn joy with a little hand crank adjacent to the grill. The toppings are plentiful and neatly presented buffet style on the counter.The meats are juicy, fresh, flavorful, perfect.My only complaints, which I would gladly tolerate to get my hands on these any day, are the lack of seating/counter space for eating on the scene as well as the relative lack of more adventurous meat options found at really authentic taco places (stomach, skin, tongue, etc). Parking is hard to find in the area if you have a car, but it's worth the trek.

Best tacos I've had in nyc hands down. Very authentic with fresh quality ingredients. The line can get a bit long since it's in Chelsea Market but they go through the lines pretty swiftly. Get one of each tacos with all the fixins!
Great tacos but I'm dissapointed with service.  I ordered 4 tacos and a quesadilla to go, and they did not pack my quesadilla.

This place in Chelsea market was such a great find, thanks to Yelp!!! Food and ambience are exceptional! But lack of space for seating is taking it 1 star down. My husband and I tried the Beef and Chicken Taco and Astadas and our 11 year old tried the Chicken Quesedillas. We all loved the food and our son said it was the best Quesedilla he ever had eventhough it had a little kick to it. Will dream of these tacos the rest of my existence.

Best tacos in NYC. I simply decided to BAN any other taco place in the city. It's either Los Tacos No.1 or nothing.The carne asada and al pastor are just incredible. I always start with two tacos, illuding myself that I'll be content with that. I cannot think of one occasion in which I did not go back there for more within 3 minutes tops.

While I will stop short of calling Los Tacos No 1 a life-charging experience, they do make some seriously good tacos!I had two tacos: one Adobada (pork) and one Carne Asada (beef).  I listened to other reviews and had them on fresh corn tortillas.  For toppings I had onions, cilantro, and salsa.  I had them leave off the creamy guacamole sauce.  I also added some of their hottest sauce (which was more like a ground chili paste than a sauce).  Both tacos included a pretty generous amount of meat, but overall the tacos are fairly small.  Initially I was disappointed they don't include cheese (they may not even have cheese, I don't know what).  However, after I started eating them I forgot all about cheese -- the meat, tortillas, and sauce were all great.  Perhaps a bit salty, but incredibly flavorful.
Great, they have couple of options so dont expect to have a large menu, My fav al pastor !!! spice sauces are great as well

Took a couple tries to get this place right, but since figuring out my order it's been kind of a must-stop every time I'm in Chelsea Market. For starters, even though I'm regularly a corn purist, the flour tortillas are 100% the move here. Carne Asada over Adobaba (marinated pork) - my girlfriend likes the tacos, I'm partial to the quesadilla (this ain't no Napolean Dynamite flat-dilla either; more like a larger taco with a layer of melty cheese under the meat). The Especial (a deep fried quesadilla) is super rich and not by any means required reading, and the guac could def use some lime and pico (both readily available at the 'fixins' bar.As the other reviews have stated, this place is authentic and yummy. go for it

Cheap tacos. No, cheap DELICIOUS tacos. There's usually a line, but it goes fast. No where to sit, but seriously. The tacos are $3.75. This is NY. I like cheap occasionally. And if it tastes good, you've sold me! It's in Chelsea Market too so I enjoy looking at everything else inside.

I'm going to have to echo the wisdom of Peter D. on this one: get two adobada tacos. You may look at the menu and think, wow! carne asada sure sounds good, or, gosh, I'm in the mood for pollo today. It doesn't. You're not. Don't do it. Getting less adobada tacos when you could possibly have more adobada tacos is one of the great tragedies of my yet young life, along with the time that I dropped a fresh warm-out-of-the-oven Oreo brownie on the ground.Get corn tortillas for your tacos, because that's what the cool kids do. Help yourself to the self-serve salsas, but remember: spicy means actually spicy, not gringo spicy. And then perch on some bench in a corner of Chelsea Market and thank your lucky stars that you are eating twice the amount of adobada.

This place just gets it. When we go for a taco we don't want to have to cover it in sour cream, fake cheese and a bottle of hot sauce to feel we enjoyed a taco. We want just the right amount of tender protein that was roasted or grilled with care served at the right temperature with a tortilla and guac/cilantro/salsa that compliments the protein rather than over powers it. And though it is located in the bit too trendy chelsea market the moment you step up to this counter the authentic vibe makes you forget the cliches surrounding u.

Read reviews that Los tacos #1 was a good spot to eat.  While in Chelsea market I ordered a poll asado on a corn tortilla with guac n cilantro. It was quite yummy...small but yummy. I'm not complaining for a taco n bottle water for 5 bucks!

We loved Los Tacos No. 1! It would have gotten 5 stars if it had a seating area. We had the beef and chicken tacos which were totally terrific. We especially like the Mexican Condiments Bar where you can get peppers and limes. We had 2 drinks but I don't remember their names. They were quite good. The only negative is that is hard to eat tacos with kids without a seating area.
Steak quesadilla was amazing. Chicken taco was very nice- the charring on the meat was great. Overall very nice casual feed

The setup is not that great (too many people around and you have to add in your salsa, which can get a little crazy). I thought the tacos, specifically the grilled steak, was delicious. I wish there was a seating area, but that's Chelsea Market for ya!

My experience with Hispanic food is very limited but the moment I bit into one of their mujas, I knew they truly lived up to their name.Service- 9/10 Los Tacos No.1 had a long line when we went. Not sure if it's like this every day, but don't be discouraged! Unlike other restaurants who have long lines, the line moves pretty fast and service is pretty quick. The guy at the counter took our order in less a minute.Food- 10/10I ordered an adobada (or pork) mujas, which to me is basically like a tostada with an extra piece of tortilla and cheese, and my brother ordered an adobada taco. They were so good. Every small bite was bursting with flavor.The adobada was so tender and juicy. But be warned, the adobada is a little spicy so if you don't like spicy food, I wouldn't recommend it. They also had some Mexican soda in those old school glass bottles. You can just ask one of the guys to open it for you. They also have cute little stone pig shaped bowls filled with different kinds of salsa, limes, radishes, and peppers. Seating- 7/10I mean, it is Chelsea Market. It's extremely crowded and we were lucky enough to find a table. The ramen bar next door has seating but you can only sit there if you order food there.Pricing: 8/10Even though the food is good, the pricing was okay around $3-$4. But it's understandable as it's in a market that probably demands a high rent. The prices are pretty reasonable compared to other places Overall: 9/10Although it's small and crowded as it is in a popular market and the pricing is a little unreasonable, the small Los Tacos No.1 truly is a Mexican food haven.
I took  out the tacos from here,even its a little bit soggy,still taste great！！Love all meat!!Must go place in NYC

After seeing this 5 star taco place pop up on Yelp, I scurried my butt over on a Tuesday night at 6 on the dot to grab some grub!This place is located right next to the Spice market in Chelsea Market - follow your nose - you won't miss it! I quickly placed an order for a Carne Asada taco with corn tortilla - only $3.50! The next part is important - GIVE ONE OF THE GUYS YOUR RECEIPT otherwise they won't make you anything! There really should be some sort of communication between the cashwrap and the workers in the kitchen because it is REALLY confusing. Consider adding a sign? I had my steak taco done up with the works - added only a squirt of lime. It came topped with guac - YUMMOOOOO. I loved the corn tortilla and the intense flavoring of the meat. However, the steak itself was a bit dry. Next time, I'd be down to try the pork everyone is raving about! Once I inhaled my taco and peaced around 6:15pm, a line was starting to build! No worries though - they're quick!

Having read the bevy of good reviews for this place and finding myself craving a taco one day, I headed down to Chelsea to see what all the fuss was about.I ended up ordering a Horchata and a Nopal Quesadilla when I arrived. I was somewhat dismayed by the long line and the lack of seating for the place, but the die was cast.I'm embarrassed to say that I didn't know authentic quesadillas came on only one tortilla, but I guess this was an educational experience! It seemed a tad small for the $5 I paid for it but I figured that the taste might make up for it. Boy was I right. If I hadn't been in public, I probably would've broke down crying when I took my first bite. Yeah, it was that good. Everything tasted unbelievably fresh and vibrant. The cheese was unlike gooier quesadilla cheeses I've had in the past. It was baked a little more, not quite like the top of a lasagne, but maybe halfway there. The vegetables all tasted fantastic and the fresh-bakedness of the corn tortilla was apparent. It tasted exactly like a tortilla chip in the best way possible.The horchata was good, although not quite as much as the quesadilla. I found it to be a little too watery for my liking, although maybe I'm not remembering horchata like I used to.All in all the food definitely lived up to the hype. I would go back in a heartbeat, but then my bank account would start to hurt...P.S. I forgot to add that the salsas are also fantastic. Spicy, but also full of flavor.
These tacos deserve the hype. The long lines move quickly. The prices are right. They could use some seating....
Super delicious and cheap. My usual: 3 tacos: beef, chicken, cactus; and horchata OR tamarind aqua fresca. A must-go if you are near in the Chelsea neighborhood.

I'm originally from the Southern CA area near the Mexican border, and I can say confidently that I LOVEEE THIS PLACE! Whenever I am feeing homesick, I always stop buy for some amazing food. If you haven't tried these tacos, you are missing out.

I'm so used to listening to the wife complain about the dearth of true, authentic tacos in NYC, that her high praise of this place (plus repeat visits) definitely made me take notice.I'm no taco expert, but these are some pretty darn tasty tacos.  The carne asada is beautifully seasoned and at the top of our hit list, but the adobada is no slouch either, bringing with it a bit more heat.  The sauces are all delightfully flavourful without being overwhelming, and the corn tortillas are definitely my new favourite way to shovel delicious Mexican food into my mouth.The line can be a bit maddening, but the fact that they are consistently long speaks volumes as to the enduring quality of the food.  Check it out!

Bomb.com!!!! It's wonderfully delicious! The tortillas are freshly made, the carne asada is juicy and well seasoned and the ingredients on top are simple and the way they should be, onions, guac and cilantro. Mmm I am salivating thinking about this. So great. I can't wait to be in NYC to eat there again :)
All of the positive reviews are true. This place is excellent.
I am from San Antonio, TX and was raised with Carne Asada. But this is by far the best I've ever had!! Be prepared to wait in line, but it is totally worth it.

Mouth is salivating thinking bout the pork taco I cant even begin to imagine how I can convey the taste and how it made me feel.Good food gets me goin', this place got me goin' in a good way, set a positive tone to the entire day. Didn't mind having to eat cafeteria style in front of a bunch of strangers as taco meat is falling from my mouth. No shame, just enjoyment.Totally understand why this place had a solid 4.5 stars, we all know 5 stars is impossible once you go over a hundred or so reviews, always gonna b a hater or two.

In order to be truly number one, you have to outshine them all.Well Los Tacos No.1 you might be it.Literally grabbed some 45 min before closing and didn't have that "hello I'm meat thats been sitting here until someone claims me" taste.Line moves pretty quick. Awesome that guac is included and your choice of flour or corn. Order the abobada and carne asada. Abobada is hands down one of the best al pastor tacos I have had in NY.  Cant even describe the taste of em but my taste buds knew.Carne asada was cool, have had way worse and possibly slightly better. Would still order it again.Best friend got the carne asada quesadilla which looked like mine just with more cheese and the cheese made the difference.Little salsa bowls in the back end were dope and your choice of mild medium or hot.Definitely would return as a pick up and burn it off on the High Line.

Yep. Finally, a "taco shop" worthy of my San Diego upbringing!! Ate here yesterday, with another transplant from Brawley -hometown of one of the owners - and man, it is spot on! Thanks and all we can do now, is come again...and again...again...Great food! Love it!

Best tacos I have ever had in my life. Real authentic tacos with an upscale twist.Line can be super long during lunch and weekends. Hop over there for a quick dinner or a snack during off peak times and you'll be served pretty quickly!Worth a trip into the touristy and overcrowded with Europeans Chelsea Market.
If you are Mexican, this is the closest and most delicious Mexican tacos you will ever try!!!! love it here and always bringing new friends to try them, and they LOVE it too.

Every time I've gone there has been a long line but don't hesitant to wait. It's delicious! The wait goes by super fast. MUST TRY: adobada taco! Do not leave until you try this taco. Chelsea Market is popping with amazing spots but this place hits the mark as my favorite.

I've had tacos in Mexico and honestly these were just as delicious. The carne asada tacos with green salsa.. I have no words. Its a must try. And the nopales are so tender and juicy. Also they make the tortillas fresh. Super friendly guys and of course always busy

Awesome tacos. You have to stand to eat them but you eat them so fast it really doesn't matter. Carnitas and asada are my favorites but chicken is pretty good too. Two tacos filled me up for lunch and I was starving. Super inexpensive for NYC and very authentic. I will be back every time I'm in Manhattan.

These tacos are unbelievable. Everything is handmade, including the tortillas. Visiting from California, I can safely say that you really can't find better, more unique tacos than at Los Tacos No. 1. 6/5 stars.

Delish but kinda pricey. Ordered steak tacos, chicken quesadillas and chips with guac. Tacos were really tasty and I was impressed that the corn pancake for the quesadillas were made fresh. All in all, super tasty. Slightly annoying that you can't sit down and enjoy it all though.

Great tacos! I frequent Mexico a lot, and if you want authentic mexican tacos, this is where you get them. Even though i don't enjoy eating standing up, that is also part of the mexican experience. It's fast, easy, and delicious. I prefer the chicken tacos over the carne asada ones and definitely get the corn tortilla. Best tacos in the city!

wowowowoowowowowowow.Are you in Chelsea Market and you want a tasty snack? GO HERE. These tacos are bananas good. So so good. Ordered the nopal cactus taco and was really impressed with how flavorful it was and how good the cactus was. And oh man, the salsas here are SO GOOD.Only thing I wish was that there was another veggie taco or some fish tacos, but beggars can't be choosers, I GUESS. Anyway, make sure to stop here if you want some tacos, end of story.

Bursting with flavor, zing and authenticity, this place is ridiculously cheap for some of the tastiest food in NYC. The staff are friendly, smiley and evidentially take huge pride in producing consistently outstanding authentic Zmexican food. I work nearby, and find it almost irresistible to not stop here daily for lunch.Best orders for me are the succulent polo quesadilla - with avocado sauce, and the pork taco - meaty, spicy and with the sweet juiciness of the pineapple.Pile up your plate with the freshly made salsas and a squeeze of lime, and you gave the freshest most delicious snack or lunch. Prefer the corn tortillas to the flour - and go steady on the spiciest salsas!
Yummy yummy. This place is casual and full of flavor. I recommend the pork and chicken. The steak was one tier. Its worth the wait.

Holy crap. Freaking amazing. There wasn't just a party in my mouth. There was a damn rave in there. Got a chicken and a steak quesadilla. If you get it, you won't regret it. Their Horchata was pretty minty and good

Earlier today I received a text message from a friend of mine asking if I wanted to join him for a quick run to the Apple store. Since I wasn't making any progress on my lifelong task of fashioning an image of Jupiter out of Neil deGrasse Tyson's shining visage, I replied, "sure."Upon arriving at the Apple store, the two of us fell into our usual task of putting an image of Nicolas Cage on each and every device our grubby hands were permitted to handle. We soon learned that my friend needed to make an appointment in order to get a technician to have a look at his malfunctioning device, giving us a full 90 minutes to wait for an available "genius." We wandered into Chelsea Market. Anthropologie is right there on the corner, announcing to passers by that everything behind those doors will be overpriced and resemble something that one would find in their great-aunt's stash of the hand-me down clothes even she refused to wear. I suppose Anthropolgie has been a repellent these past two years, an offensive guard keeping me firmly away from Chelsea Market. My friend couldn't believe that I had never been inside, that I had never enjoyed the amazing fish market and the delicious gelato. I promptly pointed to the slow-moving masses of children and tourists as reason enough for me to have stayed away. It was a stalemate......until we discover Los Tacos No. 1. Forgive my ignorance, but I had heard very little about this place prior to discovering it. (I now recall seeing it on a "best tacos" list, but this is the result of post-meal research.)
