The meat is very tasty and soft. The focus of this place is on the tacos so you will definitely feel that the drinks are lacking some flavor. The guys making the tacos are very friendly. I would definitely come here often if I lived in NY.

Fresh, delicious, and cheap tacos in one of my favorite places, Chelsea Market?  Sold.  I had the pollo asada (chicken) and adobada (pork) tacos here, and they were on point.  They were more stuffed than other taco places and very flavorful.  The pork in particular was great, probably the best pork taco I've had in a long time.  The tacos had a subtle spiciness that added flavor but didn't overpower the meat.I was feeling indulgent, so I also ordered some horchata.  It was a little expensive ($3 for a small cup) and not the best horchata I've ever had, but it was still very refreshing and not too sweet.  I think my whole meal (2 tacos + horchata) came out to about $10 - very cheap for a quick meal that will leave you satisfied.Since it's basically a taco stand located inside Chelsea Market, this isn't a sit-down place.  There are counters along the sides to stand and eat your tacos, but stake your place early, i.e. before you actually have your order, because this place is popular.  They make the tacos from fresh ingredients right in front of you, and they have sauces, radishes, and other accoutrements on the counters that you can use freely.  Even though it can get a bit crowded, they prepare your food quickly.Overall, I'm looking forward to coming back here and trying their quesadillas and having more delicious pork tacos.  Los Tacos No. 1 might even give Taqueria Lower East Side a run for its money in my Mexican food heart!
Exceptional carne asada and pork tacos in Chelsea Market for a quick bite.   Only trouble is negotiating the line which can be extensive at times and finding counter space to eat.

I LOVE TACOS. I've eaten tacos at pretty much of lower Manhattan and THIS IS THE BEST TACO IN NEW YORK CITY.Get the adobada (pork) with everything. Stuff your face and thank me later.Tip: Skip the lines by going in "off times" like after lunch or before dinner.

Daaaaaaaaaamn!!!!!!! I'm from the westcoast and nobody does Mexican food better than the west siiiiiiiide!!!!!! But I'd have to admit that Los Tacos 1 is pretty damn good! I had both chicken and steak tacos with a side of chips and guacamole. Their portions were generous and you can self serve your own gourmet hot sauces!! I'd say this could be the best taco joint in NYC. With all the competition in Chelsea Market, Los Tacos 1 always has the longest lines, so prepare to wait a lil bit!

Best tacos in the city! I'm fond of the adobada tacos (pork with pineapple) with corn tortillas, though sometimes I'll sometimes switch them up for chicken or carne asada. Three different kinds of sauces, all fresh, plus limes & radishes as garnishes. Two are usually enough for me. Really reasonable for the quality. No place to sit - I take them to a counter nearby - but they are ridiculously good! Sometimes a long line at lunchtime, too, but worth the wait. Order & pay first, then take your ticket to one of the sweet guys at the grill.  Love love love this place!

It's probably one of the only taco joints in the city to serve up nopales - that slimy delicacy perfect in a taco.  Adobada is very tasty as well. Prices are reasonable, and service is quick.  Definitely improving the currently lackluster Mexican street food scene in this city. Worth battling the crowds in the Chelsea Market for.

I've been to Mexico a couple of times and had good tacos and this place is as close as it gets.  I had the steak and chicken tacos which were excellent.  Also had the Mexican Coke which is made with real sugar.  Looking forward to trying Los Tacos again to try some other types of tacos.

You'd think that as a Californian I've had my best taco experience crossed off my list, boy is that completely wrong. This beauty in the gorgeous Chelsea Market is worth the crowded alley waiting line. Service is quick and the food is even better! I ordered a Carne Asada hold the onions and it was heavenly.  The homemade corn tortilla really amps up the flavors to an authentic taco and the meat was perfectly cooked. Best taco ever!!!

Got the carne asada and adobado (marinated pork, shredded) tacos. Love corn tortillas and the salsa bar =] The pork is cut from a spit with slices of pineapple! It was delicious! The steak was yummy as well. These tacos were one of the closest in NY so far in reminding me of those beloved CA taco truck tacos...except these are about $3 each. lol We beat the lunch crowd fortunately. A HUGE line formed only 5 min after we ordered. Get there before 12!

The BEST quesadilla I have ever had in my life. There may be a line, but these guys are quick, so you should not have to wait too long- and even if you did, it'd be worth it. The corn tortillas (highly recommended) are made fresh on the spot. I recommend the Pollo Asado Quesadilla, everything on it, corn tortilla- but really, you can't go wrong here.

I am Mexican born and raised in Chicago, a city known for awesome food. So I'm very picky when it comes to tacos. I've been searching for GOOD Mexican tacos in the 2 years I've lived in NYC and I finally found this place! They are the best tacos I've had in a long time! A bit small for the price but I'll take what I can get! The salsas were delicious and the horchata was very tasty, not too sweet but not bland. I will definitely be going back!

Best tacos I've had in NYC and at least a 200 mile radius.  No frills operation and my only criticism is I would've loved for them to have arranged a little more stand-up eating space (just a simple 'bar' you can set your food down and eat while standing).  The way it's set up now, people are eating at the counter and if you're going to get your tacos or get fixings, you really need to reach over/around people and that could get a little messy.  I've had every type of taco they offer and each one is phenomenal in its own way.  I love the sides offerings: salsas of 3 different heat levels, raw radishes, limes, fried chilies (which I'm addicted to).  Agua frescas are good, if a little on the small side.Friendly bunch of people behind the counter, too!

When in Chelsea market, you must find Los tacos No.1. Hidden in the crowds if Chelsea market, this place has the best tacos I have ever eaten. I got the carne asada tacos. The meat was flavorful and tender, and the ratio of tortilla to meat was perfect. Eating the juicy taco may be messy, but the mess is part of the fun! Sometimes the line might be long, but that food is most defiantly worth the wait. The food always comes quickly, and the service is friendly and helpful. Los tacos defiantly deserves the title of #1!!
Superb tacos, especially the steak taco. They are juicy and full of flavor. Fast, no bs service, and prices were reasonable. Strongly recommend!

Awesome tacos in Chelsea Market. The line moves faster than you think, so don't let it scare you away.I tried to chicken tacos which were super flavorful. Made in a handmade, warm, corn tortilla, they had a kick to them but just enough to not throw you over the edge. The guac is also pretty good, as well as the three different sauces you can grab on your own. The tacos are also a good size - they look small but they are pretty loaded so 2-3 will leave you satified and full.
Super busy but pretty good food. The food is fresh and full of flavor but horchata not so much. But it is very pricy.

Hands down best tacos I've ever had.  And my wife is half Mexican so I've had tons all over the place.  I live in Houston but am from LA so I have had pretty good Mexican food.  My wife says that these tacos are the closest she has ever had to Mexico.
Great authentic tacos. Fast, eat 'em and go.In Chelsea Market so can eat there or walk to High Line.

The best tacos and quesadillas I've ever had hands down.   I don't just crave tacos, I crave the tacos from this specific place.  I'm fortunate to live nearby so yes I've had them consecutive days in a row.
These are some of the best tacos I've ever had. I got a carne asado taco and a chicken quesadilla. And both were amazinggggg! I made a yelp account just to write a review.
Tacos were amazing however their expedition process is a bit hectic and out of order.  Other than that food was outstanding didnt even have to add anything to them

A+This place is extremely good. Very fresh ingredients, and the tortillas are made on site. Maybe the best corn tortillas I've ever had.  If you are wandering through Chelsea Market, this is the spot, but keep your eyes peeled because it is tucked way in the back and you could miss it.

Great shop fit out, really works to recreate the cantina vibe you'd find in Mexico. Tried grilled cactus for the first time, it has a soggy & gooey texture and goes nicely with the spices they have there. It was interesting but not sure I'd have it again.

We were visiting from LA, so we are used to great street tacos.  The tacos are definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.  It's a little expensive for street tacos, but you definitely get what you pay for (quality and quantity of meat).

This is a great place for tacos in Chelsea. They serve four different types: chicken, pork, beef, and cactus (vegetarian option). I would suggest you go for the three meats, and stay away from the cactus if possible. Depending on the time of day, this place can be very busy and a long line can form. They are not particularly fast, so prepare to wait. However, the results are totally worth it. Very tasty, juicy tacos that are quite substantial. Quite authentic.
The condiments are all fresh and delicious. I had the pork and chicken tacos both were delicious but I liked the pork slightly better because of the flavor
This place is awesome. Go for the Carne Asada with everything! The food was better than the Mexican fare I had in San Francisco.

tried all the meat tacos - chicken, beef, pork. my favorite was chicken! Each taco was filled with lots of meat with option of corn or flour tortilla. Total was $10.35. YUM!  there was a small line for ordering but it was quite fast. After you get your receipt, you line up in front of the counter where they make the tacos and give one of the guys your receipt. It is so freshly made! each taco comes standard with guac (very liquidy), raw onion, and cilantro. I got it w/o onion (the guys will ask). Then you can top it with a variety of sauces - salsa verde (spicy), the red really spicy salsa, and fresh tomato salsa. Then on the end there are buckets of lime slices, grilled chilis (SUPER DUPER HOT!!! i eat spicy foods often but this one got me crying for first time in my life and doing a crazy 'hot hot hot' dance), cucumbers, dried chilis, and fresh radishes.

Very impressive tacos. The beef (carne) and pork (adobada) tacos are amazing and the guacamole is really tasty. You will need about 3 to be completely full (possibly 2 if you are on the smaller side) but its well worth it. The corn tortilla is recommended and traditional but I always go with flour. Their salsa is a little spicy. Everything is seasoned perfectly and there are tons of condiments. The best part is that everything from the staff to the food seems authentic. Remember to give your receipt to the next station so they actually make your food. I saw someone with the especial (a deep fried version of the taco or a large empanada) and I was envious. Need to try one next time.

Was intrigued by all the hype and people saying it's "the best they've ever had." I've been to so many taco joints over the years that it would be hard to recall which is the very best, but that said, just off the top of my head I can safely propel Los Tacos into my top two or three. Easily. The absolute key here is the homemade corn tortillas. You get a choice between flour or corn, both of which are amazing, but I stick to corn. Before you even take a bite, as you lift the taco to your mouth you can smell the freshness of the corn in the tortilla. Amazing.Pork, chicken and cactus tacos were all fantastic. Pork was my fav, ever so slightly better than the others. It's nice that you can see the person making your taco and can tell him/her exactly what you want and don't want in it. Los Tacos lives up to the hype!
Excellent excellent excellent!!! I would go here on a regular basis. They were all good, but if you only get one, make it the pork! Most of all -- they were extremely nice people.

Blah blah best tacos in NYC - what else can be said here?  Say yes to beef but steer clear of the cactus, it's just a watery flavorless glop that will make you sad.  But the beef tacos are incredible.  This place is a must try for anyone in the vicinity.

Just to the left off the main corridor that winds through Chelsea Market is a food stall that beckons: "BIENVENIDOS" to hungry foodies.  Los Tocos No. 1's simple menu is packed with flavors, Adobada (marinated pork), grilled steak or chicken, or nopal (grilled prickly pear cactus).  They can be ordered as tacos, tostadas, quesadillas or mulas with prices that range from $2.50 to $4.50.  The servings are small, but inexpensive enough to order a couple of selections.  Fresh batches of Mexican beverages Rice milk (horchata) and hibiscus (jamaica) or tamarindo (tamarind) water, so good my daughter says they were meant for the gods.  Select your own toppings, salsa, lime, etc.; find a counter or sit somewhere in Chelsea Market and enjoy.

This is The Most Authentic Full Blown Flavor as fresh as it gets and Great Service, smiles all around. the Steak, Fish and Al Pastor Tacos are Out of this World / It's the Best Way to Have A great MEal kicking with Flavor, Nutrition and Size for your money.
Best tacos in the world! :*)  Honestly never had better tacos and the staff here is awesome.
Try the quesadilla...at least one.  I can never eat less than 3 of these tacos.  They are incredible.  Finally, a dependable taco joint in the Meatpacking District.
Best take away tacos in the city. These guys lose a star because there is nowhere to sit and eat, otherwise food is 5 stars!!!!!!!!!!!!

Great Taco! I ordered all 4... Pork, Steak, Chicken and Cactus.  The Pork was by far the best. Definitely worth a trip to the Chelsea Market if you are in the area.  These guys are Pros.  They crank out fresh food very quickly and with a smile!  I will return over and over...

I am from Los Angeles and have been to Mexico multiple times. I know what real Mexican tacos taste like. The tacos at this place contend against the best places in L.A.. I don't care that the quesadilla is just a taco with melted cheese and the horchata was a little watery, the tacos are AMAZING...they are big and they come with guacamole, salsa, onion, and cilantro. Also the corn tortillas are homemade unlike most other taco places, they also don't fall apart. You will not be disappointed with the tacos at this place!

This place is located inside Chelsea Markets. I stopped by one evening with a friend and ordered:Carne Asada, Pollo Asado, Adobada, and guacamole. My friend and I thought everything was just okay. A bit disappointing as I was expecting my mind to be blown.
The Quesadilla Especiale is amazing. Try it with their pork, I've never had anything like it. Friendly staff and amazing food, not to mention very reasonable prices considering it's NYC.

This place is straight fire.Picture this, I was on a casual stroll through Chelsea markets looking to pick up some fresh salmon for dinner.  It was around lunchtime, so I was pretty hungry and keeping an eye out for a good spot to grab some food.I saw a sign for los tacos, and naturally because I love tacos I followed the signs until I saw the booth slotted in a no frills space inside of chelsea market.  I ordered up 3 tacos, corn tortillas and the works.  No more than 3 minutes later, one of the waiters serving the counter (will explain this part in a bit) hands me three freshly wrapped mexican style tacos.  I am talking straight out of Pueblo, just staring me in the face.  So I grab a couple of lime slices and stand at the counter to test out the goods.  Man were they delicious.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned chicken, with just the right balance of flavors.Now los tacos is not a sit down and have a romantic meal type of place, they have a few counters where you can eat, but like most of Chelsea Market; space is pretty scarce.  BUT, Los Tacos is a perfect little taco stand in the heart of NYC, with incredible food, and quick and easy service.I will be back.  Many times.

I never knew true taco love...until now. Nopales with hot salsa. After one bite, my eyes welled up with tears of bittersweet joy: happiness from the unbelievably delicious taste and texture i was experiencing, plus sadness that i do not live in NYC and cannot eat these glorious tacos on the regular! My partner and i inhaled our order in silence, too busy savoring the taste to waste our breath on words. We realized all other tacos up to this point had been complete imposters, pale shadows compared to the flavours we were experiencing. I do not exaggerate, and i came with no expectations: i just wanted to see how good grilled cactus on a corn tortilla could actually be. Now, my friends, I know. You should find out too.

HOLY GUACAMOLE!!! These simple yet delicious tacos are amazing! They definitely don't skimp on the meat, flavor, seasons, etc. Get it at least once "Con Todo" and I guarantee you'll love it! They even have cactus - which for vegetarians, is heaven! The saddest thing about this place I can say is that they're ALWAYS busy, and sometimes they run out of pico de gallo lolLOVE Los Tacos No 1I found it actually because I work in the building, and went down after my coworkers came upstairs with it.  The Pollo Asado and Carne Asado are my faves!
So so good! All of them! And the salsas! This is where to eat when in Chelsea market.

WOW!!  WOOOOOOOOOWWWW!!  WOOOOOOZWERS!!! WOW!!!!  My offices just recently moved into the area so I usually use Yelp to help find lunch suggestions (especially one that will not make me BROKE!!!) I found this and I AM SO GLAD I DID!!!It's a lil confusing to find (but I took advantage to explore the Chelsea Market)  And YES the line is LONG!!  But it moves fairly quickly..I got 1 chicken and 1 Steak taco...  They ask if you want everything and I said, just no guac (I'm allergic to avocado ::insert super sad face::)  He accidentally put it on the steak one anyway and I explained my allergy and he immediately made me a new one (He threw away the original.. Sad to waste, but just proves how fresh they keep it!!)    You have a choice of sauces, lime slices and even fresh radishes!!  All I can say about the tacos, THE BEST!!!  and the prices is on point and the guys behind the counter were all super sweet!!  FOR SURE going back super soon!

After reading about this place a lot, I had very high expectations. And it did not disappoint! The tacos are oh-so delicious! They are the perfect size. I had four. Make sure you try the NOPAL. Couldn't believe Cactus could taste so delicious. Also had their pineapple fanta. I loved it so much that I'm now a fan. This is one place I'm going to frequent.
Best tacos in the city! The adobada taco is my favorite. The chicken and carne asada tacos are also very good. I like to get them on corn tortillas and I suggest getting them with everything on it.

Seriously, the best mexican food I've had in New York City. I am so excited about these tacos, it's insane. I got carne asada with corn tortillas. I love that you can put as much lime as you want on them and they come with guac. You don't have to pay extra! The only down side is they turn to mush after 20 minutes. (Clearly a sign of fresh tortillas.) But there is no way they will last 20 minutes on your plate anyway...
Be careful! Don't unwrap the piece of paper holding your taco together. These little bad boys are so flavorful and moist, the juices will pour all over your hand. VERY VERY VERY tasty!
Carne Taco's were amazing, the beef was tender and full of flavor, make sure you get it with everything . Only issue is the Taco's aren't that big so you need to buy about 3-4.

So my manager has tried some of the best taco places in NYC and she said that this one is by far the best. She invited me to tagged along on a food adventure with her since I didn't believe her..boy was I glad that I got invited!!!As soon as we got to the Market...we walked through it and hit Los Tacos No.1 immediately. She raved about how great the steak was..so we got one of that..and since I have never tried cactus before, I had one of that too...and I also decided to tried the pork as well..Go BIG or Go HOME right?!The cactus taco was ok..not a huge fan, it was a bit slimy and a bit bland?? The steak taco was pretty good...flavorful and went well with the sauces that were on top....but the pork one, that one was the winner!!  It was marinated perfectly and soooo good!!! After my manager ate the pork one...she was like this thing is amazing!! I'm like I know!!! LOL..From there on..her love for steak turned into her love for pork!! LOLI love how they make the fresh tacos on the spot, and you have so many options to add what you like to the tacos. Furthermore, the boys and girls working there are super nice; I can't wait to come back for more pork tacos!!Note: Takes Credit Card except AMEX

$3 for tacos is average price, but they bit small. However, the tacos were wonderful and tasty. One of the best tacos I ever had. Chicken and pork was juicy. The flour tortilla was different, it was thinly good but they should give at least 2 because my fillings were spilling out. You can also top it off with the different sauces they have on the counter.

Tacos definitely live up to the hype.  Yes there will be a line but it moves fast.  No there wont be any seats, but theres plenty of places and surfaces to stand up and eat.  Tacos are legit and the prices are reasonable.  Very generous with the toppings and unlimited extras to add.  Al Pastor is the standout.  Also check out their fresh drinks which were delicious!  This is about as close as I've come in NYC to authentic Mexican tacos.

I want to thank this restaurant !!!!VERY COOL !I had a nice time with my friend.The food was extremely tasty ,the tacos I will come back for ) Love the smell of corn tortillas and the friendly staff that make the atmosphere so comfortable.Thank you
One of, if not the best tacos I've ever had in my life. The adobada was mind blowing. The corn tortilla was very fresh. Load it up with their delicious salsa. Seriously, just eat here.

I've been meaning to try this place forever, but I rarely find myself in Chelsea Market. And for a while, I was distracted by Quest Love's fried chicken across the way. Finally made it one Sunday morning, so tacos for breakfast!! (I guess more like brunch since it wasn't that early--just the first thing I had eaten.)I ordered the adobada and the carne asada tacos on corn tortillas, no cilantro. Order and pay at the register, bring your ticket down the counter and give them your printed order. They ask you if you want to corn or flour tortillas (this is when you give any special instructions), they make your food in no-time flat, you find a spot at the counter, add some salsa if you want, and chow down.Now, I can't claim to know what an authentic taco should be, but these were damn good. I get that it's a high turnover kind of place, so no stools at the counter (but some hooks underneath!) and you'll have to accommodate others trying to get to the fixings--but some more counter space or some seating might encourage me to order more.They are pretty generous with the fillings, so not the easiest or cleanest endeavor. But, that makes it even better. Definitely going back!

Excellent tacos favorite taco place in the world! I would rank these tacos as the best in the world ! Los Tacos No 1 you guys are the best keep up the great work i usually get 2 adobada 1 carne asada and 1 pollo asada i like the flour tortillas the best and also a mexican coke!

The adobado taco was amazing, a perfect blend of spicy and flavorful. It comes will sliced pineapple on top, which really made the taco stand out to me. I also ordered the pollo asado taco which was also delightful and went really well with the guacamole topping. My only con on the place was the salsa was watery. Spicy and flavorful, but way too thin for my taste. Otherwise, great lunch spot.
Agree with previous posts that these are the best tacos in NYC. The carne asada and chicken were good but I'd stick with the Adobadas. Amazingly flavorful and delicious.
Best tacos I've ever had!!!! Highly recommend going there. It's located in Chelsea market and I would say it's the best place to eat there. Definitely try the guacamole and adobada tacos

Delicious, excellent tacos!!I tried the trio, the steak, chicken and cactus tacos and found them all fresh and tasty. The cactus for obvious reasons piqued my interest the most, and it's chewy texture was really something.  The steak was probably my next favorite, as the meat was perfectly grilled and marinated. You could really taste the cilantro and spices. The corn shells were also tasty, and the cook did a splendid job putting them together without over stuffing them to must-spill proportions. I'll definitely be back for the quesadillas which seemed really popular. Take note though, there isn't any seating, but for the time being you can steal a few moments on the counter of the closed restaurant space just across the way to enjoy your meal.

This place truly lives up to the hype, some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. Got 3 tacos: pork, chicken and steak. For my money the pork was easily the best. After eating my 3 I had to go back in line for a fourth and opted for another pork, absolutely fantastic decision. ELITE TACOS
They really pack in quality meat and ingredients into the cute, freshly made taco skins! Every bite was enjoyable and sooo worth it. Definitely going back :)

Most amazing tacos  my husband who is from Guadalajara said he "tasted Mexico." He actually said "this is the best taco I've ever had." (I'm pretty sure he meant it's right up there with the tacos from Mexico he's grown up on.) This really made me happy considering it's like pulling teeth to get him to even say tacos in NY are even "ok."  Great spot in the city, so happy we found it. You will be 100% satisfied if you go there anytime of the day!

Must try this taco place if you are in the Chelsea Market area. I had Carne Asado Adobado tacos in flour and corn tortilla with everything in it (I liked the flour tortilla more than the corn tortilla). This is the best taco place I know of!! Line can be long but it moves fast and the price is reasonable.

Amazing tacos not to be missed. They keep the menu simple, authentic and delicious!  The pollo asado on corn tortilla taco is superb. Perfectly seasoned chicken accompanied by all the authentic toppings. Seating doesn't exist (it's Chelsea Market) so be ready to eat on the go or carry it a block to the highline where you can sit, relax and enjoy the view!
Thank you for this place. I was missing the SoCal taco so badly, nothing in the city could compare, but this place has become my saving grace. It's just as good. This is where it's at people.
Hands down, the best tacos you can find in New York. The price is a bit high, but it's not possible to find anything this good here.
Loved the tacos here!! We got the beef and chicken quesadilla. FLAVOR TOWN. I'm so hooked that I've already gathered a list of other taco joints to see how it compares!!
fuegooooooooooooooocactus nopal plate was dynamite. wish there was immediate seating but otherwise...fuegooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo.

The people making tacos are so friendly. You know these tacos are good whenever there are Asian people choosing tacos with salsa over the Asian place in front of the restaurant, which I thought was pretty funny. BUT, they do have a killer salsa. Yum

I only write these reviews if I hate or love the place. I love this place. Being a Southern California native and having gone to school in San Diego, I have to say I'm fairly picky about Mexican food. That being said, these are bar the best tacos I've had in the city. I get that the tacos are fairly small for the price you pay but you have to pay for a spot in Chelsea Market somehow, right? If you're going to eat in a tourist spot, expect to pay tourist prices. All in all, worth every penny.
Some amazing cali style tacos that always has a long line but moves very quick. All the tacos are amazing but the pork is hand down packed with the most flavor

Great taco spot in the Chelsea Market.  Its so easy to order and you get the freshest, tastiest taco around. Its very inexpensive here so its a great spot to come to before dinner or just a good place to stop in for a quick snack.

This place is such a gem in the Chelsea Market! Small soft tacos, big on flavor! Guacamole is very good. Salsa is a bit on the spicy side but very fresh and very good. And they serve Mexican Coke. ....how bad can it be? I had the pork taco and it was heavenly. ....juicy, succulent and seasoned to perfection. They have the pork turning on a huge rotisserie like stick in view of the customers. It turns in front of a vertical grill flame with a big hunk of pineapple of the top and bottom of the pork. Then they shave it off to order. ....oh my goodness!

This place manages to stand out from the crowd in a city where Mexican food is abundant.  The staff were friendly, the menu was simple and the food was delicious.  We liked that the tortillas were made fresh and that we had an option of choosing flour or corn.  The tacos had layers of flavor - spicy, tangy and sweet.  We also enjoyed the 3 salsas that are offered, they were fresh, house-made and allowed us to adjust the spiciness of tacos to our liking.  All in all, quick, simple and delicious food.  The only thing missing is 1 more vegetarian taco option - perhaps a avocado taco.

Got the carne asada and grilled cactus tacos. The really like the carne asada, the meat was tender and juicy and marinated well. It was a little bit on the spicy side for me but still very good. I was not too fond of the grilled cactus the texture was not what I had expected. We also got some chips and guac which were definitely on point. The guac had a nice kick to it and was so creamy. I would definitely come back next time and I'm going to stick with the meat tacos.

Great Nopales veg taco. Loved the authentic bar style service where you top off with the options provided at the counter. Unbeatable for $3 and change. Can't believe I have never been here despite coming to Chelsea market for years
Amazing! Best tacos in ny, just like the tacos I had in Mexico. Good and kind service. Perfect for a quick bite!
Had the beef and chicken taco in corn tortillas. Excellent.  Guacamole and chips were excellent as well. Deserves the high reviews on Yelp.
Love this place! Having lived in SoCal for sometime, this is one of the few places in NYC that come close to authentic Mexican food!
Best tacos on the east coast, bar none. You must try the deep-fried quesadilla. It's decadent.

A much welcomed addition to the Chelsea Market family, Los Tacos No. 1 was started by 3 close friends with a dream to bring the vibrant tastes of Mexico to the East Coast. The ingredients are all as fresh as can be, made to order in front of your eyes, and are as delicious as it gets. The menu is short and sweet with offerings of Tacos, tostadas, quesadillas, and mulas. You can also grab a Mexican Coca-Cola made with real sugar instead of the High Fructose corn syrup we all know and love to hate.

Best tacos in NYC! I am from Southern California (born in Brawley!) and the food is what I miss the most besides my family. That being said, as soon as I found out that one of the owners was from my hometown, I rushed to this place. It did not disappoint and truly reminded me of home. Thank you Tacos No. 1!

We go to Chelsea Market specifically for these tacos! My favorite is the streak and the bf's is the pork, but they're all delicious! The line can get long and there's no place to sit close to the restaurant.. but it's still so worth it!
Amazing tacos; fresh and clean.  Cactus on corn good for vegetarian.  Flour tortillas have lard.  Beans have pork.

This might be one of the best meals I've ever had. We ordered four tacos: carne asada (grilled steak), pollo asado (grilled chicken), adobada (marinated pork), and nopal (grilled cactus) on flour tacos. The service was fast, and the meal was inexpensive. The flavours were unique and complex. The grilled cactus had a great texture. Come for the tacos and stay for the rest of the Chelsea market.
Great Taco!!! Maybe the best that I have eaten...

I had heard raves about this place from friends and co-workers and finally made it there to test it out. And let me tell you, these tacos are fantastic! The service was extremely friendly and fast. I had the pork version and it was bursting with flavor like I had never tasted. Plus they have a countertop of different salsas and add-ons if you want to mix and match. I only had the one but it was plenty filling for $3.50. I can't wait to go back and try the other flavors.

I am a Southern California native so I know authentic tacos and these guys KILLED IT!! I had the adobado and carne asada tacos. Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection! I've taken my friends that visit me and they all agree that they are the best tacos the've ever had!! I AGREE!!
As all the rest of the reviews are suggesting, this place is hands down the best tacos New York has to offer. Emphasis on going there to anyone looking for tacos
Best tacos in Manhattan hands down. TJ style tacos with high quality meats. I recommend adobada and steak tacos on corn tortillas. So good, even in LA I miss these! The horchata was pretty average.

great tacos really good. no space to sit down and eat them. nowhere. for a very long time. you can eat them standing at their super crowded counter elbowing people left and right trying to eat . front and back people trying to catch their orders being handed to them and up and down trying to avoid people's hands reaching for salsa, pico de gallo or napkins. and even if you are ok with that you still have to inhale the food and leave asap as more people are waiting for a spot on the counter. even if you walk out into the main corridor and look for a place to sit at the burger and shakes /ice cream area chances are your tacos will get cold long before you find a seatmeanwhile the korean mokbar place right across from Los Tacos has a friggin concierge and table service and is never even close to being at capacity and the tea selling spot a few feet away has barely any customers and no seating or counter space whatsoever and these two take up 3 times the Los Tacos space.they need to rethink their contract with chelsea market cos their tacos are really good.
Fabuloso!!! Handmade, luscious corn tortillas with perfectly cooked carne asada, cilantro, onions, guac, & spicy salsa... washed it down with a Mexican Squirt soda (sugar not HFC). Perfect lunch!
The best authentic Mexican tacos in New York City!  Fresh tortillas (corn / flour) made by hand in front of you, salsa, guacamole!  Yum!

I must say, that they are a little pricey but hey it's Chelsea. I would definitely say it is well worth it! I had the steak and goodness, they were made to perfection. They are also very generous with the meat that goes on the tacos. I was a little disappointed with the amount of chips they give you, but they have amazing guac! Will come back frequently.

One of the best tacos and quesadillas I've ever had. Fresh spicy and delicious. Nowhere to sit but elsewhere in the market but not a huge problem. In the words of Arnold Schwarzenegger, "I'll be back."

Completely do not understand the hype of this place. The tacos were below average. My chicken was average and mostly flavorless and the corn shell ripped before I could even take a bite. My husband and friend said their quesadillas were average. I do not think this place is worth the wait in line, not to mention there is no where to eat your food. There have to be better taco places in NYC and better food options in the market.
Really good and priced ok (like $4/taco), a little more than I usually pay for tacos, but definitely a unique taste and an experience. My only deal is there's nowhere to sit.

Unexpectedly found this place.... We were driving down 15th St. And contemplating on what to eat when suddenly we looked up and saw people stuffing there faces.. Saw the name tacos... Thought hmmmm ... Let me YELP it ... So glad I did!!! Seriously great tacos! The carne asada is delicious! The only thing I did not like ...it's too small lol.

I haven't traveled much in the US so I haven't tried tacos from too many different regions. I hear there are amazing taco spots in Cali and Texas. But if you tell me a taco exists that's more delicious than those served at Los Tacos No.1... I wouldn't believe you. How can it get more delicious than this? These tacos are fully saturated with deliciousness. Believe the hype!
My favorite mexian food in NYC！nice location n price，also u could do selfservice with the sauce
Absolutely delicious and authentic! My favorite is the taco adobada!

What an amazing taco joint, the chicken taco was the best with all 3 sauces on it. Cactus taco was just as good if you can get use to the slimy texture of it. Def would come here again, the Chelsea market has so many different things going on.

YUMMY!! And fast! Oder in the front and then give your ticket to the "guys" at the far end of the counter. Lots of condiments/lime/radishes to add to your order. No beer so get that somewhere else and bring it over. Loved it.
Nice place!!! Tacos we're delish, but a bit over spiced . But my girlfriend loved it. We'll come back.

Not sure why this place isn't a full 5 stars. I'm from California = a Mexican food/ taco snob and these are honestly some of the best tacos I've had. Such incredible flavor in the meat whether it's pork or steak or chicken. A must go
Best tacos I have ever had. We go here every time we are in NYC. Cheap and delicious, great value. Always crowded with customers but service is quick so you're never waiting long for your food.
Rafa (one of the taqueros) is amazing. He's always in a great mood and provides an excellent service.

Can I swear on here?!!? These tacos are f*cking stunning!  Get your tail here, these tacos are world shattering, fresh good you will dream about each night! I purchased 2 of the steak, pork and chicken and I actually believed the pork was going to be my favourite it turned out the chicken was the greatest. So, that being said I went up and got more! As I said before get your behind there! P.S. Service is outstanding!
Hands down the Best tacos I've ever had. Ordered the steak and chicken on a flour tacos. Quick and friendly service.

Quite simply, the best tacos I've had in NYC (or anywhere for that matter). All 4 taco options (beef, chicken, pork, cactus) are delicious with the most perfect toppings on each. I loved them all! Cannot pick a favorite. The pork was the most spicy but it wasn't overpowering. Their home made tortillas are the best!
Holy smokes. Visiting from Chicago and I had a steak taco from here. It was delicious! I would plan to eat here everytime I'm in NYC from here on out. Such great food! Love this place!

The line might be long, but it moves really quickly and it's well worth it! One of my favorite places to eat in Chelsea Market, and it tastes just like street tacos, the authentic kind you can't ever seem to get enough of.  The pork tacos will blow your mind, and they even come with pineapple that make it all taste a little tropical. The flavored are all perfect, and I go back frequently.
Absolutely delicious! They are pricey but I'm not from around here so I'm not sure if that's normal for this area. $3.25 and up for one taco seems a bit steep. They are tasty expensive tacos though!

SERIOUSLY NO. 1 TACOS. BEST TACOS IVE EVER HAD.They corn tortillas are hand made, which make the tacos all that better. I had the adobada and carne asada. Both are great, but adobada is to die for. The tacos are full of flavor and they don't jip you on the meat. The tortillas are also bigger than normal so the price is well worth it. I highly recommend eating here!

A bit more expensive than the stuff I'm used to eating in California. Not saying that the quality of the stuff their is not as good or the stuff here is bad. But they do have quite a limited selection and expensive sodas - tho Mexican coke is always good. Go for the pork  tacos instead of beef.. Much more flavorful in my opinion.
Some of the best tacos I've ever had. The tortillas are made to order and the portions are generous. There's no seating by the stand so be prepared to eat while standing.

Really worth the trip if you are in the area. Had a grilled steak, grilled chicken and marinated pork taco. All delicious with the pork taco being the best. I ate it last and it was still the most enjoyable, which shows you something. A little pricey but will be back again for sure.
The best tacos I have found in NYC to date. 'Nuff said. A must try.
Friendly staffers. Pork taco was the best of the bunch. Wish chelsea mkt had more room to sit and public bathrooms.

There's not much I can say that hasn't been said in the 890+ reviews of this place. You already know that there's not much room, the Horchata is legit, and the ordering process is a little unusual. I will say, that if you're from CA or you're one of those people that thinks "there's no 'good' Mexican" food in NYC, this place will change your mind. Btw, there's plenty of good Mexican food here, it's just more Tex-Mex than Cali-Mex. That said, if you have taste buds, you will enjoy this food. So do yourself a favor, stop reading, and go order already!
GAME BLOUSES I don't have to fly all the way home to LA anymore I'm crying thank you based god

My favorite fresh tortillas in the area are the ones that I make.  My second favorite fresh tortillas are those made at Los Tacos No. 1.  Everything that they make is top notch: the tortillas, the fillings and the toppings.  I'd even rank their horchata as some of the best that I've had.  I've been several times.  On the most recent occasion I was with an associate who had spent a year in Mexico for work and, while there, spent his spare time trying to find the best Mexican street food.  He also vouched for this place's authenticity.

Best food in the Chelsea market. They have delicious tacos and quesadillas. Salsa, radish, lemon and hot sauces are all self-service which makes a more natural touch to the atmosphere. Both beef and chicken quesadillas are my favorites. The only downside is that they have limited standing area(3-5 people).

Imagine if this place was open 24/7 ... that's the kind of planet I'd like to inhabit.  I'll keep it short and sweet: you must eat the tacos here.I absolutely go crazy for how good they are each and every time.  The meat (or chicken) is always super delicious and well spiced/marinated.  All of the other ingredients (always asking for tacos "con maiz con todo!") are super fresh and delicious too.  Sigh, I am moving soon and writing this review is breaking my heart because I'll miss this place, the dozens of tacos it has fed me and the endless memories I have with people I've brought here.

Best. Tacos. Ever. By far the best and most legit tacos I've had in NYC. I could eat them all day, every day. Definitely recommend them to anyone looking for an awesome true Mexican taco. So delicious!

Yum!  We came here early on a Saturday evening, looking for a snack before going for a walk on the High Line. The line to order wasn't too long and it moved fairly quickly. These tacos are tiny but they cram a very generous amount of filling in there. That means that they super messy to eat so don't go there with people you want to impress since pieces of filling will most likely end up everywhere in your attempt to bite into it. I had the chicken, my husband tried the pork and beef, we agreed that they were all equally delicious. Con todos is the way to go (they'll top your taco with salsa, cilantro, onion and guac) and you can still choose from a bunch of sauces and add ons on the counter. We'll definitely be back!

Be ready to order twice as much as you were planning to because their portion size is tiny! You can see through the tortillas they are so thin, and even their plate item only has two small scoops of beans. Everything feels like is tapa sized. Their cactus has very weird seasoning and just tastes very sour. I've had cactus in other Mexican restaurants that put this to shame. Go to Chipotle instead and the food will taste better and you can actually have a full meal.

Best tacos I had outside of Mexico and approved as the best in New York by my native Mexican friend! Authentic cuisine is not only represented by the flavor, but also by the atmosphere of the place. A bit uncomfortable to eat, but that's where the magic is!
The tacos here are incredible - especially the Adobado ones - That's what I'm talking about - I've had some great tacos/burritos in my day especially in Cali but these are the best in NYC by far....

Can't say anything beyond what the other reviewers have said. One of the few places(maybe the only one) in Manhattan that serves Tacos the way they are meant to be-at least I perceive them as such. Do try the Horchata though-it was my first time, and I liked it.
I'm Mexican and let me tell you.. BEST tacos in NYC!! The guys working there are so friendly and great and there are handmade corn tortillas :)
I only had 1 adobada taco because I was just trying to eat my way through Chelsea market and it was amazing! just so flavorful!

Being from Califronia and hearing some skepticism about Mexican food in New York, I decided to try this place out after walking through the Chelsea Marketplace. I decided to get a carne asada taco after reading some good reviews. The meat tasted great and didn't disappoint. My meat-to-tortilla rate was a little mysterious since I still had a lot of meat leftover once I finished the tortilla. I was happy to find horchata here, which was great as well. This was a good sized snack for around $7
This is one of the best taco places in Manhattan. Beef tacos are slightly better than chickens.
Mouth watering tacos.  The best is the Pork.  So glad I don't have travel out of manhattan for tacos anymore.
I've lived in south Brooklyn for many years & have tried just about every legit taco place. Los Tacos 1 is the real deal! Usually a long line but definitely worth it.

They really are no. 1!Corn tortillas are made fresh and their carne asada tacos taste almost better than the ones I've had in Mexico. Their Pork might be more popular, but in my opinion the steak takes the cake.

I had the adobada taco on the handmade corn tortilla. I don't even like pork or tacos and I have been raving about this for the past week. Absolutely amazing. I went with my friend, who didn't order anything and was standing behind me while I waited for mine to be cooked. The chef saw my friend and asked her if she was waiting for one. When she said no, he told her that he was giving her one on the house. The line moved so fast and the staff is so friendly. And, as everyone else has stated, these are some of the best tacos in NY.

Not sure why everyone goes crazy for this place. Decent tacos, but nothing special. I've had great Mexican fare in Arizona and this place doesn't even come close to the average taco shop in the Phoenix area.
This place feels like home (I am Mexican). The tacos are incredibly awesome and at reasonable price. The taqueros are friendly and the atmosphere is great. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Being from Arizona, I know what good street tacos taste like. (You would have a hard time finding even average street tacos there.) Unfortunately, New York does not have the same tacos that I grew up loving... well except for this place. I always order the carne asada tacos. Simply amazing. The price per taco is a little high, but maybe that's what's to be expected at Chelsea Market. Choose the flour tortillas - they're made fresh right in front of you. The line can be intimidatingly long at times, but it moves quickly.

These are truly some of the best tacos & quesadillas I've had- they make your quesadilla in front of you and you choose the salsa. plus horchata, Jamaica & tamarindo agua frescas. Go here, eat plenty- you won't regret it.

forgive grammar and spelling: first we have to remember we're in new york and not in texas (where I've finely refined my mexican palette) that being said and being in meatpacking (chelsea market) they are 3 times the price of a texas taco, portions are okay im used to double tortillas (here it was only one per taco) for the nearly $4 you pay for a taco, BUT this is the same area that a couple blocks away you get a beer for a mere $16 (tip not included), ok im past the price and nowhere to sit.Im greeted by a mexican guy (i would have been sad if none of them were mexican) takes my order explains the ingredients, and the process has very "production line" feel to it to get the customers their food not too sure how i feel about the guacamole sauce (kinda liquidy) and i miss simple lettuce and tomatoes but being this the chelsea market nothing is simple.It feels like im in a sort of airport/amusement park with a mexican franchise.its not on my top 10 mexican places at all but i can see and appreciate the effort put into this, and deffinitley breaks my top 5 mexican joints in new york (but why do i want to get mexican food in nyc is beyond me) (actually its because of the pix11 report on top 100 fav restaurants.i was however instructed to try a quesadilla so i will be doing that in the near future but may not write a review unless its lifechanging

The Adobada taco is incredible. This would be a 5 star spot if it weren't for the fact that ordering/receiving your food is a logistical nightmare. Prepare to have people hanging off your back but after lingering around aimlessly for 15 minutes you'll be handed the savory goodness. You'll likely have to reach over two or three fake hipster chicks to receive the goods but all in all it will be worth it. Enjoy
Almost 4 dollars for a taco that could only feed a Keebler Elf. Are you guys serious? Their shakes are good, however.

I don't really eat a lot of tacos so I don't have a lot to compare it to, but I thought it was pretty good! When they take your order they're really quick and speak fast so be ready. the meat was juicy and just having 2 is a good amount. Get some coke. Have some tacos. Not a bad way to end your day.

Take it from a California boy....these tacos are legit. Certainly best I've had in the city and better than almost everything I've had back home. For me it's all about the adobada (pork) with a flour tortilla. The tortilla itself is worth a visit. The carne asada is also really, really damn good. Wish there was a place to sit, but oh well. I'm a fan for life.
The best tacos ever!!  I've had many tacos living in So Cal, but their Tacos are the Best!! My family like chicken better than beef. I'm so glad I ate there and Chelsea Market was really cool too!!

I grew up in San Diego, so I'd like to think I know a thing or 2 about Mexican food! Nothing on the east coast can compare to SD or Texas Mex, but Los Tacos is pretty dang amazing. I had the cactus taco and chicken. So Yumm. Their drinks are pretty amazing too. I was stoked to see Tamarindo  (water infused with tamarind), a San Diego taco shack staple.
Adobada taco on a fresh, warm homemade corn tortilla will become that thing you crave whenever you're hungry.

OBSESSED. I usually get 3 pork tacos with the corn tortilla. The salsa is extremely spicy so if you can't handle it, ask the guys to make it without. So good, if part of my taco fell on the ground I would eat it off the dirty streets of NYC. Yup, THAT good

These might be the best tacos I have ever had in the 5 boros. I always get the homeade corn tortillas which are great. They have all the salsas and pico de gallo to add to your tacos which are great. The adoboda is excellent. I'm a big fan. Cheap as well. The reason it only gets 4 stars is because its almost impossible to find a spot on the bar to eat. PS be prepared to deal with a lot of tourists when you come here

Wow!!! Absolute delicious tacos!  I had the carnitas... So yummy! They are a little too spendy for street tacos.I wouldn't choose to come here if I were really hungry. But if you are looking for a quick bite packed full of flavor this is your stop.
The pork corn tacos were my favorite. The salsas were all amazing. The food was exploding with flavors and color. I could eat hear daily. I will return

First of all, I must say their Chicken is definitely the best and can be found nowhere else. Affordable pricing for single or group of friends and for sure, you cannot go wrong with any choice you make here.

Outstanding. Fresh, crispy and authentic tacos. Worth the trip to Chelsea market. U have to eat standing up but that's what u would do at a taco stand in Mexico. And these tacos are even better. Try all 3 meats.

I'm so sorry but I HATED, HATED the cactus. It's slippery and, quite frankly, I thought it was DISGUSTING.I don't eat meat, so I'm sure the other tacos are delicious but........ I left with an awful, awful taste in my mouth.Maybe I'll come back for their chips and gauc...?

The ONLY reason for 4-Stars is the pint-sized tostados. These lil' tacos pack SUPER-SIZED flavor tho'! I LOVE them all! Pollo & Carne are my favs! Luv the fresh picante & salsa verde. Guac & Chips are a little priced on the high side, in my opinion, but delicious nonetheless. Expect lines but they know how to move you quickly. If you're staying to eat, you'll  be standing at the squished counter-space that's rarely available. Expect strange elbows to cross over bites you take as they load up on condiments. But hey, Get In Where You Fit in because if you leave, you're just going to turn right back around to come get more! THAT GOOD! Mexican sodas are the only way to wash it all down. GREAT food, light on the pockets.

I was starving and we were out and about.  Grabbed my yelp app and spotted this place.  Ordered a chicken and a steak taco.  Pretty small portions but they are like street tacos.  The chicken was the best.  Real fast service.

When I saw the excellent yelp reviews for this place, I knew I had to try it when I was in the chelsea area. My husband and I shared pork tacos, a steak taco, and a chicken quesadilla. The pork was my favorite, but it was all super flavorful and delicious.  There was a line, but it was very quick. The only downfall is that there's really no place to sit and eat.

If you want some good... no GREAT tacos you have to go here. The wait is a bit long but it is so worth it. I decided to go in with my family and saw the line was pretty long, but then the long line also made me want to try the tacos even more to kind of get in the hype. The wait wasn't too long as the line went down pretty quick, and we ordered the steak, chicken, and pulled pork and I have to say all three were a hit. The flavors and the spiciness of the taco definitely had the taco game on. I didn't want to order too much, because we just wanted a taste, but we definitely regretted not ordering more. When you order I recommend order 3 per person, because within 2 bites it is gone.
Best tacos I've ever had, period.  I've had them everywhere from Southern California to Chicago.  These are the best.  Get the corn tortillas and enjoy.
Adobada, but don't take all the toppings. It'd be nice if there was space to eat.

i don't eat pork but that carne asada is good enough for me.you have to spend a minimum of $6 to use plastic but it's not bad since you need to buy at least 2 tacos to keep you satisfied.the pollo adobo was NOT good :/the best mexican food i've had in NY. LOVE it.
Delicious tacos, authentic Mexican. Only downside is you have to stand but it's so worth it. I will definitely go out of my way to stop here.

Can I give a place 6 stars? Cause that still may not be enough. First of all, I am a taco snob. A completely helpless taco snob. This place has tacos that are off the chain and compares to anything you'll find in Texas or Cali. I usually go with a pork taco and a chicken taco, both of which are delicious. The pork has a great sweet and spicy thing going on since they put some pineapple in the taco. The place also has a while bunch of free sides that you can add to your tacos. Careful of the spicy sauce people. Food is very well priced. There is always a line and ever since the ramen place took up the side wall, not a lot of counter space. Despite this, go to Los tacos and eat until you need to roll home. Best taco in town.

No lie, this is probably one of the best Mexican places to eat. The food is just simply amazing and you can smell how good it is from far away. So this place is actually tucked in a little corner across from a Korean ramen place. The place doesn't have seating so stand and eat or find a seat somewhere in Chelsea Market. We had the carne asada taco and quesadilla with chips and salsa. The food was smaller then expected so order more than one because we were still hungry afterwards. First bite you already knew this shit was going to be good. The quesadilla they gave me was like an unwrapped burrito (the ingredients were laying on top of one tortilla unlike two tortillas pressed together like other quesadillas) so I folded it like a soft taco. It was really good! The salsa had a great kick to it. They're spicy stuff made me have the sniffles so you know it's good. But yeah amazing place, definitely will come back. Only downsides are no seating and small portion so order a lot to get "full full".
mexican in ny is always a bit iffy but this place was solid! the line has never been reasonable which is the only complaint but that is because it is a good taco.
Service with a smile, and most importantly, the MOST DIVINE tacos!!!!!!!!!!

Really good tacos, but on the expensive side.  Not worth going out of your way for, however, if you're planning a visit to (the crowded and overly-commercial) Chelsea Market, then drop a tenner and enjoy.

Good carne asada, a little disappointed in the adobada. A little more seasoning would have made it way better. The homemade flour tortillas were okay but got soggy really quickly and fell apart. Salsa was yummy and the guys behind the counter were really nice about putting a little more on when asked. I recently moved back from the west coast and have been looking for a good taco shop, so this place is solid for New York but can't really compare to west coast tacos.

My wife and I were trying to find a place to eat in Chelsea Market on Thanksgiving day for lunch. The only place that we could agree on was Los Tacos No 1. It was an excellent decision.It was busy, but the line went quickly. The employees were pretty cheery for having to work on Thanksgiving day too.When you get to the counter you order the main taco filling and then you are able to add cilantro, onion, guacamole, etc and there is no extra charge for it.We both ordered 2 tacos each (each being around $3-$4). We also both got a nopal (cactus) & a carne asada (beef) taco. The nopal taco was good. I have had nopal before but sometimes it can be really salty. In this case, not so. The carne asada taco on the other hand was EXCELLENT. We were both glad that we saved that for our second taco to eat.They also have an excellent horchata with none of the horchata-cinnamon sediment that happens sometimes at other places. Very smooth and refreshing.2 tacos may seem like a small meal but it was definitely just enough for a lunch.The only issue for this place is the seating. There isn't really any. The ramen bar nex door was closed and had a counter so people sat there. There were also a few tables but I think it was also for the ramen place. When that ramen place is open I don't know the seating situation. Don't let that discourage you though. It is eating even without seating available.

Now these are the bomb.   Best tacos in ny.  Well worth the price.   Portions are perfect.  Flavor is deep and will not disappoint.   Only reason not 5 stars is cause food was a trace cool and toy want tour tacos hot.   Won't stop me from chiming back though.   I'm a future regular.   You'll see how amazing it is.
Great tacos, tasty meat and salsa. Chelsea markets nice venture for an hour or two but gets busy and nowhere to sit.
Pretty freakin good tacos and setup. Very nice crew working hard,& a Nice place to stop for a bite in the Chelsea market. Go chill with your food on the highline.

I came here on a Tuesday night and the line was still sizeable. They were out of pork (Adobada), which accordingly to Yelp is their best taco, but I had the steak and chicken in both taco and quesadilla. The orderin process is a bit. Funky, but you order and pay at the register, then move to the opposite side of the bar, where you hand your receipts a cook who will prepare your order just how you like it. You can then move to the center, where they have salsa set up.Frankly, these may be the best tacos that I've had in New York. Given how small they were (I will assume that the average person will need about 3 tacos to feel satisfied), the price was a little high; also, the line was long, and I'm told that it's always this way.

Recently I've been obsessed with tacos. While traveling to NYC earlier this week, I decided to try this spot based on reviews and I am do happy I did! My boyfriend and I shared three pollo asada tacos (mine on corn tortilla, his on flower). They were very flavorful and not over stuffed with toppings. Watch out for the salsas , they're spicy !!!
I live in California just north of Tijuana Mexico and this is about as close to being in TJ as you'll get. I'd put these street tacos against anything you'd find in Southern California and even TJ.

Soooooooo Yummy!This might be the best Mexican food I've had in years! I ended up ordering the " quesadilla" instead of a taco because the taco did not come with cheese, but the "quesadilla" was really just a taco with melted cheese so I ended up with just what i craved! I got the chicken and the seasoning on the meat was perfect! The cheese added a lot of flavor and the corn tortilla was nice and moist and soft. Yum Yum Yum!You'll probably need more than one to make a meal, but since I was only looking for a snack - one was perfect!

the best pollo and carne tacos in the city, hands down.  The QUESO taco ( pollo or carne) are also off-menu solid pics, but get a bit messy eating with your hands. Good for on the go eats, or even to eat there.  there isn't seating, so should be comfortable taking it to go, or standing and eating.

The tacos here are awesome! I got a few of the steak tacos and the steak quesadillas since a friend recommended the steak since it was good. Definitely a good decision on the steak because they cook it very nicely here. I was told that the guys who run and work at the place are mainly from Mexico and California. They also serve mexican coke which is a nice touch.

My husband and I stopped here for a quick lunch on the way to the Highline. We ended up checking out the rest of the market too - really cool architecture and stores.The tacos were small, but tasty. The marinated pork was the best of the three we tried because it had the most flavour. The steak and chicken were good, but made better by the sauces and limes they have at the pick up counter. Totally get a side of guac and chips - it is big for only 3 bucks. If you see a open seat anywhere in the market, grab it while it is free! It was busy when we were there at lunchtime and ended up sharing a table with a couple different people.

One the best tacos I've ever had.  The carne asado taco were really tasty and was actually a good size.  The same went for the pollo asado.  Having coca cola from Mexico in a glass bottle was a huge plus.

Definitely a los angeles taco place..spicy salsa. It wasnt quite dirty enough for my liking...I wanted some fried rolled tacos with gauc and shredded cheese and lettuce...but no go.  Its just a little too nice to be real so-cal mexican..gotta get dirty.
I am from the west coast and the tacos and quesedillas here are the best I have had in NYC.

Amazing!!!!! The soft corn tortilla with whatever - chicken or steak is the bomb diggity (I don't usually refer to food in comparison, but these tacos are amazing). These are the best authentic tacos I've ever eaten and where they're located - market environment similar to EATELY but more rustic.

Preeeeeety Goood.The produce and meats being used are very fresh and get prepared in front of you.The place is pretty hygenic , but chelsea market isin't , it's filled with grime and residue from tourists and mainstream madhatteners..I like the price to size ratio of this Fast Food place , but would prefer to see them also making big burritos for 6-7 bucks rather than paying 7.50 or more for 3 small gentle tacos.

I went there yesterday and it was awful there were a lot of people waiting, horrible service... one of guy there started to be rude just because we didn't understand him when he asked about which kind of tortilla we wanted....Tacos are good I mean like real Mexican ones but not so spacial for wait 30 min for your food and horrible costumer service.

Had a carne asada taco on a corn tortilla and it was up there with the best - I am originally from Texas.  Is New York City putting Houston to shame?   If you are on the fence just try one and then get ready to get back in line and buy 3 more, which is what happened to my group.   When you see a 4.5 star average and a $ price in NY that is special.  Take the money you saved and grab a cab and skip the subway for a change:)
These are legit tacos!  Adobado/al pastor are amazing!  Just like in Mexico on el trompo.
Best taco I ever had in new York. The food was so tasty , juicy and heavenly taste. Worth for what you pay.
$3.50 for a taco. Great green sauce. Not big, but enough meat. Can probably be full after 4-5. Definitely get the corn tortilla, not the flour. Sub par but serviceable Horchata. No seating.

Delish! Dropped in while at Chelsea Market with the hopes of finding something to hold me over until I got home - got the carne asada corn taco. Made fresh in front of you with tortillas fresh off the grill. Needless to say I went for one then had to get back in line for a second. Some of the best tacos on this side of the country.

There was some pretty extreme hangriness at play when we descended on this slick taco operation. This may or may not have influenced the comment "this is the best taco of my life" from my companion but either way, pretty damn good tacos.
Best tacos ever!!!! this is the only place that you can eat authentic mexican tacos.
SLAMMING! Pretty much the best tacos in the city. I don't think that there's another level of better taco to be had. And Its just a taco stand in the mall.

Really good tacos.  Make sure you get the corn tortillas. Homemade corn tortillas? Seriously? can you get better than homemade?!  I had one chicken and one steak.  The downside- no seating. It's located in Chelsea market so what can you expect, I know, but still it's hard to hold onto your tiny plate and a glass coke and eat.  Definitely worth a visit.  I'm Mexican-- this is authentic.

I usually don't leave reviews but this place was too good NOT to leave one! I ordered the carne asada tacos with everything and the especial, a deep fried quesadilla with meat and toppings added in! Both were AMAZING! I thought we had really good Mexican food here in Cali but I honestly want to make the trip back to New York sooner just so I can eat here! It was that good!

The reviews are on point. These are the best tacos I've had since Texas. The thing that makes it superb for me is the spicy chili paste...be careful. All of the ingredients are fresh and extremely tasty. California Baja has nothing on NYC.

Always spot-on, this is my go-to taco place in the city. I usually go for two tacos and a quesadilla. Tender, juicy meat; warm, soft corn tortilla; spicy, soul-renewing dried pepper (optional). I'd especially recommend the adobada. Eat at the counter if there's space, or try to find a table in the Market. Enjoy!

Adobada! yes please! give me 3! So happy I finally found a great taco place in Nyc. The tacos are soooo tasty, full of flavor, and just delicious! Make sure to get the Adobada on corn tortilla... the cactus taco was ok but definitely prefer meat.

Let me say that this are THE BEST TACOS I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.I know, best tacos in NYC? is that posible? well, YES.This place is... I dont even have any words to describe it.Ambience and service dont even matter, we're talking about a spot in the Chelsea Market where you have to wait a line for your taco, but people who work there are just in great mood. maybe because i speak spanish and i felt so at home talking to this geniouses.lets talk about FOOD:- FRIED CHICKEN QUESADILLAS IN A CORN TORTILLA. this is the most important thing in here. you MUST try this.- the other tacos are amazing, just try everything you can. there is no downfall. its all PERFECTION.go ahead, wait in the line, eat wherever u find a spot, but go for it!!! NO REGRETS.
The best taco place in the city! Every time I am around the area I stop in an grab three or four to go.

The tacos are so authentic I forget I'm in NYC and revel in being South of the border on vacation .  I usually get chicken tacos with their home made medium salsa but the quesadillas are equally sublime.

If you're looking for quality tacos in NYC, look no where else! This place has the best tasting tacos in all of NYC. I've lived in LA for a few years where quality tacos are easy to find and after moving to NY I realized that NY doesn't know what a quality taco is! That is of course until, Los Tacos No. 1 opened. The owners are from SD (San Diego) so, they understand quality ingredients to make an amazing taco! They even make their own tortillas (the way it should be). The menu is simple and everything tastes great. I hope that one day they will add carne asada fries and tortas to their menu. Until then, I will be enjoying the tacos! Thanks for finally introducing New Yorkers to what a taco should taste like! The best!

Wow. Came to NYC for the first time from Los Angeles and was just browsing looking for maybe a burger or pizza and read so many great reviews that we just had to check it out. And OMG-are we glad we did! Ordered 4 tacos and chips and guac and had to go back at 8:50 to order three more tacos, chips and guac AND a quesadilla. We were only bummed that they closed at 9 and we couldn't order more! Best tacos ever and we are taco snobs! Also guac is amazing! Freshly made corn tortillas are perfect! Caution though, the salsa is VERY spicy!!!! Writing this almost 6 hours after eating there and we keep saying we want to go to breakfast. Just delicious!

Omg! Best tacos I've ever had in my life. Words can't describe these tacos. And they're gluten friendly.. Got the corn tacos chicken and steak today. Going back again tomorrow for chicken and pork tacos. I think they melt the cheese on top of the corn tortilla which surprisingly keeps the taco together. They hide a smidgen of guacamole in there so it doesn't overwhelm the taco. There's an unlimited pico de gallo/salsas station. Located in an unassuming corner of Chelsea market. Don't count on getting a seat nearby though. So stock up and head over to the highline. You'll achieve a little piece of moksha on an urban rooftop garden under a pergola intaking the skyline and enjoying a taco.

If you want Mexican tacos, this is the place! I never thought I would find such perfect tacos inside Chelsea Market. The whole "taco street stand" concept is great, it's like an authentic taco joint from Mexico City. Steak, pastor, everything is delicious and portions are big enough (three tacos will be a perfect lunch). This place is a must if you feel nostalgic and you are in the need for real tacos!
Just go!  You wont be disappointed.  Skip the cactus taco.

Very confused about the popularity of this place.  The pork in the taco had lots of potential(had some flavor and bits of pineapple) but overall the tacos were overpriced and bland.  I tried one of each meat.  No cheese, sour cream, salsa (although there was a bowl of salsa at the counter but I couldn't put it on since mine were wrapped to go).  Also didn't think the meat was salted enough including the pork.  All in all the lamest food I had all week in NYC.

My friend from San Diego recommended this place to me, saying that it is the closest to authentic Mexican you can get in this city.  She was right!  I had the carne asada and pollo asado tacos, and they were delicious!  Juicy meat, well seasoned, and some quality guacamole.  Two is enough to fill you up, and at less than $10 for two tacos and a drink, you can't go wrong!  I will definitely be returning when I need a little taste of home.
Really, these are los tacos number one. The best al pastor-style taco that I have eaten outside of Mexico came from this little joint hidden in Chelsea market.

I ordered a pork taco, cactus taco and guac and chips.the pork taco was very flavorful! I highly recommend and don't forget to put salsa and hot sauce on it. they have medium and spicy hot sauces (be careful, the spicy one is pretty spicy)my first time having cactus taco and as my friend says it tastes like a slippery pepper hahha They also have a kick to it as well. I felt like the cactus taco was more soggy because of the cactus. you can never go wrong with guac and chips - an A+! They do serve jamaica, horchata and tamarind drinks - all of which were very delicious! Not much counter space to eat, but Chelsea Market has a ton of tables and chairs so you can find a spot. I'd come back for the pork tacos and drinks!

My goodness is this place good! Anything less than 5 stars is a complete travesty. Honestly, it might be the greatest food establishment on the planet. They take tacos to an out of this world level, and do it without dousing them in salt. Every ingredient is just complete perfection.

We tried the Pollo Asado tacos and quesadilla. First off, the process is a little confusing. You place your order, then move along in the line and give your ticket to the cook. He then prepares the food. We weren't exactly sure how it worked and basically watched the people around us to figure it out. They gave us the food on tiny plates and there is no seating, so we had to get napkins, forks, sauce, and juggle them around Chelsea Market until we found a seat -- not an easy task on a busy day. We finally found a place and bit into the tacos. Wow! They tasted amazing! The only problem is they were messy and we only had these small plates, so we had to basically devour them quickly before the dripped over our clothes. That was the easy part because they tasted amazing. I wish there was some seating, but the food was still worth the ordeal.
Some of the best tacos in New York. Only downsides are the long lines and lack of seating

If we're making a list of the reasons why I cry because I had to leave NYC, this is the one on the top of the list. Try every single taco. Wash it down with horchata. Come back every day  because one day you're not going to live in Manhattan anymore and these tacos will be the only thing you think about for the rest of your life.
Quesadillas were somewhat small, but oh the taste... Skip the usual Coke and try one of the local beverages.
Great tacos!  I had the chicken and cactus and the were both delicious.  Price is great for NYC and would defiantly eat here again.

Hands down, one of the best taco places in NYC. These are authentic, Mexico-city style tacos. I grew up in California and have spent time in Mexico and sadly NYC is limited in its Mexican offerings. My search for a "go to" taco joint is over! The ingredients are fresh, the service is friendly and quick (even if there is a line during busy days they move it along). I love the salsa bar and the sliced cucumbers and radishes that they have on the side. The tortillas are handmade and as fresh as they get. Love this place!

No doubt about it: this place is a winner.  The corn tortillas are home made--and they taste it--and the high-quality cheese is melted onto them.  Add to that their absolutely delicious adobada (marinated pork) and freshly made pico de gallo, and you have the taco of your dreams.  They remind me of the best tacos from San Francisco's Mission district or LA's taco trucks; greater praise than that I cannot muster.

With Los Tacos No. 1 setting up in Chelsea Market, there's about one thing to say on behalf of taco-crazy New Yorkers when it comes to defending their assertions that they now have one of America's best tacos: God help you. West Coasters who haven't even sought out the city's best will likely have too much of a chip on their shoulder to admit it, many so-called East Coast taco experts haven't a leg to stand on to combat the cliché that there are no good New York tacos anyway, and it's going to seem pretty outrageous to declare a place open for less than a year as one that serves one of America's finest, so good luck with all that. But who cares anyway? Texans and Californians be damned, it's true. Los Tacos No. 1 serves a taco so good that you could dare anyone to taste it blindfolded against their supposed classic favorite confident and they'd secretly be worried they'd choose Los Tacos No. 1 instead. And Californians and Texans should have no reason to begrudge them anyway -- it's a collaboration of three close friends from Tijuana, Mexico, and Brawley, Calif., for crying out loud, guys who heard the East Coast plight and wanted to proselytize the West Coast expertise. Forget reason. Let's go to taste. You really can't go wrong whether you go with adobo or pollo, but the winner is the red chile-marinated pork, the adobada. Moist. Salted. Flavorful. Sweet but not cloying. Accoutrements. Proper moisture and accurately delivered tortilla. There are expertly prepared salsas. Dress it yourself. You'll shut up because your mouth will be full and you will be happy. (You shouldn't need to undersell them New Yorkers, but like dealing with that difficult friend, loved one, or sibling, you know well enough that introducing your West Coast friends to Los Tacos No. 1 will mean bumping into them there getting their fix.)Written by The Daily Meal

These are the best authentic Mexican tacos I have ever had. THEY MAKE THE TORTILLAS FRESH RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOU. This makes a huge difference. The adobada (AKA al pastor) and carne asada were both outstanding. I think the cut of beef used for the carne asada was skirt steak, hence the deliciousness. They roast the pork on the trompo (vertical spit) which is not something you see in New York City. When I saw the trompo it was a good sign.I lived in Houston for a while and tried a lot of the "best of" places in Houston, Austin, Dallas. My previous favorite was "Tacos La Banqueta Puro DF" in Dallas, and I think this place edges out La Banqueta slightly. This place blows Tehuitzingo (47th St and 10th Ave) out of the water.
